loans.name: Thlai

texts.en:
A mother in her late forties and a villager from Banteay Mean Chey province, Thlai is married and blessed with five children. Currently, only two children are in school. To struggle for a living, she farms rice on a one and a half hectare area and ships water for resale. This is the business that she has done for 20 years. 

Thlai is a new client for VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a new loan to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who is pursuing her bachelor degree specializing in accounting. She hopes that she can help fulfill her daughter's dream of finishing her bachelor degree and getting a good job.

loans.use: To pay tuition fee for her daughter

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Rober es estudiante de Administración Bancaria en un Instituto local
Rober tiene 20 años, eligió esta carrera porque en el futuro quiere desempeñarse como gerente o administrador de alguna entidad de prestigio. Rober está cursando el segundo año de su carrera, diariamente le dedica a sus estudios 6 horas, en sus ratos libres esta laborando como cajero en una entidad privada. Rober solicito este préstamo para  poder pagar las mensualidades de este ciclo y así poder continuar con sus sueños, está feliz de poder acceder a este crédito que le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Rober quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA que confían en jóvenes como él.
texts.en:
Rober is a student of bank administration at a local institute. Rober is 20 years old. He chose this major because in the future he wants to work as manager or administrator of some prestigious organization. Rober is in the second year of his major. Every day he dedicates six hours to his studies. In his free time he works as a cashier in a private organization.

Rober requested this loan to be able to pay the monthly expenses of this cycle and therefore be able to continue with his dream. He is happy to be able to access this loan, which will permit him to have better opportunities in life.

Rober wants to thank the Kiva investors who put their trust in young people like him.

loans.use: to pay the monthly expenses of a cycle.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
Sunilda es de la ciudad de Villarrica, comenta que empezó trabajando en casa de un hermano con la ayuda de él y sus padres.
Dice que esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería para tener un futuro mejor y ayudar a sus padres y con el tiempo quiero abrir para su propia farmacia y trabajar también en su profesión, quiere poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y también de las cuotas de universidad, que le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
Sunilda's from the city of Villarrica.  She says she started working in the home of one of her brothers, with his and her parents' help.

She's studying nursing so she'll have a better future and help her parents.  In time she wants to open her own pharmacy and also work in the nursing profession so she can help people who need health care.

She's requesting this loan to be able to invest in paying the tuition for her classes and her university fees.  She's grateful for this opportunity, which will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Los Tajibos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS TAJIBOS  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Aida en la foto (parada primera desde la derecha blusa naranja) tiene 51 años, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, ella  se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos, calzados por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Aida va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y calzados por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra.  Aida va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra.  Aida es una persona  muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.en la fotografía Se adiciono a dos integrantes que no se encontraban en la foto grupal.
texts.en:
The "Los Tajibos" Entrepreneurial Bank is made up of nine members, seven of whom are women and two men. The bank's president is Aida, situated on the right hand side in the orange blouse. She is 51 years old and has three grown children. She makes a living selling cosmetics and footwear by catalog, which she carries out by visiting nearby homes and offices in the city of Santa Cruz. 

This loan is her first with the institution. She will use it to buy cosmetics and footwear at wholesale and discount prices in order to offer her customers a variety of products and increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Aida will use her earnings to continue buying a variety of beauty products. She is a very hard working person and is pleased with the opportunity brought forth to her and her group members because some of them must care for their families on their own. Two of the borrowers have been added to the photo that were not in the group photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Maryorie Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryorie, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años. El marido es artesano.
  
Doña Maryorie realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su  esposo en su negocio el cual tiene una pequeña fábrica en el cual elaboran botones hechos con tagua. Ella por su parte también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual sale dos o tres días por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días.  Gracias a sus ganancias su situación económica y familiar está mejorando.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar tagua y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace casi 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que viven con familiares.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized arts and crafts.  The majority of the people here earn a living making tagua nut buttons, as artisans, and in commerce in general.

Maryorie, 23, lives here.  She's in a common-law relationship and has two children, ages 4 and 2.  Her husband is an artisan.

Maryorie is requesting the loan to help her husband in his business.  He has a small factory where he makes buttons of tagua nuts.  She also works as a merchant.  She sells all types of clothing, going out two or three days a week to sell her products.  She leaves them on credit and collects every week.  Thanks to her earnings her finances and her family situation are improving.

She's going to use this loan to buy tagua nuts and all types of clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help with loans.

Her dream is to have her own house, because she lives with relatives.

loans.use: to buy clothing and tagua nuts

loans.name: Sida's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Sida is 29 years old and the widowed mother of one little kid. She struggles to make a living as a single mother from her paddy rice cropping business, which has returned her about 21,000 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Sida’s group consisting of two female borrowers who seek the same loan amount of 1,200,000 KHR. For Sida, she has fully repaid her past loan wisely to uplift better than before. Sida, who is the leader, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing her farmland. She hopes to boost her crop on time and get a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is 36 years old. She lives in the northern part of Tajikistan with her parents. She is not married and has no children. She has a high degree. She is a feed keeper for her parents. 

Gulchehra began her own animal husbandry business 13 years ago. She fattens cattle and sells them at the local market. She has own customers at the local market. 

She wants to develop the business, but she does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase the number of cattle and from the related profit, improve her living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is married with two children. He has been farming rice for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs necessary during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs necessary during rice production

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto, es una persona reconocida en la comunidad por su actividad,  está casado y vive actualmente con sus padres y tres hijos. El, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, siembra de granos básicos, asimismo posee un molino y tienda, es un negocio que lo tomo por iniciativa propia y para brindar servicio a la comunidad, lo realiza desde hace 3 años consecutivos y uno de los riesgos seria la competencia. 
El crédito que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas para la siembra de 8 tareas de maíz. Esta inversión le ayudara a obtener una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas, uno de los problemas seria la inestabilidad del invierno que afecta la producción.
El sueño del Sr. Fausto es generar más ganancias económicas en el negocio, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fausto, a person known in his community for his work, is married and currently lives with his parents and three children. He is a farmer and plants basic grains. He also has a mill and a store that he started on his own initiative in order to offer a service to the community. He has done it for three consecutive years. One of the challenges to his business would be competition. 

The loan he is requesting would allow him to purchase necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide to plant 8 plots of corn. This investment will help him have an abundant harvest free from pests. One of his challenges would be the instability of the winter affecting production. 

Fausto’s dream is to earn more income in his business and improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide

loans.name: San Juan De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JUAN DE ESCOMA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nativa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nativa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de enaguas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y en la actualidad tiene un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “San Juan de Escoma” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Nativa is the treasurer.  The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied, among them are:  selling clothing, a neighborhood store, selling fish and selling fruit.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small group of micro-entrepreneurs of which Nativa is a member.  She says that this is the first time that she is a member of Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of an organizer of the institution who visited her at home.  At present she has a business sewing and selling traditional skirts.  She makes known that she learned this business on her own initiative and at present she has an independent business.
 
The loan that she will take out now is for the increase of capital to buy fabric that she will acquire from the stores of the city of El Alto and later she will sell in her sales space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible as she is married and has two children. 

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan meetings.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Zaida Lucia

texts.es:
Zaida tiene 28  años de edad, es casada, tiene  un  hijo,  convive con su esposo e hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.

Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.Como actividad adicional se dedica a la  venta de productos Yambal y ropa por catalogo en cantidades bajas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos una bomba de fumigar.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  mejorar la produccion  y comprar a menor precio los insumos. 

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana.   Su sueño es tener una casa propia. 

Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta vender a los vecinos los productos de yambal y ropa.
texts.en:
Zaida is 28 years old, married and has one child. She lives with her husband and child in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios. 

The members of the "VRC Avanza" communal bank live in the Recinto Aquas Frias area where they were raised. Most of them make a living in agriculture or in livestock. Additionally, Zaida sells Yanbal products and clothing through a catalog in small quantities. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, and fumigation equipment. With the help of this loan she can improve her production and buy the supplies at a low price. She buys her supplies in Ventanas on a weekly basis. 

Her dream is to own her own house. Her challenge is her competition. She enjoys selling Yanbal products and clothing to her neighbors in her free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and fumigation equipment

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward de 32 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada y vive en la casa de su suegra en compañía de su pareja y sus 2 hijos. Edward se dedica a dar el servicio de mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración, para eso ha instalando un pequeño taller en la casa de sus padres en donde tiene los implementos necesarios para desarrollar su labor. Se inició con pocos pedidos y actualmente la demanda de su trabajo se ha incrementado. Empezó a ejercer esta actividad hace 4 años con la ayuda de su padre. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite mantener su tiempo ocupado en un trabajo que le genera el ingreso económico que necesita para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de equipar su taller con mejores implementos y consolidar un local de atención más amplio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contento por saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser un socio puntual y responsable.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará motores de refrigeración y balones de gas pequeños para equipar su taller y continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edward, 32, is a hard-working entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead.  He is married and lives in his mother-in-law's home with his wife and two children.  Edward runs a refrigeration maintenance service and has a small workshop set up in his parent's house where he has the necessary tools to do his work.  He began his business with only a few orders but the demand has increased since then.

He began his business four years ago to help his father.  He enjoys what he does because it keeps him busy and generates enough income to cover household expenses.  His plans are to equip the shop with better tools so he can broaden his customer service.  

On this occasion, he is requesting 1,000 PEN.  He is very happy knowing that there are people backing him economically so he can continue his work.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.

He will use the loan to buy refrigerator motors and small gas cylinders for his workshop so he can continue with his job.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator motors and small gas cylinders.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo, a 49-year-old married father of a son and two daughters, is a constructor at the local power station earning a monthly income. His wife owns a stall at the local open market, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. Rezo and his son sometimes help her in the running the business. Rezo’s elder daughter is a university entrant, and the younger goes to the public school. The family lives in a rented house in Akhalkalaki district.

With this start-up loan, Rezo plans to purchase a van to start a transportation business. He will carry and transport various items depending on the needs and requests of his customers. He will also use his van to make fruit and vegetable deliveries. He thinks that the business will be profitable and the family will have a stable income, enabling them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.

With the support of the start-up program, Rezo will get an opportunity to tackle their financial difficulties and save for the purchase of their own house.

loans.use: to purchase a van for starting a transportation business

loans.name: Super Poderosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Super Poderosa  nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Karina, presidenta del grupo tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella se dedica a las ventas de variados productos, y hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de  azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, lo que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas y luchar de esa manera.
texts.en: The "Super Poderosa" communal bank was created by a group of women working in the city of San Lorenzo. The members of the communal bank have the goal of seeing each member grow in both their person and their business. Karina, the President of the group, is 36 years old. She is a very enterprising woman and very capable of leading a large group like this one. Through all their loans she has demonstrated a will to overcome. She sells a variety of products and has asked for this loan in order to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, breads, rice, drinks, oil and flour. This will allow her to continue her sales and to continue fighting.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, breads, rice, drinks, oil and flour.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es una persona con grandes aspiraciones, que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que está estudiando, para el día de mañana ser un gran profesional.
El está estudiando la carrera de medicina y su principal sueño es poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud. El se destaca por el gran esfuerzo que está poniendo, ya que estudia mucho y se sacrifica.
Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas y clases de universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Juan is a person with great ambitions, who wants to get ahead. So he is studying so that he can be a great professional in the future. He is studying medicine. His main goal is to be able to help those who are in need of medical attention. He stands out with his great effort as he studies hard and sacrifices. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his University tuition and fees, so he can continue to study. And approach his goal. He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving as the loan will be of great use.

loans.use: to pay for his University courses and fees.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ls socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y venta de queso,la socia a los ganados los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tenr un local donde pueda vender los quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member continues in the business of cattle farming and in the sale of cheese. The member fattens the cattle and sells them at different fairs. The member works from 8:00a.m to 5:00 p.m. She has been doing this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell cheese. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle.

The partner is happy for the loan and she promises to fulfill the monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Feruze

texts.en:
Feruze is an Egyptian Albanian who was widowed very long ago when her two children were still babies. Just like other members of her ethnic minority, she moved to the rural area after the collapse of the previous regime. 

“It has been a blessing since then. Relocation made it possible for me to raise the children, when I thought that there was no way that I could make it alone. Village was a heaven for me and my children; we had food to eat and fresh air to breathe and security also. Finally, my kids could play outside and I could work in the fields and look after animals to feed us and generate an income also. But, I would not be able to do all these, without the help from VisionFund Albania since its opening in 2001. This loan I am requesting now will be my seventh one from the same institution,” said Feruze.

Feruze wants to buy a dairy cow to generate a little income because the pension she makes is only USD 50 per month.

loans.use: to buy a cow that will enable her, as a retiree, to make a little income by selling the milk.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, su esposo de 49 años de edad y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 19 y 25 años, todos trabajan juntos. Ella, se dedica a la compra de ganado para destazar las reces y luego vender la carne, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días y lo desempeña desde hace más de 20 años, este oficio se lo han enseñado a sus hijos para que lo puedan realizar. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar una vaca y un chivo, asimismo para pagar el destazo. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes.
El sueño de la Sra. María es remodelar su casa, ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
María lives with her family, including her husband, 49, and their two children, ages 19 and 25.  They all work together.  María buys cattle to butcher and sell the meat.  She works every day and has done so for more than 20 years.  She has her children the business.  

The loan María is seeking will allow her to buy a cow and a young goat and to pay for butchering.  The investment will help strengthen her business and satisfy clients.  

María's dreams include remodeling her house, offering a better quality of life to her family, and having her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a young goat and pay for butchering.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste, a 24-year-old single man planning to get married, has been rice farming for the past five years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs involved in rice production. He will use his profits to help improve the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en:
Narcisse is 47 years old. He is a father of four children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 28 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Beatrice est trésorière d’une association d’affaire  « Naboti»,  entrepreneur expérimentée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses produits dans un petit dépôt et parfois  à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de base de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de manioc, bananes plantains,  pommes de terre, courges, etc.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Beatrice is the treasurer of the Naboti business group. She is an experienced businesswoman and mother to six children who all go to school. 

Beatrice sells food products. She conducts her sales from a small warehouse, sometimes from her home. She started this activity with the basic loan granted by the Hekima MFI about two years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy three sacks of cassava and some plantain bananas, potatoes, zucchinis, etc. 

Her goals are to expand her business, to feed and educate her children, and to buy a house. 

Beatrice would like to thank the Hekima MFI for supporting small business owners through microfinance.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of cassava, 4 bunches of plantain bananas, 3 sacks of potatoes, some zucchinis, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Yamileth es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 37 años, casada, madre de dos hijos. De oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y es dueña de una mini pulpería. Ella empezó  vendiendo tortillas en su casa. Con las ganancias de la venta de tortilla estableció su mini pulpería a los 33 años de edad. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo e hijo, quienes le ayudan económicamente. Sus expectativas es surtir su negocio para así satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos. Solicita este crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico,  y jabón. Su  plan próximo es mejorar la infraestructura  de su casa. su meta futuro es convertir su mini pulpería en una pulpería. El crédito le ayudara mucho ya que obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yamileth is from the city of Boaco. She is 37, married and the mother of two children. Yamileth is in the sales trade and works selling tortillas and is the owner of a mini store. She started selling tortillas in her house. With the proceeds of the tortilla sales, she opened her mini store at the age of 33. She has the help of her husband and son, who she supports economically.

She expects to supply her business in order to satisfy the need of her customers and obtain better income. She is applying for this loan to buy: rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper and soap. Her next plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house. Her future goal is to convert her mini store into a larger one. The loan will help her a lot given that she will obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy: rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper and soap.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 38 years old. He is a father of four children. He has been a rice farmer for ten years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 35 years old. He is single and has been a rice farmer for the past fifteen years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for use during rice production

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
Санобар жизнерадостная и  заботливая мать троих детей.   Её муж раньше работал на заводе, но его заработной платы  не хватило на жизнь.  Чтобы прокормить семью и обеспечить будущее своих детей муж Санобар  уехал на заработки в Российскую федерацию. Он каждый месяц регулярно высылает деньги семье.
Сама  Санобар дома занимается откормом скота, ей помогает старший сын.  С марта по  ноябрь скот пасется на пастбище в горах,   жители села поочередно смотрят за скотом. Этот бизнес дает Санобар хорошую прибыль.  Она старается развивать свой бизнес и постепенно расширяет его.  
 Санобар планирует осенью женить сына, так как её муж приедет в октябре.   На сумму кредита которую она  хочет получить в Арванде Санобар планирует купить  несколько голов скота.  Она очень надеется на поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Sanobar is the vivacious and attentive mother of three children.  Her husband used to work in a factory but he didn't make enough for the family to live on, so in order to feed the family and secure their children's future, he went to work in the Russian Federation.  He sends money on a regular, monthly basis.  

Sanobar, by herself at home, earns a living fattening up cattle.  Her eldest son helps her out.  The cattle graze in mountain pastures from March to November.  The villagers take turns keeping an eye on them.  The business provides Sanobar with a nice profit.  She is trying to develop it and it is growing gradually.  

Sanobar plans to marry off her son in the fall, so her husband is coming home in October.  With the loan she wants to take out with Arvand, Sanobar plans to buy a few head of cattle.  She is really holding out hope for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Houédoté Émile

texts.fr: Houédoté Émile âgé de 36 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Houédoté Émile est marié à Augustine. Le couple a un enfant à sa charge. Houédoté Émile vit ensemble avec sa femme et son enfant. Les différentes charges du ménage sont assurées par le couple.  Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille Houédoté Émile vend depuis sept ans des fils de rebobinages dans sa région. En dehors de son activité, Houédoté Émile achète des motos qu'il revend. Houédoté Émile s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son de fonds roulement et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houédoté Émile sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Houédoté Émile, age 36, has received minimal schooling. He is married to Augustine, and the couple have one dependent child. Houédoté Émile lives with his wife and child, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Seven years ago, Houédoté Émile started to sell winding wire locally to support his family. In addition, he also buys and sells motorcycle. 

Houédoté Émile buys his stock at a market in Bénin. He is seeking a first loan from ALIDé to bolster his working capital and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy winding wire to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 63 years old. He is a father of seven children. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

Alexandre is 36 years old. He is married with four children.

For the past ten years, he has been a rice farmer.

With the requested loan proceeds, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to pay labor costs. With the profits he expects to generate from his business as a result of the loan, he plans on improving his family's standard of living.

As of 209, the agriculture sector accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and to cover labor costs

For the past fifteen years, he has been a rice farmer.

With the requested loan proceeds, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. With the profits he expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, he plans on improving his family's standard of living.

Claver is 59 years old. He is married and has ten children, all of whom attend school.

For the past 30 years, he has been a rice farmer.

With the requested loan proceeds, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. With the profits he expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, he plans on improving his family's standard of living.

As of 2009, the agriculture sector accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 37 years old. She is married and lives in the Ozurgeti district with her husband and their young child.

The family runs a small-scale agricultural business. Specifically, they have a garden where they grow citrus fruits and nuts. Seasonally, the family sells their harvest at the local open market, but otherwise they have no monthly income and generally live in poverty.

Ekaterine has made multiple loan requests, without success, from the local financial institutions in order to start up a trading business. Her loan requests were rejected each time due to her low income. Ekaterine’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with lenient conditions. Borrowers in the program are vulnerable poor people who do not have easy access to credit products because they are regarded as "high-risk borrowers" due to their low incomes.

With the requested loan proceeds, Ekaterine would like to purchase basic groceries and to set up a store. She plans to gradually increase her trading business over time. She feels that this new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, would significantly increase her family's income. Ekaterine will work hard and she is confident that she will be able to improve her family's living conditions with your help. With this loan, she feels that her family will generate enough income to access regular credit products in the country’s capital market in the event that they need such funds.

loans.use: to set up a grocery store by purchasing basic groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 37 years old. He is the father of three children.

To earn a living, he works as a rice farmer.

With the requested loan proceeds, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. With the profits he expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, he plans on improving his family's standard of living.

As of 2009, the agriculture sector accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Ama is married and has five children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fried fish. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fried fish.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, manifiesta que en este momento se encuentra con la necesidad de surtir su negocio y no cuenta con el recurso necesario e importante para poderlo hacer como lo es el dinero, por lo que nuevamente se acerca a la Institucion, para solicitar un crédito y de esa manera poder realizar la compra de: carne de res, pollo, refresco, condimentos y cereales; y así poder obtener ingresos para ella y su familia.
María, nos cuenta que con el crédito que anteriormente se le otorgo logro generar ganancias y así fue como pudo cancelar los créditos y realizar algunos gastos del hogar que eran necesarios.
texts.en:
Maria finds herself in the need of stocking her business and she does not have the necessary financial resources to do so. This is why she is again applying for a loan at this microfinance insitution so that she can buy beef, chicken, soft drinks, condiments, and cereals. That way, she can generate an income for herself and her family. 

Maria says that with the previous loan she was able to make a profit and use it to pay back the loan and pay for some necessary household expenses.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, soft drinks, condiments, and cereals

loans.name: Malom Maning Leikai Jlg Group

texts.en:
With no fields where she can plough, no higher education to seek a government job, and the tight financial condition of the family, Kumari is compelled to run a grocery store and manage the family expenses. 

Kumari is pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower member of “Malom Maning Leikai” Group. All the members live in the same region, which is about 40 kms east of the capital state of Imphal. It is one of the state capitals for the Northeastern states in India. The members joined hands and formed the group to stand for one another in times of need, and they still continue the pledge. 


Kumari runs the grocery store in the front yard of her house. Her husband also helps her in the store by running errands for her since he left his driving job. She sells potatoes, onions, edible oil, garlic, etc. She opens the store at the break of the dawn and closes down at late evening. She manages the household chores and also runs the store. 

She usually gets the supplies from the main market and sells them. The store is a success, as she has buyers thronging in round the clock, but she is incapable of supplying the demands. The generated income is used for her children’s educational fees and other household expenses, which generally paralyzes her in refilling her stock for the store. 

With the Kiva loan, Kumari will refill the store and manage some savings. Happy and elated, Kumari shares that she has plans to purchase an auto vehicle in the future. Her husband can drive and run the vehicle for public transportation. The store is the main source of income for the family. 

Kiva and WSDS join hands; supporting the group is a blessing, and the group members will work harder for better performance so that each of them can make a stand financially and morally. Kumari says, “Thank you so much, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are engaged in sand-sieving, weaving, and vegetable-selling businesses.

loans.use: to refill the store by purchasing imported rice, cereal items, edible oil and other commodities; then sell them and earn profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition fees and graduation expenses for her Masters Degree.

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su familia, su esposo de 38 años de edad y sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 6, 8 y 18 años, todos trabajan en el negocio día con día y su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne. La Sra. Sonia se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, lo desempeña desde hace 2 años y lo realiza todos los días, dicha actividad la aprendió de  una amiga y gracias a Dios ha sido satisfactorio el negocio. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería de ropa, tales como: faldas, camisas, blusas, chores, pantalones y ropa para niños.  Esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su actividad  y brindarles mejor satisfacción a los clientes.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y culminen la universidad; asimismo su aspiración es que su negocio sea rentable y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her family: her husband, who is 38 years old, and her children who are ages six, eight, and eighteen. They all work at their business every day and her husband works selling meat. Sonia works selling american clothing, which she has been doing for two years. She works every day and learned the business from a friend. Thankfully, the business has worked out to her satisfaction.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy a variety of clothing merchandise, such as skirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, and children's clothing. This investment will help her strengthen her business and satisfy her customers better.

Her dream is for her children to stay in school and finish university. Her other aspiration is for her business to be profitable and grow financially.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres en casa de ellos, es una persona luchadora y responsable. Actualmente  posee un negocio de venta de comida en la terminal de autobuses cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú como pollos carnes, verduras, frutas, maíz, etc. y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle seguir ayudando a sus padres sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives with her parents in their house.  She’s a hardworking, responsible person.  

She has had a food selling business in the bus terminal near her place of residence for many years.  She has a large regular clientele because she sells her plate of food for a very good price.  

She wants to enlarge the food stand, that is, to buy tables, chairs and more raw materials like chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc. to vary her menu in order to earn a little more income but does not have sufficient income for this investment which is why she’s requesting a loan to buy the aforesaid and thus earn higher profits to continue helping her parents with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc.

loans.name: G.s Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer emprendedora de la zona oriente de Honduras y su fuente principal de ingresos es la venta de abarrotería, tiene 14 años de tener la pulpería y es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Doña Martha sus  clientes son los vecinos de la zona y algunos agricultores, ya que también sale a  vende mercadería en las montañas donde no llegan los proveedores, junto a su esposo han salido adelante y han logrado tener este negocio por tantos años.
Doña Martha su negocio le es de mucha ayuda y le es una bendición porque a través de este le han dado el estudio a sus hijo,  han mejorado su casa y compraron unos cerditos para revenderlos en la comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la comprar de agua, azúcar, café, leche, huevos, manteca, sal, arroz, frijoles, etc. y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña Martha al igual que sus compañeras de grupo está contenta de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Jesus se dedica al comercio y su fuente principal de ingresos es la venta de golosinas los fines de semana  desde hace 7 años.
Doña Marlene se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de lácteos como queso, mantequilla y cuajada desde hace 3 años.
 

Danlí, Honduras – Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising woman from the east of Honduras.  Her main source of income is selling groceries; she’s had a grocery store for 14 years that’s her main source of income.

Martha’s customers are local neighbors and some farmers because she also goes out to sell her merchandise in the mountains where suppliers don’t go.  She and her husband have gotten ahead and have succeeded in staying in business for so many years.

Martha’s business is of great help to her because it’s a blessing; through it she’s been able to provide schooling for her children, the house has been improved and they’ve purchased some piglets to resell in the community.  

She’s requesting the loan to buy water, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, shortening, salt, rice, beans, etc. to continue improving her business.  Martha, as well as her fellow members, is happy to work with Prisma.

Jesus works in commerce and her main source of income is selling snacks on the weekend; she’s done this for 7 years.

Marlene works in commerce and her main activity is selling dairy products like cheese, butter and curd; she’s done this for 3 years.


Danlí, Honduras – August, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Maghlaki, West Georgia with his wife, infant daughter and retired grandmother. 

Dima requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The family is involved in a small scale agricultural business. They run a family-owned dairy farm with four milk cows. The family produces cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, they grow nuts and grapes which are used in wine production. 

Dima sells his products seasonally, but the income is not enough to provide the family with adequate living conditions. Dima has requested a loan from Credo to start a poultry business. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with fewer conditions to the country's vulnerable poor for business start-ups and re-start-ups. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of low income, and they often do not have access to credit. 

With the credit, Dima will purchase chickens and place them in a shed located in their yard. He will raise and sell the chickens for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda tiene 52 años de edad y una familia muy numerosa compuesta por 4 hijos de los cuales 2 se dedican al trabajo del campo y los otros 2 están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación en una escuela de la zona. En compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y ella independiente del cultivo elabora tamales y pan de casa para su venta siendo sus clientes los vecinos de su comunidad ya que por medio de esta actividad ella contribuye aún más con los ingresos en el hogar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado pero gracias a sus padres la tierra que trabajan en familia es propia por una herencia por parte de ellos las cuales están ubicadas a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a los cuales se trasladan a pie en ocasiones o en vestía.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesario para su cafetal ya que por medio de esto ellos esperan mejorar y al final obtener una excelente cosecha obteniendo resultados positivos y esperados.    

Ella planea ampliar más sus cultivos de café sembrar una mayor y mejor variedad de esa manera ella podrá fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y dejar una tierra propia fértil en la que ellos puedan trabajar y generar sus ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and has a large family, which is comprised of four children.  Two of her children work in the field and the other two of them are in different grades in a primary school in the area.  She and her husband farm together.  Besides her farm work she makes tamales and bread to sell as her customers are her neighbors in her community.  It is through this business activity that she contributes, with the profits, even more to the household.

She attended school up to the fourth grade.  Thanks to her parents, the land that they work as a family is her own.  She inherited it from them, and the land is three kilometers from her house.  They walk there, or sometimes they go by animal.

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies needed for her coffee farm.  With these supplies they hope to improve and to get an excellent harvest at the end.  They hope to get the hoped for positive results. 

She plans to expand her coffee crops and to plant more and a greater variety.  This way she will be able to strengthen her children’s inheritance and leave her land fertile.  She will do this so that they are able to work and generate income for their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies needed for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Santa Maria

texts.es: El señor Santa María, tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en un sector del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. El se dedicaba al comercio de mercadería y hace 15 años decidió por establecer su propio taller de fabricación de muebles de madera como mesas, sillas, ventanas, puertas, contramarcos etc. Ha mantenido varios préstamos con ODEF para inversión en el taller. Actualmente ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo que es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual  va comprar madera, lacas, sellador, lijas, barniz, pegamentos etc. Para la elaboración de muebles. Su plan es seguir trabajando con su negocio para que su familia tenga calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Santa María, is 52 and lives with his wife in a section of the city of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He used to work selling merchandise and decided 15 years ago to set up his own shop to make wooden furniture such as tables, chairs, windows, doors, window and door casing, etc. Mr. Santa María has received several loans from ODEF for investment in his business. He is currently applying for his fourth cycle, a loan of 10,000 lempiras, for the purchase of wood, lacquer, sealant, sandpaper, varnish, glue, and other supplies for making furniture. Mr. Santa María plans to keep working at his business to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as wood, glue, varnish, lacquer, sealant, sandpaper, and other supplies for making furniture.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her kenkey in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling kenkey for six years. 

Abena is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty kenkey. 

In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth lives in Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old and married, with six children. She makes a living by providing motorcycle transportation and rental services to people in her community. Her husband is the the one who operates her motor as driver.  She has been in this business for more than 12 years and earns PHP 11,000 a month from her work.  Lilibeth successfully repaid her previous loan and now she request a smaller amount of 10,000.00 for her needs for the moment is to buy tires for a better services.She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2010 and it helps her a lot to improve her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life she want to provide for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy tires for her motor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, snack foods, coffee, and other items to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, snack foods, and coffee.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, snack foods, coffee, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala, a rural villager from Phnom Penh's Dongkor district, is 48 years old. 

She has earned a living through working as a paid worker in garment factory in a local area. She has been in this job for five years. The current business earns her about US $9 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Mala has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which helped her better support her family with enough food. 

Now she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter's education. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Lenchonghoi Group

texts.en:
26-year-old unmarried Linroukim is the featured borrower member for Lenchonghoi group. Graduated from a government college and possessed a caring and strong personality, sincerity in work and  great determination is Linroukim’s character. She is on the extreme left in the picture with her hand raised. All eight members belongs to a tribal community and live in a village which is about 40 kms away from the state capital of Imphal, which is one of the North-Eastern state capital in India. As an eldest daughter in the family, she takes on the role with passion and has shown immense sincerity in whatever she does for the family and for herself.

Linroukim runs a general store in the village. The store is located at the other end of the village, on the closer side of the town market. The town market is where people from all neighbouring villages have stores and run their businesses. She sells imported rice, salt, chillies, sugar, milk, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, different items of cereals, detergent soap, detergent powder, hair oil, sachets of shampoo, local delicacies, etc. She is in charge of the store only in the morning and in the afternoon as she teaches in primary private school during the daytime. Her mother usually replaces her in daytime and she closes the accounts at the end of the day. 

Linroukim's father’s income is insufficient to support the family with her three younger siblings in different schools. She initiated all possible ways to share her father’s burden and started earning by opening a general store besides teaching in a school. On restricted holidays she usually gets the supplies from the town market and sells them in the village. The generated income is not enough to refill the stocks on a regular basis as her father’s income in unreliable and irregular. Most of the expenditure is borne by her to fulfill the family's needs.

She wants a loan from Kiva to purchase more supplies for the store. She will buy all the essential goods like rice, edible oil, wheat by the bag, flour by the bag, soaps, shampoos etc. Expansion of the store is the vital plan as she wishes to continue the general store even after she is married. Another future plan she has with her family is to re-construct their house; the leaking roof during rainy season and the dilapidated condition of the roof and mud walls needs to change. If their plans are successful then they will build the house very soon. 

Linroukim thanks Kiva and WSDS for helping her achieve some portion of her plan and which will eventually become the platform to start off. She says "thank you so much, Kiva”. She also shares that she will repay the loan on time without fail and will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like rice, soap, cereals, etc for the general store to earn more profit.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is made up of five women who live in the area around the city of Accra. This city is a very busy one in terms of business for both locals and foreigners alike. All of the members  of this group are friendly and helpful and they all strive for a better economic stability for their homes and families so they can make progress in life.

Sarah has been one of the members of this group from 2010 till now. She lives in the center of the city Accra called Dansoman and she likes the group because it is supportive. She is 34 years old, separated and has two children from her marriage who are working and help her out financially. She does not have her own house so lives in a rented place.

Sarah has been earning a living for the last seven years selling mobile phone SIM vouchers of different networks and slippers. She sells her products on a pavement in the city, working from one Sunday to the next without a fixed timetable. 

She will use the loan amount of GHS 2200 to buy phone vouchers and slippers and sell them to customers.

Sarah, together with her friends who are selling African wax-print, 'kenkey' (corn paste) and fish, need GHS 4300 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy phone vouchers and slippers for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. 

Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. 

Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her kenkey. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs, due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en: Teodorico is a new member of PMPC. He is 47 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City, with his daughter Elsie. Teodorico has a restaurant. He has this business for six years. He requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients and inventories for his restaurant. In the future, Teodorico hopes to improve his living conditions to sustain his financial status. He also hopes to improve his restaurant to have another branch.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and inventories for his restaurant

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen was born and he still lives in the village of Aralez which is in Ararat region. He is married and he has a daughter and a son. After getting back from the army, Armen studied at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute and after graduating, for many years he worked at the nearby village school as a teacher. Then he was appointed as a director of a secondary school in Vedi city and in 2009 he became the director of Vedi high school. 

During these years Armen worked very hard and finally he has built a small house for his family but now, since the winter months are not very far, he is concerned how he can heat his house.

Armen is asking for a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to install a heating system in his newly-built house.

loans.use: to install a heating system in his house

loans.name: Mkono Mkononi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndalemwa est présidente d’une association d’affaire  « Mkono mkononi»,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 12 enfants dont 5 étudient. Son conjoint est un Maître maçon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse des articles divers. Elle est propriétaire d’un petit kiosque (boutique) installé  à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son conjoint, il y a environ 14 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les articles divers (carton de savons, cartons de bonbons, biscuits, 10 pièces de torches, piles, lotion, allumettes, savons Omo, etc.).  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Ndalemwa, is the president of a business association called "Mkono Mkononi". An experienced entrepreneur, she is 45 years old and the mother of twelve children, of whom five are students. Her husband is a master builder-mason. This client sells a variety of goods. She owns a small kiosk (store) set up in her home. She started her business with her own funds from her husband about fourteen years ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase various goods (boxes of soap, boxes of candy, cookies, 10 flashlights, batteries, lotion, matches, Omo detergents, etc.) Thus, she would like to grow her enterprise and to provide schooling and food for her children, as well as to buy a house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase various goods (soap, candy, cookies, flashlights, batteries, lotion, matches, Omo detergent, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 40 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She has four children, three of whom rely on her, as two of them are in school and the remaining one is still a small child. Nowadays, she has two types of crops, rice and cassava, as the main income source for her family. She earns about 37,500 Cambodian Riel (KHR) per day from this business, which she has been engaged in for 20 years. 

Srey is not new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She utilized her first loan wisely to support her business and it has returned her a decent income to improve her living, keep her kids in school, and set aside some money for future needs.  With a new loan, she leads a group of four female borrowers. She is seeking for 1,200,000KHR while her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. Srey will spend her loan portion to buy potash and pay for transplanting fees. She hopes to grow her crops well and make a good income so  she can buy pigs to raise for extra income.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, a rural villager from Kampong Cham province's Srey Sonthor district, is 51 years old. She has earned a living through planting mango and selling fruits for 30 years. Her husband earns additional income by buying and selling cows. Sinat and her husband are able to save up to 10,000KHR per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the second-cycle loan for Sinat with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter’s education, specializing in Accounting. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to obtain a higher educational background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter’s education.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells 'saabo' in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. As a widow with four children, Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize to make into 'saabo', which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize to make into 'saabo'

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough, wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Esi is married and has four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ekua sells saabo and watermelon in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a mason and, together, they have three children. 

Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of saabo and watermelon, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of saabo and watermelon.

loans.name: Asevi's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Asevi (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28 ans. Asevi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Asevi est mariée un boucher nommé Karim. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Asevi vit avec son mari et ces enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Asevi vend des sacs de charbon de bois et des ustensiles de cuisine à son domicile et par la méthode distribution depuis quinze ans. Asevi s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et renforcer son activité, Asevi s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Asevi (with her hand raised in the photo), is 28 years old. She did not attend school. She is married to a butcher named Karim. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Asevi lives with her husband and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Asevi has been selling bags of charcoal and kitchen utensils out of her home and by the distribution method for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. To satisfy customer demand and to bolster her business, Asevi joined with the other members of her group to request an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Hohoutou Pierrette

texts.fr: Hohoutou Pierrette âgée de 23 ans est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de François. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Hohoutou Pierrette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Hohoutou Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ces enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont assurées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Hohoutou Pierrette vend du maïs, du haricot et divers produits(sucre, lait, savon etc.) à son domicile depuis cinq ans. Hohoutou Pierrette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre la demande de sa clientèle, Hohoutou Pierrette sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Hohoutou Pierrette, aged 23, is married to a farmer named François. The couple have five children, all in school and in their care. Hohoutou Pierrette did not attend school. She lives together with her husband and children. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. For this reason, she has been selling corn, beans, and a variety of products (sugar, milk, soap, etc.) out of her house for five years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of increasing her working capital and responding better to her customers, Hohoutou Pierrette is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans to sell

loans.name: Rosseld

texts.es:
El socio Rosseld tiene 20 años  de edad y es soltero,el socio continua dedicandose a trabajar  en un taller de mecanica,el socio lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el arregla carros y motos,el socio desea continuar trabajando para de esta forma segrui adelante cada dia.

El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas para su trabajo como martillos.pegamentos entre otros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosseld is 20 years old, single, and is still making a living working in an auto shop. He has been doing this work for years and it is going well for him thanks to the determination he puts into each day at his business. 

He fixes cars and motorcycles. He wishes to continue working so that he is able to continue getting ahead every day. He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work, such as hammers, glue, and more. He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: buy things for his work, such as hammers, glue, and more

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is 33 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is with her family. Carol has an Internet shop. She has had this business for almost two years. She requested a loan to purchase four computer units to earn additional income. Carol had been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions to sustain the financial status of their needs and to also improve her internet shop.

loans.use: to purchase four computer units

loans.name: Jovita
