texts.en: Jovita is married with 10 children. She is 63 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Philippines. She operates her little "sari-sari" (variety) in their place. She seeks from PMPC additional capital to purchase additional products and inventories of canned goods, noodles, beverages and others. These will help her increase her sales if she has enough inventories. Jovita wishes to have her business grow into a convenience store someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a businesswoman and has engaged in computer services to earn a living. Marilyn is 54 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City and enjoys being a member of PMPC for 7 years. 

She has requested a loan for 40,000 to purchase 2 computers for her internet cafe business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers for her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children who are going to school, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits for her business to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, two of whom are in school, Jeannilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Jeannilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell for her business.

Jeannilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Racquel is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries for land cultivation.

Racquel has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries for land cultivation

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel and his family live in Kapan city. He lives with his two sons, his wife, and his wife’s retired mother. Samvel has higher education and he has a veterinary specialty. Both of his sons are employed, but they greatly help their father in their farm since Samvel is seriously engaged in beekeeping. 

His beekeeping occupation is in the nearby village of Shgharshik, where he has twenty-five bee families. In a year Samvel manages to sell 200 kilos of perfect and pure honey. Samvel has a lot of loyal customers in Kapan and Kajaran cities, who trust him very much and they are sure that Samvel works honestly.

Samvel asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of fifteen bee families, frames, and also beekeeper coveralls.

loans.use: to purchase fifteen bee families, frames, and beekeeper coveralls.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que hoy en dia se dedica a la agricultura,  este es una oportunidad y recurso económico importante para incrementar las cosechas en la agricultura y en cualquier actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar 6 quintales de abono para abonar 16 tareas de maíz que ya tiene sembrada y asimismo pagara mano de obra para limpiar toda la maleza.
Gracias al crédito anterior aumentaron las cosechas de maíz y frijol, esto le ayudo mucho debido a que no ha necesitado comprar maíz ni frijol sino que por el contrario a vendido para cancelar el crédito. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado porque la inversión le ha generado ganancias para apoyar a su familia, también realizo cambio en su vivienda, agrego una habitación y cocina a su casa.
texts.en:
Ernestina, who makes her living in agriculture, is presented with the need to apply for a new loan. This is an opportunity and important economic resource to increase the agricultural harvests and other activities. This investment will help her to buy 600 pounds of fertilizer to fertilize 16 plots of land measuring 69.03m² each, which she has already planted. It will also pay for labor to clean all of the undergrowth.

Thanks to her previous loan, the corn and bean harvests increased. This helps her a lot given that she has not had to buy corn or beans but instead has been able to sell them to pay back her loan. Her economic conditions have improved because the investment has generated income to support her family. She also made a change to her home, adding a bedroom and kitchen to her house.

loans.use: to buy 600 pounds of fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas (Active Women) Trust Bank is composed of a group of eight women and is aptly named because they are all very active and like to have fun during their monthly meetings. The women enjoy participating in the educational lessons that are part of their microcredit loan from Friendship Bridge.  The educational lesson topics range from business and money management to women's rights and health. Within their Trust Bank, they have created a circle of trust which fosters mutual support between all the women in the circle.

Susana is a member of Mujeres Activas.  She is a very sociable woman who is constantly seeking opportunities to ensure her family’s development. Susana is 45 years old, married to a farmer, and has six children.

Susana owns a business that sells snacks to members of her community.  She sells seven days a week during the afternoons. Susana has a small space in her house that she sells the snacks from but she also sells door-to-door for the convenience of her customers. 

About 10 months ago, Susana and her oldest son opened a new business that makes and sells piñatas and other party items. Although this venture is currently a small-scale operation, they have a plan for growing the party business. Susana is requesting a loan with Friendship Bridge to continue to expand her businesses. She intends to use the funds to buy a wagon for selling snacks door-to-door, add more items to her store and also purchase materials in bulk to make piñatas. 

"It's a blessing to have the support of Friendship Bridge because it benefits not only me, but my whole family. It allows my son and I to invest in the new business. This party business will help him continue his education. My dream is to see him graduate from college - he is already taking steps toward this goal as he is already in ninth grade," explains Susana.

The Mujeres Activas Trust Bank, represented by its board of directors (president, secretary and treasurer), thank their Kiva investors wholeheartedly because their help benefits towns like the one the women live in (Santo Domingo Xenacoj Guatemala), which is in need of development, and without this kind of support, their dreams would not be possible.

loans.use: to buy a wagon for selling snacks and items for her piñata store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells bread, eggs, and tea in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 35 years. As a widow with 5 children, Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions

loans.name: Arya

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Arya is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling 'kenkey' (fermented maize paste), oranges and cassava in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Arya is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Arya wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of 'kenkey', oranges and cassava. In the long term, Arya plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of maize, oranges and cassava.

loans.name: Falome Élisabeth

texts.fr: Falome Élisabeth âgée de 42 ans est mariée à cultivateur du nom de Pierre. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Falome Élisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Falome Élisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille Falome Élisabeth vend torches et des réchauds depuis quatre ans. Falome Élisabeth s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Falome Élisabeth sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Falome Élisabeth, aged 42, is married to a farmer named Pierre. The couple has three children, all enrolled in school and being supported by their parents.   Falome Élisabeth lives with her husband and her children. The couple share in covering the various expenses of the household. 

  Falome Élisabeth did not attend school. To meet the needs of her family, Falome Élisabeth has been selling torches and cook stoves for four years. She buys her goods in Nigeria. Wishing to grow her working capital and satisfy the demand of her customers, she is asking, for the first time, for financial support from  ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy torches and cook stoves.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,al socia en su terreno de cultivo siembra maiz y papa y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas para su terreno de cultivo.


La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Antonia is still farming. She plants corn and potatoes and later sells them at various markets. She works from 7am until 4pm. She has been doing this for 8 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to increase the size of her land. Antonia is requesting this loan to buy seeds to plant in her fields. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her fields.

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Margarette.  She is married and has three children, aged five, six, and fifteen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 1995, Margarette established her textiles business. The business started to help her husband with the children's education. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,086,390 every month from this business. 

Margarette would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional lining material, cotton, and wax. She hopes that this loan can improve the business and increase her stock. 

In the future, Margarette plans to expand the business to a kiosk in the central market and hopes to make more profit and take care of the needs of the children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 67 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres nietos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, ella se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es maíz y frijol, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Cristina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra ella y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Cristina, 67, lives with her husband and three grandchildren who are 13, 10 and 6 years of age in her own house but does not have electricity.  She works in agriculture; her main crops are corn and beans.  She sells her products in various markets near her place of residence.  With profits earned from her sales she’s able to cover some of her household expenses.

Cristina’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because what she earns isn’t enough to do so.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels in the shape of a lamp that’s useful for houses in rural areas that don’t have electric power.  With this purchase she and her family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have light of their own at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: May Shane

texts.en:
May Shane is single. She is 31 years old and lives in Catadman Manabay, Ozamiz City.

May Shane sells motorcycle parts and accessories to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional motorcycle parts and accessories.

May Shane became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Linda Adjoa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Linda did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Linda sells rice in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a driver, and together they have one child. 

Linda uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Linda will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Linda wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice for resale

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 48 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gerlie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gerlie has been in farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
Artsrun and his family live in a beautiful city, Dilijan. Artsrun is married and he has a son. In the district, the city Dilijan is the richest in nature and with a beautiful lake. Forests provide fresh air. From the local river and lake you can taste the most delicious fishes and admire the ancient Armenian churches built in different centuries, which you can find in Dilijan and in surrounding villages. It is obvious why the city is greatly visited by tourists.
 
Artsrun works at the organization which is responsible for the cleanliness of the city and he is the head of the workers who keep their city clean and cute. The salary that Artsrun receives hardly covers their family needs and his son greatly wants a computer which he will use for his education and improving his computer skills. Artsrun has decided to try to realize his son’s desire with the help of Kiva lenders and he asks a loan of 220,000 Armenian drams for that purchase.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his son's education

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and newborn daughter in Vanadzor city. Vardan has higher education as an engineer. During these years he has never managed to find work in his specialty and it is already four years that he has been engaged in trading business. 

On his father’s truck,  Vardan provides different candies, biscuits and pastries to Vanadzor food markets. He buys these products from different sweets manufacturing companies once a week. He already has many loyal clients who are the owners of food shops, and they always give him great orders. Vardan has already become rather skillful in this trading business and he is thinking about product range enlargement. 

This is Vardan’s second loan from Kiva. Now he is seeking a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some new types of sweets, which will help him to have more orders, more income and a lot of new clients.

loans.use: to buy new types of sweets to increase his income

loans.name: Fatima Julissa

texts.es:
Fátima, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio;  esta inversión le ayudara a comprar  pan por mayor parcela  y maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  de manera positiva, ya que le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos, por lo que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Fátima is presented with the need to opt for a new loan, because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business. This investment will help her buy bread in bigger lots and corn.

The previous loan helped her in a positive way, since it helped her to increase her inventory and obtain better earnings, and consequently the economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy bread in bigger lots and corn

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, vive actualmente con su esposa, sus cuatro hijos y tres nietos.  El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días, junto con sus hijos, ya que lo aprendió de sus padres desde muy joven y esto le ha servido para que a su familia no le falte lo esencial para vivir.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicida,  entre otros para la siembra de la postrera y para el cultivo de primera. Esta inversión le ayudara a facilitar el tratamiento del cultivo y de esta manera las cosechas serán mucho mejores.
texts.en:
Jorge currently lives with his wife, four children and three grandchildren. He makes a living cultivating basic grains. He does this work every day with his children. He learned to do this from his parents at a very young age, and this has served him by preventing his family from ever lacking that which is essential to survival.

The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy necessary agricultural supplies, such as: compost, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and more, for the final sowing and for the first crops. This investment will help facilitate the crop treatment and because of this the harvest will be much better.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and more

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a widow and has four children. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Shei will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer de 49 años , está casada con Julio y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Llego desde la sierra de su región cuando tenía 5 años junto a sus padres para evadir los problemas causados por la violencia política de aquel, fue así que su familia empezo con la agricultura, primero como trabajadores del lugar para que luego compren sus propios terrenos de cultivos. Esto le sirvió a ella para obtener los conocimientos del cultivo de la papa, maíz y otros productos de la sierra. Cuando cumplió 20 años  se casó y logró comprar un terreno de 1 hectárea, actualmente siembra cacao orgánico y se siente muy a gusto con su labor ya que es un trabajo que le entretiene mucho porque puede estar siempre con su familia mientras realiza el mantenimiento de los árboles de cacao y también el retiro de maleza necesario para que estas plantas no consuman los nutrientes de sus parcelas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Natalia is a 49-year-old woman, she is married to Julio and has four children with whom she lives in her own house. She came from the mountainous part of her region when she was five years old together with her parents, seeking to avoid the problems caused by political violence in the region. 

That is how her family got into agriculture, first as workers in the area, and later as owners of their own cultivated land. Natalia thus learnt how to cultivate potato, corn, and other products grown in the mountains. When she turned 20 she got married and was able to buy one hectare of land. At present she cultivates organic cocoa and she is very pleased with her job. It entertains her and allows her to be close to her family at all times while taking care of the cocoa trees and removing weeds, preventing them from consuming the nutrients of her land. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to improve her situation and pledges to make her repayments on time. On this occasion she is asking for 2000 PEN so that she can buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Esi sees growing demands among consumers’ for her ‘Kenkey'. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. She aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, a single mother of four children, one of whom goes to school, resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent for her business premises and school fees.

Harriet has an enterprise selling cameras, camera battery cells, sole tape, and envelopes for photographs. In business for eight years, she has a shop where she sells on both a retail and wholesale basis, working seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves who frequently break into her business.

Harriet has applied for a loan of 1300000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cameras, envelopes and camera battery cells. She aspires to build her own rental shops and to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cameras, camera battery cells, and envelopes.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Un Amor Verdadero Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario un amor verdadero, este Dúo esta conformado por la señora Sabina de 57 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales stales como pollos cerdos, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 21 años y le da gracias a Dios en gran manera ya que le ha ayudado en su negocio, y espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitasdo ya que de esta manera ella podra seguir luchando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Dúo Solidario Un Amor Verdadero group. She is 57 years old, and earns her living by raising and selling animals such as chickens and pigs. She has been working in this occupation for 21 years, and gives heartfelt thanks to God for helping her in her business. 

She hopes that you can help her with the loan she is asking for, so that she will be able to continue to strive in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”;  La socia es Catalina, la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son papa y maiz, la socia vende en las ferias de los días viernes a todos sus clientes que le solicitan su mercaderia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra fertilizantes para su chacra.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Catalina is a member of the  “MUJERES EN ACCION” communal bank. She is still farming. She plants corn and potatoes. She sells at the Thursday market to all the clients that seek her goods. She is a responsible, hard-working person this being her way of getting her family ahead. Catalina is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 49-year-old married woman living in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her three children. She sells home use products in their community to earn a living. Her husband is also a fisherman. She had successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC.In order to have an additional stocks to offer, she borrowed a new  loan of 11,300 PHP from Gata Daku MPC microcredit   to buy rice and corn grits and livestock's feeds to sell. She hopes to gain more revenue in order improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits and livestock's feeds to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a loyal partner in good standing. She is thankful for the loan lent to her as it helped a lot in her business. Her income from her business assists her with her family's everyday expenses as well as in the education of her children. Aside from her variety store, she also has a direct selling business. She keeps on working to provide for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes to expand her business and to have more customers. She dreams of giving her children a good and quality education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
This is Bebelyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the needed materials for her tailoring business. Her income from business assisted in sending her children to school and their everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide for their everyday needs. Aside from her tailoring business, she also has a variety store.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy  grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bebelyn dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is 39 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. Rice farming and growing pineapple are the main sources for her family’s income and she has been in this business for 16 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 18,000 KHR but she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Thou with VisionFund; she completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. With the successful past loan, she has improved her standard of living. Now she is applying for another to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is 62 years old and he lives in the village of Shahumyan in the Lori region with his wife and retired mother. He has two sons who are already married and they live separately. 

Arkadi is a very skilled farmer since he has been in this occupation since he was married. His sons used to help him a lot several years ago, but now he manages everything alone. He breeds two cows, a heifer, a calf, and fifteen chickens. At the same time, he works at the school as a watchman. 

Since his farm animals are few, Arkadi does not manage to sell his farm products, which will bring some income to his family. In all it is very hard for him with such a small income to take care of both his farm and his family's needs.

Arkadi asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams so he can organize hay mowing activities and gather fodder for his farm animals for the winter months.

loans.use: to organize hay mowing activities and gather fodder for his farm animals for the winter moths

loans.name: Getrudis

texts.en:
Getrudis is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives in a town near the school and runs a kiosk at her house, a strategic location where many people, including students, come to buy goods.

Getrudis will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as oil, salt, sugar, coffee, noodles, cigarettes, books, and pencils. She is making good money from her kiosk sales, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, salt, sugar, coffee, noodles, cigarettes, books, and pencils

loans.name: Soam's Group

texts.en:
Soam is aged 35 years old and married with two children. He and his family live in a village of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteat Meachey province. To make a living, he has been farming rice and working as a motor-taxi driver. His wife also helps to earn more income by working at a garment factory. Having been in this business for 10 years, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

Soam is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. He has successfully used the past loans to improve his family’s livelihood. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Soam will use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his crops better and produce higher yields in order for him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 40, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Prey Chor district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Mom and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice and cassava for 15 years, earning about $18 per day to spend for the family’s needs.

This is the first microloan for Mom with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Joetta

texts.en:
Joetta lives in Airport in Margibi County, which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 27 years old; she and her fiancee are living together along with two children ages 6 and 8, who are in school and live at home. Her fiancée buys rubber and sells it to Firestone.

For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes in the market. She started this business by selling used clothes for her mother, and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She completed 5th grade.

She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. She likes selling to her customers, and her business makes her responsible. 

Her plans are to expand her business and see her children out of high school.  

She appreciates Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 43 años, está casado y tiene cinco hijos, él nació en la comunidad de Viscochoni pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana con su familia. 

Fransisco continua con la venta de yeso y le va excelente, él agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas y leña.
texts.en:
Fransisco is 43 years old, is married and has five children. He was born in the community of Viscochoni but lives in Jajahuana with his family.

Fransisco continues to sell plaster, and it is going very well for him. He is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported him with his previous loan, which helped him with the capital for his business. This time, he requires the loan to buy tools and firewood.

loans.use: to buy tools and firewood.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de vacas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,al socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de quesos,por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar quesos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to work raising cows. She raises them and fattens them up, and then she sells them at different markets. She also continues to dedicate herself to her cheese-selling business. 

The borrower hopes to get ahead through these two businesses. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her cheese. She is asking for this loan to buy cheese.

The borrower is happy to get this loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Teodisia

texts.en: Teodisia is 58 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She plants and harvests bananas to sell in their local community to earn a living. She has also engaged in pig-raising for six years to earn additional income.Teodisia successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC and it helps her to improve ability to engaged business.  She requested a new loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase piglets and pig feed. In 2009, she became a member of GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has three children. Marcos has been in the farming business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income.

Marcos is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Marcos has hopes of expanding his farm so that it will generate more revenue, which he can use to buy food for the family and to pay the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, age 50, resident of Batasan (Commonwealth), Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Christopher and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josefina runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In her case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from ukay-ukay stalls. These are very much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an ukay-ukay stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, also used bags and footwear. If she can roll the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Josefina dreams of having a beautiful store and hopes to build a beautiful house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes.

loans.name: Keosovannary's Group

texts.en: Keosovannary, 30, is a young father of two little kids, residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal Province.  He earns a living via the fish catching business while his wife is working at the factory. He has been involved in his business since he was 20 years old. The current business has returned about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Currently, he has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy below-the-ground materials to build a decent latrine for his family. He hopes to own a proper latrine to promote a healthy practice for his family.

loans.use: To buy below-the-ground materials to build a decent latrine for his family

loans.name: Sarom Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Sarom is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and raising cows. Having been in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn about KHR 43,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 3,000 each day for future needs. 

Sarom is a fifth cycle client with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past four loans. She wisely used the loans to make her living situation gradually improve. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes to harvest more rice so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 54 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Florencia has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Florencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 36 years old and lives at Paynesville North; which has the largest local market in Montsorrade County.  She did not go to school. She and her fiancee, who is a local businessman, are living together. They have three children between the ages of 8 and 14 who are currently attending school and living at home.  Hawa described herself as a hardworking woman.
 
For the past four years she has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper,  and etc in the local market. She likes her business because her business is growing every day, and she gets some money for her expenses.  She mentioned how she got a small amount from her children's father in order to establish this business. Also she quoted; "regard to how I transport my goods, typically I used taxi."

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, and etc for this business increasing. She explains her future plan is to increase her business, meaning to move from table business to store business where she will sell goods at wholesale price.  

She likes to show her gratitude to the lenders who supporting BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, and etc for this business increasing.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 53 years old and married to David. She supports a family of seven people. She has a small-scale poultry farming business in Tachasis. She has been in this business for the last twenty years, earning an average monthly income of KES 40,000. 

Leah plans to use some of the loan amount (KES.70,000) to pay school fees for her children. She will use the profits from the business to improve on her farm's crops variety and animal breeds.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Ruman Yueil

texts.en:
Ruman is a Finance Sudan client. She is now borrowing her third loan with Finance Sudan. She is 29 years old, married and a mother of six children, three of whom go to school. She runs a business that includes a shop and a bar. 

She is borrowing a loan worth 1,500 South Sudanese Pounds to expand her business. She currently has employed one staff person to help her run the business. 

Her businesses are growing steadily, and she intends to use the profits to pay back the loan, improve her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy mixed goods like sugar, onions, beer, soda, and many other items for her shop and bar.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 21-year-old business lady; she is a single mother of one and supports three people. She runs a retail shop in the Masaba trading center and is served by the KADET Ltd Kapsabet branch. This has been her income-generating business for the last two years. 

From this business, she gets an average monthly income of KES 32,000. She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 65,000 to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves among other items. 

Caroline will use the profits from the retail shop business to invest back into the business and pay the school fees of the children she supports. Her dream is to create a source of employment for others by expanding her business, assist in reducing the poverty rate in her community, and help in improving the economy of her country.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and other items for her retail business.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales como chanchos, el socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio lo vende de forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar chanchos para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to work raising animals such as pigs. He has spent years working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts in every day. The borrower makes sales by travelling to different markets. He wants to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family.

The borrower is asking for this loan to buy pigs for his business.

The borrower is happy to get this loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 34 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has three Children between 10 and 3. Only two of her children are currently in school, while one is still too young to attend school, and they all live at home.

For 24 years now Yassah has been selling provisions in the local market, where she enjoys the location of her business since it is situated in a very good position not far from the road. She has many customers and the need for her products is very high, although sometimes business is slow. Almost all of the time she makes good money.

Yassah is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, flour, etc. for her business, which will enable her to earn more money since the demand from her customers is very high. In the future she plans to expand her business not only in the local market but internationally.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, flour, etc. for her business

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 21 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has a seven-year-old child who lives with her and goes to school. Currently she is a ninth grade student.

Over the past six years she has been running a table business selling Vita, salt, pepper, onions, oil, seasoned oil and other products in the local market. She started the business with her own money, and with the high price of food ingredients in Monrovia she thought of selling food ingredients. 

Angie has requested a loan to purchase more Vita, salt, pepper, onions, oil, seasoned oil and other products to attract more customers. In the future, Angie hopes to be a big business woman and have her own store. She is glad to be a BRAC  and Kiva borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more Vita, salt, pepper, onions, oil, seasoned oil and other products to attract more customers.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 35 years old, married, and lives in Airport, Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. Her five children live at home; three of them attend school. Her husband is a contractor. 

For the past 17 years she has been involved in business and currently she sells milk, bread, soft drinks, etc..  She says she always uses a taxi to transport her goods to her business. She likes how her customers can buy from her, and she is proud of how supportive she is to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells 10 hours a day from Monday to Saturday.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build her house. She is glad to become a borrower of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Filbert, born in the mid-1970s, is married with two children, a daughter and a son. One of the children is in school and another is still young. Filbert has been running three enterprises: a pharmacy and two money transfer businesses (M-Pesa and Tigo Pesa) for six months as well as a dry food shop for eight years now. Filbert is a college student undertaking tourism studies, so he has employed helpers in his businesses. 

His business activities start from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and he is able to earn a very good return per month. This will be his fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to repair his business premises and invest in his Tigo Pesa business. He used the previous loans to restock more foods items, open a pharmacy and start his M-Pesa and Tigo Pesa businesses.  The profits he receives will be used to cover household expenses and school fees. He dreams of building a house.

Filbert will share this loan with his loan group "Wazo Tegeta," which totals seven members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair his business premises and invest in his Tigo Pesa  business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de verduras,la socia vende tomates,zapallos,zanahorias entre otras verduras,la socia vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para compara cebollas,zanahorias y tomates.


La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lucila continues making a living buying and selling vegetables. She sells tomatoes, pumpkins, carrots, and other vegetables. She sells them in different markets, working from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She has already been in this business for four years and it is going very well for her. 

Her dream is to have a property where she can sell vegetables. She is requesting the loan in order to buy onions, carrots, and tomatoes. She feels thankful for the loan granted and is committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a 59-year-old married father of six in Thika, runs a butchery business. He currently lacks sufficient funds needed to purchase enough meat to serve his ever-growing customer base. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, James will be able to purchase more cows for slaughter to sell in his butchery. James is requesting his seventh loan from KADET LTD, having completed repaying all his previous loans successfully. Additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. 

In the future, James would like to invest in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for slaughter

loans.name: Sankey

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet Sankey from Liberia.  Currently, she resides in the Buchanan area, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea, and is known for their beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 45 years old, married, and her husband is one of the tappers at Firestone. They have six children between the ages of 29 and 12; only two are currently living at home and attending school. 
 
Sankey has a small shop, and she has been selling dishes for the past eight years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more dishes such as plates, cups, spoon, bowls, etc.  

On average, she works ten hours each day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business by selling cooked food, and learned to sell from her sister. She transports her merchandise by a shared taxi. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a store.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more dishes such as plates, cups, spoon, bowls etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one child, who is in school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Janet operates a clothing sales business. She sells clothes at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
José, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por sus actividades agropecuarias y por la dedicación a ellas, ya que él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz, maicillo, y frijol, oficio que lo heredo de sus padres, posee 41 años de experiencia  y lo realiza desde las 6:00am a 2:00pm; ventaja que tiene es que no paga alquiler de terreno para la producción de maíz.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para 12 tareas de maíz y maicillo que tiene ya sembradas. Esta inversión le ayudará  a obtener una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas para comercializarlas y también para el consumo, asimismo le fortalecerá los ingresos. Uno de los riesgos es los cambios drásticos del invierno.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para logar mejores ganancias y así crear una estabilidad de vida mayor en cuanto a su vida personal y su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a very well-known person in his community for his agricultural activities and his dedication. He works growing bulk grains such as corn, sorghum and beans. He inherited this line of work from his parents. He has 41 years of experience and works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. One advantage he has is that he doesn't have to pay to lease the land where he produces corn.

He is asking for this loan to buy the agricultural inputs that he needs, such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides. These will be used on the 12 plots of corn and sorghum that he has already planted. This investment will help him to obtain an abundant and bug-free harvest, which will help to boost his earnings. He will sell the harvest and also use it for consumption. One of the risks facing his business is the drastic changes that occur in winter.

His dream is continue working to increase his earnings and, in so doing, have more stability in his personal life and in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Fatmata from Tombo, a Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of one year and four years old. Fatmata established her soap business after her wedding. She began her business because she was trained in business and she needed to generate income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and power soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more and even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and power soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una joven que nació el 26 de septiembre de 1984 es madre soltera de 2 niñas, de 5 y 2 años, su núcleo familiar está conformado por sus padres y dos hermanos. Es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de luchar por sus hijas y darles un mejor futuro.
Ella aspira estudiar hotelería y turismo ya que siempre le ha gustado y sobre todo quiere una buena estabilidad para sus hijas y ve que con esta carrera puede abrir un campo laboral  para su vida. Aunque no le ha sido fácil salir adelante con sus hijas, es tan grande su anhelo que ha tocado tantas puertas pero en la dura realidad las mujeres en estos casos es poco el apoyo que les brindan.
Por eso ella quisiera que campoalto muy respetuosamente la apoyara ya que es cabeza de familia y realmente tiene muchas ganas de estudiar para llegar cada vez más lejos y demostrarles a todas las mujeres que ellas no dependen de nadie y que solas pueden vencer muchos obstáculos y cumplir todos sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Paola is a young woman who was born on September 26, 1984.  She is a single mother with 2 daughters aged 5 and 2.  Her nuclear family is comprised of her parents and two siblings.  She is an enterprising woman who has a strong desire to fight to get ahead for her daughters so that she can give them a better future.  

Paola aspires to study hospitality and tourism, because she has always enjoyed this line of work, and most of all, because she wants to provide good financial stability for her daughters.  She sees that this degree can open up a path for her life's work.  Although it hasn't been easy for her to get ahead with her daughters, her desire is so great that she has knocked on many doors.  However, the harsh reality for women is that there isn't a lot of support available.  

This is why Paola wanted to respectfully request support from Campoalto, since she is the head of her household and truly has a strong desire to study to reach further every day and demonstrate to all women that they don't have to depend on anyone, that only they alone can overcome obstacles and accomplish their goals.

loans.use: to pay for her studies

loans.name: Isai

texts.es:
Isai, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de pan, tales como: harina, azúcar, huevos, manteca, leña, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer en su negocio y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, es por ello que las condiciones económicas han mejorado y asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Isai is opting for a new loan because he needs more working capital in order to continue investing in his business. This investment will help him to buy raw materials for making bread, such as: flour, sugar, eggs, lard, firewood, and more.

His previous loan helped him to grow in his business and have everything necessary in order to work. This is why his economic condition has improved, as well as his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, lard, firewood, and more

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is divorced and has seven children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Faustina is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells gari (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava) for a living. She normally sells her gar’ in Akonoma, near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for a number of years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Faustina uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Martha from Liberia. She lives in Airport Margibi county which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is unmarried and has four children who live at home. All four of her children are between the ages of three and 14, and three of them are attending school and live at home. Her fiance is a security guard of Firestone. For the past three years, she has been doing business in the local market, selling red oil and charcoal. She started this business with little money from her fiance and learned this way of selling from her mother. Most often she uses the bus to get her goods to the market. She likes the flow of her customers, and she enjoys the profit she makes sometime. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business. Her dream is to see herself as international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es: Doña Juana es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 44 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas. Empezó con una mini pulpería vendiendo pollo y cerdo. Luego Tubo la iniciativa de aprender a elaborar piñatas, años más tarde se motivó para poner su propio negocio, el cual comercializa de manera ambulante  por diferentes municipios de la ciudad y ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho sacrificio. Su expectativa es sacar un curso de diseño de piñatas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: periódico, cartulina, pega, papel crepe, etc. Su meta futuro es mejorar la  infraestructura de su local y comprar una mesa grande de madera para trabajar, elaborar más piñatas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is originally from the city of Boaco. She is 44, married, and the mother of two children. She is a merchant by trade, making a living making and selling piñatas. 

She started with a mini grocery store selling chicken and pork.  Then she had the initiative to learn to make piñatas. Years later, she motivated herself to start her own business, wherein she sells by foot in the different municipalities of the city and she has been able to get ahead with much sacrifice. 

She expects to take a course in piñata design. She is requesting the loan in order to buy newspaper, cardboard, glue, crepe paper, etc. Her future goal is to improve her property's infrastructure and buy a large wooden table in order to work, make more piñatas and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy newspaper, cardboard, glue, crepe paper, etc.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de KANGARE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec au moins cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements et de céréales et de produits agricoles à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mil et 5 d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne à DALABALA et environnant  et vend ses céréales à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group that is part of the Benkadi association, located in Kangaré. Its four female members all know each other because they are family members or neighbors. They are on average 40 years of age, and are married with at least five children each. They all work in different businesses, including selling clothes, cereals, and agricultural produce. The group’s members all live in large traditional families in Kangaré, located in the sub-prefecture of Selingue (in the Sakasso region of Mali).

These women have worked in small-scale retail for several years, and are all in high demand. In order to meet the growing needs of their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and are now on their fifth group loan.

Maimouna is pictured first on the left in the photo, and is the president of the group. She is very well-known in Kangaré, and plans to use her loan to buy ten sacks of millet and five sacks of peanuts. She gets her supplies in Dalabala and the surrounding areas, and sells her cereals in Kangaré on a retail basis for cash and on credit. Her customers are both male and female.

Maimouna hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is married with three children and all those children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 7,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. She generates additional income through tailoring.  She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, tiene 38 años de edad y está acompañado,  vive con sus suegros y disfruta de tres hijos. El se dedica a vender pan y posee una sorbeteria para obtener ingresos y mantener el hogar, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 9 años y lo lleva a cabo de lunes a sábado, sale a vender de casa en casa y lo inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia. 
El préstamo que requiere el Sr. José le ayudara a comprar pan dulce, paletas, sorbetes, conos, vasitos, entre otros para luego venderle a los clientes. Esta  inversión le servirá para aumentar la capacidad de inversión y mejorar sus ingresos, no tiene ningún riesgo en la actividad.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio para incrementar  sus utilidades y lograr financiarle la educación a sus hijos para así tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and has a partner. He lives with his in-laws and is happy to have three children. He works selling bread and has an ice cream shop to  earn an income and support his household. He has had this business for nine years and works Monday through Saturday. He sells door-to-door and started this business on his own initiative.

José is asking for this loan to buy sweet breads, ice pops, ice creams, cones, cups and other items to then sell to his customers. This investment will help him to improve his investment capacity and his earnings. His business has no associated risks.

His dream is to strengthen his business to increase his profits, and to finance his children's education, to have a better life in this way.

loans.use: to buy sweet breads, ice pops, ice creams, cones, and cups, among other items.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en el cultivo de maíz, pipián, frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro cultivar lo deseado y obtuvo buenas cosechas, asimismo genero ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen mientras que las condiciones económicas se han optimizado. Su deseo es agregar otro tipo de cultivo, ampliar su vivienda y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Santiago is opting for a new loan in order to continue working to cultivate corn, squash, and beans. This investment will help him buy necessary agricultural supplies, such as compost, herbicide, and insecticide, and to pay for manual labor.

His previous loan was positive, since he was able to cultivate what he wished and he had a good harvest, and he also generated income. His family circumstances have remained the same and his economic condition has been optimized. His wish is to add another type of crop, expand his home and grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicide, insecticide, and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans, T-shirts, and boots for his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Janet is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions and cosmetics in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Janet is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Janet wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Janet plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy  is 31 years old and lives in airport Margibi County. She is unmarried. She did not attend school but she is good at managing her business. She has five children between two to 16 years old, all of whom live at home and only three are in school For the past five years, she been selling oil, pepper, onion, okra, vita, salt, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her fiance. She learned this business from her aunt. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, onion, okra, vita, salt, etc. for her business. She hopes to have more profit to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, onion, okra, vita, salt etc for her business.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 42 years old and lives in Airport of Margibi County, which has the larger rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married to a doctor, and they have three children ages from 15 to 22 years old, only two of whom are in school and live at home. The oldest children are living on their own and out of high school. Finda's parents did not send her to school, so she decided to do business in order to survive. Over the past 10 years she has been selling fashion slippers in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending nine hours with her business. She started this busbies by selling cookies, and her aunty is the one who taught her how to sell. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. She enjoy how she saved money every time. In the future she want to build a house. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business,

loans.name: Edwing Francisco

texts.es: Edwing es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 24 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza. Empezó trabajando a la edad de 22 años con una tía, poco a poco logro tener su propio negocio realizando ventas de producto de limpieza, en esta actividad los apoya su familia quienes comercializan sus productos en hospitales, hoteles, restaurantes y diferentes departamentos. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso la comideria de su esposa. Su expectativa es vender al por mayor logrando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: esencia de fresa e hipoclorito de sodio ya que piensa invertir en pedidos que tiene. Sus planes futuros son comprar dos estantes y contratar dos empleados. Sus metas son hacer crecer su negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida. Este préstamo le ayudara mucho  ya que piensa invertir en más materia prima para cubrir pedidos.
texts.en:
Edwing is originally from the city of Boaco. He is 24, married, and the father of one child. He is a salesman, making a living selling cleaning products. He started working at the age of 22, with an aunt. Bit by bit, he was able to start his own business selling cleaning products. His family supports him in this work, selling his products in hospitals, hotels, restaurants, and different departments. He has his wife's eatery as another source of income. 

He expects to sell wholesale, thus satisfying the needs of his clients. He is requesting the loan to buy strawberry essence and sodium hypochlorite, since he plans to invest in the orders he has. His future plans are to buy two shelves and hire two employees. His goals are to make his business grow and improve his standard of living. This loan will help him a lot since he is planning on investing in more supplies in order to cover his orders.

loans.use: to buy strawberry essence and sodium hypochlorite

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Amigas Unidas
Uno de sus socios es Vitgar de 32 años, casado con una hija pequeña de un año.Vitgar es técnico en sistemas e informática,  en la actualidad trabaja como profesor en una entidad educativa; por otro lado hace 03 años empezó su negocio propio, un taller de computo donde presta diferentes servicios como arreglo de computadoras, mantenimiento de sistemas y soporte técnico. Entre sus clientes figuran algunos comercios, escuelas y diferentes personas que requieren de sus servicios.Vitgar se siente contento con su negocio ya que gracias a el puede obtener más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, el crédito que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro le gustaría expandirse y ofrecer más servicios. Vitgar está agradecido por este préstamo que le da tranquilidad  y confianza para alcanzar sus proyectos.
Vitgar es el primero de la izquierda.
texts.en:
This is the Amigas Unidas (United Friends) group. One of the members is Vitgar, 32, who is married and has a small, one-year-old daughter. Vitgar is an information systems technician. He currently works as a professor in an educational institute. 

He also started his own business three years ago: a computer workshop where he offers different services such as computer repair, system maintenance and technical support. Among his clients, there are some businesses, schools and different people who require his services. Vitgar feels happy with his business since, thanks to the business, he can obtain a better income for the well-being of his family. 

The loan he has requested will be used to buy tools for his business. In the future, he would like to expand and offer more services. Vitgar is thankful for this loan, which will give him the tranquility and confidence to finish his projects. Vitgar is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Hassanatu. She is widowed and has three children aged 10, 18, and 29. In 2000, Hassanatu established her motorbike spare parts business.

She began her business after losing her husband in order to be self reliant. Her business is located in city center, and her main customers are motorists and mechanics. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,741,362 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Hassanatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional tires and engine oil. She hopes that this loan will improve the stock and raise the profit.

In the future, Hassanatu plans to expand the business to the sale of motorbikes and hopes to be able to raise enough profit and expand to the outskirt of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil.

loans.name: Wuyah

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Wuyah. She is married and has three children, aged 14, 11, and seven. In 2009, Wuyah established her plastic slippers business. She began her business just to enable her provide for her domestic needs. Her business is located at city centre, and her main customers are both men and women.
