Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Wuyah has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level. In the future, Wuyah still nurtures the plan of renting a shop and to educate her kids. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic slippers.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: This is 58-year-old Fanta.  She is married and has four children aged 25, 21, 18 and 15. In 1998, Fanta established her provisions and rice business. She began her business in order to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located at city centre, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fanta requires a loan in order to buy mayonnaise and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her solve her domestic problems. In the future, Fanta plans to educate her kids and to rent a shop along Maxwell Kobe Street. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions and rice

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 26 años, está casada con Wilmer y tiene una hija pequeña , juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe. Nelly se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un terreno que compró junto a su esposo y desde entonces vienen cultivando varias de las plantaciones más productivas de la zona como cacao orgánico y árboles frutales que tienen un  óptimo crecimiento en sus terrenos. Viene trabajando hace 7 años y durante este tiempo a logrado obtener buenos resultados. Es un trabajo que según comenta le agrada ya que puede realizarlo con su familia y también contratando trabajadores del lugar para tareas complicadas ya que le gusta mantener su parcela en buen estado, además acostumbra fertilizar sus terrenos con abono orgánico. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 26 and married to Wilmer. She has a young daughter and lives with her family in an adobe house. 

Nelly is a farmer and has a plot of land that she and her husband purchased and on which they have since grown some of the most productive crops for the climate where they live. Nelly grows organic cacao and fruit trees that achieve optimal growth on her land. 

Nelly has farmed for seven years and achieved solid results in that time. Nelly likes farming, she says, because she can do the work with her family. She can also hire seasonal help for complex tasks as she likes to keep her land in good condition. Nelly has also adopted the practice of fertilizing her land with organic manure. 

This is Nelly's fourth loan with Kiva and she's grateful for the financial support that she'll receive to continue progressing forward. Nelly is also committed to making timely payments. She has applied for a loan of 1,500 new soles to purchase organic manure for plantings.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Faustima

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Faustima is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling limes in Akonoma(near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Faustima is married and has five children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Faustima wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of limes. In the long term, Faustima plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of limes.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es:
Mujeres de Confianza está conformado por ocho integrantes mujeres soltera con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Son originarios de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser personas  trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación persona. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta en familia, preparándole un platos típicos de la región como son los “tamales rellenos” lamentablemente no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a  trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo que lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Blanca es la coordinadora del banco comunal Mujeres de Confianza y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, azúcar,  frijoles crudos y cosidos, tiste, pan, leche, huevos, detergente jabón, gaseosas, frutas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, actividad que la realiza con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Mujeres de Confianza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mujeres de Confianza [Women of Trust] is made up of eight single women members with ten children under their responsibility. They are from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. It's characterized by its hard-working, responsible people with goals of personal improvement. In their free time they like to be with family, preparing them typical dishes of the region like "tamales rellenos." Regrettably, they could not pursue a career and they were obliged to work from an early age. Therefore, they fight day after day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her efforts to move forward, Blanca is the coordinator of the Mujeres de Confianza village bank and she runs a shop. It's a small shop that sells edible products in small quantities like rice, sugar, raw and cooked beans, tiste [corn-based drink], bread, milk, eggs, detergent, sodas, fruits and matches. She dedicates 12 hours to her business a day, an activity she carries out with much pleasure. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and grow her business in the purchase and sale of edible products so that in the not-so-distant future she can obtain better income.

The Mujeres de Confianza village bank is grateful for the help of the Kiva investors who help people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified type of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business in the purchase and sale of edible products such as rice, sugar, raw and cooked beans, tiste [corn-based drink], bread, milk, eggs, detergent, sodas, fruits, matches.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 420year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has four children aged 19, 15, 13 and nine. In 2003, Ibrahim established his dry milk business. He began his business in order to enable him to settle his domestic problem. His business is located at city centre, and his main customers are mostly women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy packets of dry milk. He hopes that this loan will increase his capital base and his stock level. In the future, Ibrahim plans to rent his own store/shop, to build another house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy packets of milk

loans.name: Benjamin Meliton

texts.es:
Benjamín, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol y para el ganado; esta inversión le ayudar a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y medicamento para el ganado.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha utilidad, ya que logro cultivar la producción anterior y hacerle mejoraras a su hogar. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Benjamín needs a new loan because he needs more working capital.  He needs this in order to continue investing in his basic crops like corn and beans and for his livestock.  This investment will help him to buy the needed agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides and medication for the livestock.

The previous loan was very useful.  He managed to cultivate the previous production and to make improvements to his home.  The financial conditions and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides and medication for the livestock.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: You are welcome to meet 43-year-old Alice from Liberia. She resides in the community surrounding the Airport of Liberia in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her husband and nine children. Only four of her children are in school and live at home. They are between the ages of 13 and 30. For five years now, she has been involved with business in the local market selling frozen food such as chicken, fish, pig feet, and chicken foot. Her aunt taught her how to sell and assisted her with 2,000 LRD. By these means she was able to establish this business. Freezing food has little profit but it is fast to buy goods in the area she sells. She makes more profit because she sells more cartons before each day ends and has more customers. She is asking for a loans to buy more chicken, fish, pig feet, and chicken foot for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, fish, pig feet, and chicken foot,  for her business,

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 54 años de edad la cual es soltera y no tiene hijos y vive bajo el techo de su madre y vive en su compañía. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa dedicándose a la actividad de la agricultura hace muchos años la cual lo aprendió de sus padres los cuales son ancianos y fue por mucho tiempo y sigue siendo su único medio de ingreso para cubrir las necesidades básicas entre otras que se presentaban en el hogar. Ella también en temporadas frías siembra maíz y frijoles siendo sus clientes una empresa ubicada en la misma comunidad la cual se dedica a la compra de estos productos para revender o exportar. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación siendo ella la única que se involucra en la asistencia y mantenimiento de sus cultivos.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesario como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, etc. para su cafetal ya que por medio de esto ella espera mejorar sus cultivos y al final obtener una excelente cosecha obteniendo resultados positivos y esperados.  

Ella planea ampliar más sus cultivos de café sembrando una mayor y mejor variedad de plantilla ya que de esa manera ella podrá generar mejores ingresos logrando alcanzar un buen precio en el mercado y pudiendo retener mejores ganancias para familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and single. She doesn't have any children, and she lives with her mother in her mother's home. She is a farmer and housekeeper. She has worked in agriculture for many years, and she learned how to farm from her parents, who are now elderly. Farming has been her sole means of earning an income for a long time, and it allows her to cover her basic necessities and other household expenses. 

In cool seasons she also plants corn and beans. Her main customer is a business located in the same community as her. They buy her products to resell or export. 

Her crops are located 100 metres away from her home, as she is the only person who is involved in the care and maintenance of her crops. 

She is asking for this loan to buy necessary agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers and manure, for her coffee farming. With these inputs she hopes to improve her crops and obtain an excellent harvest, achieving positive results.

She plans to increase her coffee crops by planting a better and larger variety of seeds, since she will be able to increase her earnings in this way. It will help her to sell at a good price in the market and she will be able to retain more earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ivett Irene

texts.es:
Ivett es estudiante de Farmacia y Bioquímica

Ivett, continua estudiando de forma satisfactoria, solo le falta un año para terminar su carrera y eso la hace muy feliz, en la actualidad está realizando sus prácticas pre profesionales en un laboratorio. Invett está solicitando su tercer crédito para pagar las mensualidades de su nuevo ciclo en la universidad, se siente agradecida por obtener este préstamo ya que gracias a el podrá continuar con su propósito de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Ivett is a pharmacy and biochemistry student. She is completing her studies in a satisfactory way. She only has one more year before she finishes her degree, which makes her very happy. 

She is currently doing her pre-professional work placement in a lab. Ivett is asking for her third loan to pay her monthly tuition fees for the new term at university.

She feels very grateful for this loan, because thanks to this loan she will be able to continue working toward her goal of having a great professional career.

loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, menciona que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en la elaboración de pupusas y venta de refrescos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz, quesillo, aceite, loroco, chicharrón, entre otros. 
Cuenta que el crédito anterior le fue favorable, ya que logro surtir la materia prima para la actividad que realiza y aumentaron las ventas. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado porque los ingresos son positivos.
texts.en:
Claudia says that her past loans have helped her to generate new income. She needs a new loan to continue investing in making pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and selling soft drinks. 

This investment will help her to buy corn, fresh cheese, loroco [an edible flower from El Salvador], pork rinds, and other items.

Claudia says that her last loan was helpful, because she managed to stock up on primary materials for her work and increase her sales. Her family circumstances remain the same, while her economic conditions have improved since her revenues are positive.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, oil, loroco, and pork rinds, among other items.

loans.name: Elda Elena

texts.es:
Elda, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en la  elaboración y venta de pupusas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: tomates, repollos, carne, aceite, quesillo, entre otros.
Menciona la Sra. Elda que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ganancias, las cuales las invierte en los gastos del hogar y en la educación de sus hijos. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado  y la familia se encuentra muy bien de salud y se mantiene el mismo grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Elda needs a new loan because more capital is required to continue investing in making and selling pupusas, a thick corn tortilla stuffed with various fillings. This investment will allow her to buy the raw materials, such as: tomatoes, cabbages, meat, oil, quesillo (a soft cheese), and other products. 

Señora Elda says that the previous loan helped her to increase her earnings, which she invested in household expenses and the education of her children. Economic conditions have improved; the family is in very good health, and has maintained the same structure.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbages, meat, oil, cheese, and other products

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en: Yowah is 37 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her boyfriend and three children between 3 and 11 years old. All their children are in school. For four years now she has been selling oil, salt, drinks such as beer, stout, white spirit gin, black horse gin, milk etc. at her shop in the community. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more of the goods mentioned above for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more, educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more oil, salt, drinks, etc to sell in her store.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 20 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.   

Patience is single, and she was educated to the eighth grade. For the past four years she been selling pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita and other products. She started this business with a small amount from her aunt and learned this business from her as well. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita and other inventory for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita and more items for her business

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, tiene 55 años de edad, casada y madre  de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante. Empezó vendiendo  productos lácteos. A la edad de 25 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de verduras y zapatos lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio, en este negocio la apoya su familia. Sus expectativas son: mejorar el local y surtir su negocio para vender al  por mayor a sus clientes. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: zanahoria, tomate, cebolla, repollo, papas y botas para la temporada. Su plan futuro  es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y su meta próxima es comprar ganado de ordeño. Este crédito le ayudara por que invertirá y  así de sus ganancias piensa poner otro negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 55, is from the city of Boaco. She is married with one son and she works as a merchant. She started out by selling dairy products. At the age of 25, she decided to start selling vegetables and shoes, which has been very profitable. She supports her family with this business.

Her goals are to improve her property and stock her business to sell wholesale products to her clients. She has applied for a loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, and boots for the new season. Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business. Her next objective is to buy dairy cattle. This loan will help her because she will make an investment. With her earnings, she hopes to open another business.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, and boots for the new season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Rose is an entrepreneur. She specializes in hairdressing in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Rose is married and has four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Rose wants to use her loan to expand her business and hire more employees. In the long term, Rose plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to expand her business and hire more employees.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es viudo, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilado con la cual se mantiene y cubre sus necesidades mas minimas, el credito que solicita es para efectuar un tratamiento medico ya que la caja no cubre algunos analisis y medicamentos
texts.en:
Raul is a widower.  He lives with his two children in his own house in the city of La Paz.

He currently receives a retirement income with which he supports himself and covers the barest necessities.

The loan that he is requesting is for medical treatment.  Some analyses and medications are not covered by health services.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment, analyses, and medications.

loans.name: Max

texts.es:
Max es chófer asalariado y afiliado a un sindicato, vive en casa de sus padres la cual es muy humilde en la ciudad de la Paz.
Necesita crédito para costear el tratamiento medico de su hija ya que sufrio un accidente de transito, el sindicato le comunico que no puede ayudarle y lo que gana no es suficiente.
texts.en:
Max is a salaried driver and affiliated with a union. He lives in his parents' house, which is very modest, in the city of La Paz.

He needs a loan to cover the medical treatment of his daughter, as she suffered a transportation accident. The union informed him that they cannot help him, and what he earns is not enough.

loans.use: to pay for the medical treatment of a close family member

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la mercadería necesaria tales como: bebidas, frutas, entre otros para brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió generar mejores ingresos, es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado porque sus hijos hoy reciben una mayor atención alimentaria.
texts.en:
María has opted to apply for a new loan, because these loans have been a income-generating force for her. This investment will help her to buy necessary merchandise, such as drinks, fruit, and others, to offer her clients a better service.

Her previous loan permitted her to generate higher earnings, which is why her financial conditions and family circumstances have improved. Today, her children receive more attention to their food.

loans.use: to buy drinks and fruit, among others.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz, frijoles, condimentos y leña para la elaboración de tamales pisques y luego venderle a sus clientes. 
Cuenta la Sra. María que el crédito anterior le ayudo al fortalecimiento del negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia, ya que su deseo es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y mantener el negocio para cubrir los gastos del hogar siempre.
texts.en:
María has opted to apply for a new loan because she needs more working capital. This investment will help her to buy corn, beans, condiments, and firewood to make tamales pisques (spicy tamales) which she will sell to her clients.

María says that her previous loan helped her to strengthen her business. With her earnings, she has managed to support her family. Her wish is to help her children with their studies and to maintain her business so she can always cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, condiments, and firewood.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo  y por la buena atención que la Institución brinda; esta inversión hoy le ayudara y utilizara para comprar un lote de terreno.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar su vivienda, por lo que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado; asi mismo logro adquirir mas clientela en su negocio de venta de tostadas de platano.
texts.en:
Concepción has opted to apply for a new loan because she needs more working capital and because of the good service which the institution offers her. This investment will be helpful to her as she will use it to buy a plot of land.

Her previous loan allowed her to improve her home. Her financial conditions and family circumstances have improved. She also managed to acquire a larger clientele for her business selling toasted plantains.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
José, menciona que los créditos son una fuente financiera favorable que ayuda a mejorar las ventas, es por ello que necesita de un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la elaboración de pupusas; esta inversión le servirá para comprar repollo, tomates, cebolla, chicharrón, frijoles, maíz, quesillo, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar sus ventas y con ello se optimizo la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
José says that these loans are a favorable source of financing that helps to improve sales. For this reason, he needs a new loan to invest in the making of pupusas, a thick corn tortilla stuffed with various fillings. This investment will allow him to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, onions, fried meat, beans, corn, quesillo (a soft cheese), and other products.

The previous loan allowed him to improve his sales, and with that he improved the economic stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, tomatoes, onions, fried meat, beans, corn, cheese, and other products

loans.name: Suzzana

texts.en:
Suzzana is 41 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Suzzana is married and has five children aged between 10 and 21, only three of whom are in school, and all of whom live at home. Suzzana did not go to school. For the past four years she has been selling soft drinks. She started this business with a little amount from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. She likes the profit she makes every time. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for 10 years. A loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO would help Margaret to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Margaret generates additional income through frying and selling samosas. She works from home and sells both on wholesale and retail. She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and rainy season which hinder her movements. 

Margaret aspires to own delivery vans to ease transportation and to sell on wholesale only. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: El Sr. Ademar  tiene 26 años, soltero el  se dedica a la venta de comida junto a su Mama en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de La Guardia,    este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá transportarse para realizar algunas compras para su negocio, El Sr. Ademar  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de él y de su Mama, ya que es lo que más le preocupa cuidar de su Mama.
texts.en:
Ademar is 26 years old and single.  He sells food together with his mother at a sales stand in La Guardia.

This loan is his first cycle within the institution.  He will use this loan to buy a motorcycle.  This will allow him to have the transportation to make some purchases for his business.

The challenge that Ademar faces in his business is the competition.  There are already various people who sell food.  

His wish for his business is to continue selling and to have a restaurant in order to be able to make his customers comfortable.  This way he will be able to make his business grow, improve his income, and improve his quality of life and that of his mother.  What he is the most concerned about is taking care of his mother.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 37 años , es madre soltera de 2 hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y para el normal desempeño de sus labores cuenta con la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar quienes se encargan de realizar las tareas difíciles como el retiro de maleza que crece constantemente y la aplicación de abono orgánico indispensable para mejorar la calidad de las mazorcas.
Al finalizar la campaña productiva  y con la llegada de la cosecha contrata algunos jornaleros para recolectar las mazorcas de cacao maduras y tras partirlos extrae cuidadosamente las almendras que son secadas a la luz natural del sol para luego ensacarlos adecuadamente y llevarlos hasta los centro de ventas, el cual está ubicado en su localidad. Uno de sus principales objetivos es adquirir otra parcela para iniciarse en la producción de barbasco puesto que el precio de este producto esta proyectando a una buena demanda. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard-working 37-year-old woman. She is a single mother of 2 daughters, with whom she lives in her own house. Rosa is engaged in agriculture, and for the everyday performance of her work, she counts on the assistance of local workers who take care of the difficult work of removing the constantly growing brush and applying the indispensable organic fertilizer to improve the quality of the cacao pods.

At the end of the productive season and with the arrival of the harvest, she hires a few day laborers to collect the ripe cacao pods and, after splitting them, carefully extract the kernels, which are dried in natural sunlight. After, they adequately package them and bring them to the sales center, which is located in her area. 

One of her main objectives is to acquire another parcel of land to begin the production of barbasco, a plant often used in fishing, as the price of this product is projected to be in high demand. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to move forward. For this opportunity, she would like to request 1,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Amalia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene 35 años de edad y vive con sus padres. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de cerdos, dicho oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo desempeña de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y asimismo la producción.
El sueño de la Sra. Blanca es optimizar sus ingresos, fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old and lives with her parents. She makes a living in agriculture by planting corn and raising pigs. She learned about this profession from her parents, and she works from Monday to Saturday from 6:00am to 12:00pm.

She has applied for a loan to buy necessary farm supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among others. This investment will help her to increase her income as well as her production.

Blanca's dream is to optimize her income, strengthen her business, and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Yobana Margarita

texts.es:
Yobana, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio; esta compra le permitirá adquirir pan dulce, francés, quesadillas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro surtir más el negocio con diferente mercadería. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, sus ingresos han incrementado; su deseo es mejorar la vivienda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Yobana has opted to apply for a new loan because she needs working capital to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to buy sweet bread, French bread, and quesadillas, among others.

Her previous loan was successful because she was able to stock her business with different merchandise. Her family circumstances have improved and her income has increased. Her wish is to improve her home and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, French bread, and quesadillas, among others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She lives and works in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is a widow, and she did not go to school. Mary has seven children between 19 and 30 years old, all of whom are living on their own.  

For the past six years, Mary been selling flour, rice, bread, sugar and other items in the local market. She started this business with a small amount rounded up from her late husband’s family. She learned this business from her friends, and she likes her business because the of how people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar and similar items for her business. Her dream is to build a decent house and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar and similar items for her business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Cecelia from Liberia lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Cecelia is unmarried. She completed eleventh grade. She has children aged 4 and 12, who are in school and live at home. Over the past two years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc. She started this business with 1000 LRD from her fiancé who is a businessman as well, and she learned the business from her friends. The benefit from her business is helping to support her home, and she spends eight hours with her business six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. In the near future she wants to get more money and buy a car for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of two entrepreneurial members. One of these is Florence, a 43-year-old single woman with four children. Her business for four years has been selling underwear as a street vendor.  

Florence will invest this loan in the purchase of nightwear, brassieres and panties to sell to customers. She would need GHS 1,500 to purchase this inventory. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana and first with Kiva.

Sarah is 41 years old, and her business is selling bags and toy materials.

loans.use: To purchase nightwear, brassieres and panties to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ramón De Jesús

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 59 años de edad, es casado,  procreo seis hijos, convive junto a su esposa de 50 años,  una nuera de 25 años y sus  cuatro nietos de aproximadamente seis años. Él, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa  y nuera quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

 Él desempeña actividades agrícolas, como la siembra de maíz; el cual aprendió de sus padres. Para llegar a las parcelas camina 1 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposa durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde realiza viajes con un vehículo que posee desde hace diez años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cambiar la caja de velocidad a su vehículo; para tenerlo en buenas condiciones de realizar viajes y evitar que ocurra algún incidente. 
	
su meta es,  comprar un molino y poder elaborar lácteos como queso, crema y quesillo y así en un futuro poder construir una casa digna de ladrillo para su familia; ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Ramón, 59, is married and has six children.  He lives with his wife, 50; a daughter-in-law, 25; and his four grandchildren, who are around 6 years old.  He only studied up to ninth grade.  He gets up at 5 a.m. with his wife and daughter-in-law, who depend on the work he does.

He does agricultural labor such as growing corn, which he learned from his parents.  He walks a kilometer to get to his land and works with his wife in the morning.  Later, in the afternoon, he provides transportation with a vehicle he has had for 10 years.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to change the gear box on his vehicle so it's in good condition for making trips and to avoid any mishap.

His goal is to buy a mill and be able to make dairy products such as cheeses and cream.  This way, in the future he'll be able to build a decent brick house for his family, because his current house is made of adobe.

loans.use: to fix the gear box on his vehicle

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is thirty-three-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children aged three and eight. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help in the business. In 2010, Mohamed established his trimmings, electrical, drinks and pure water business. He started the business to be self reliant after graduating from school. His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,194,200 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy additional trimmings and poplin. He hopes that this can improve his stock and maximize his profit. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand the business to include the sale of recharge cards. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional trimmings and poplin

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She has a business of a pub and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 600000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water and Jerycans of local gin. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and rainy season which hinders her customers to reach out to her. She aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water and jerycans of local gin.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es una mujer soltera de 29 años que vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Vilma se dedica a la agricultura , siempre estuvo al lado de sus padres a quienes ayudaba desde pequeña en las distintas actividades agrícolas referentes a la producción de productos orgánicos como el cacao, barbasco entre otros. Esta es una labor que le agrada puesto que le gusta trabajar al aire libre realizando labores agrícolas por eso brinda un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de cacao. Actualmente viene haciéndose cargo de las 2 hectáreas de terreno familiar en donde tienen muchas plantaciones de cacao los cuales logran producir mazorcas de calidad siendo una de las favoritas de la zona. Para mantener y optimizar sus cosechas suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico y seguir fertilizando sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 29, lives in her own house made of wood. She works in agriculture. 

From a young age, she was always at her parents' side. She helped them with various farm activities related to the production of organic products, such as cocoa and barbasco, among others. She enjoys her work because she likes to work outside, doing various types of farm labor, so she maintains her cocoa plantations well. She is currently responsible for two hectares of her family's land where they have many cocoa plantations. This land produces good-quality pods, one of the area's favorites. 

To maintain and optimize her harvests, she tends to fertilize her plots with organic fertilizer. This is her first Kiva loan, and she feels grateful for the financial help she is receiving to continue moving ahead. She is also committed to paying her installments on time. She would like 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy organic fertilizer so she can continue fertilizing her land.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Elba

texts.es:
Blanca, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo  para seguir invirtiendo en la venta de tortillas y elaboración de pupusas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, loroco, leña, entre otros.
Cuenta que el crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que mejoro notablemente su negocio y aumento la clientela, asimismo sus ventas. Las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Blanca needs to get another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business selling tortillas and making pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  This investment will help her buy rice, pork rinds, soft cheese, beans, loroco, firewood, and other ingredients.

She says the previous loan was a big help to her because she improved her business and increased her clientele and her sales noticeably.  She has made the best of her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 45 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Mama and her fiancée stay together. She did not attend school and has two children aged 13 and 15. They live at home and attend school. For the past four years, Mama has been selling salt, pepper, oil, rice and similar items in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by first selling for her mother, learning the business from her. She appreciates her business because of the assistance her business gives her. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more salt, pepper, oil, rice and other goods for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, pepper, oil, rice and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education. However, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama prepares and sells Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 20 years. 

Ama is married to a farmer, and together they have one child. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase a greater amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall Kenkey sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials which he will use to sew shirts, skirts, trousers and blouses.

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
The group, which is called "Arise And Shine," is comprised of 6 women entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established. The women sell groceries, second hand clothing, cutlery sets, food flasks, cooking oil and cooking utensils. This is their second loan with Kiva and the seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Salomey, has been in the group for the past three years and has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Salomey, 37, is married and has three dependent children who are staying with them. She rents the house she lives in and her husband is a mechanic who works so hard to support her.

For 8 years, Salomey has been selling groceries, including milk, assorted soap, tooth brushes and paste, and canned products. She sells throughout the week by walking to her customers.

She plans to use the new loan to buy milk, assorted soaps, tooth brushes and paste, and canned products so that she can sell enough to take care of her children. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her children. 

They need total loan amount of GHS 5550 to buy more stock for sale.

loans.use: To buy milk, assorted soaps, tooth brushes and paste, and canned products to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has 4 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves, and also sells watermelon for a living. She normally sells her kenkey in Akonoma (near Cape Coast.) She has been actively involved in this business for about 3 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of watermelon and maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells in order to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of watermelon and maize

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Abass. He is married and has five children ages 24, 21, 19, 17 and 16. He has two additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  

In 1997, Abass established his provisions and confectioneries business. He began his business for self-empowerment. His business is located at city centre and his main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Abass would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Abass has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase sardines (1,500,000), batteries (700,000) and biscuits (500,000). He hopes that this loan shall provide him with more income for domestic use. 

In the future, Abass plans to educate his children, to build a house and to rent a spacious shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sardines, batteries, and biscuits

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Rebecca is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling eggs and saucepans in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. 

Rebecca is married and has three children. Her husband works as a maintenance man. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Rebecca will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of eggs and saucepans, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of eggs and saucepans, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and she did not attend school. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. Buchanan is located by the sea and is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of Buchanan love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Mary is married with five children between 2 and 12 years old, only four of whom are in school and they all live at home. For the past two years, she been selling cold water and charcoal in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her husband and she learned business from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday for 9 hours. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water and charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more water and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: María, tiene  38 años de edad, esta soltera y vive con sus hijos en el municipio de San Juan, Intibucá. Ella anteriormente ayudaba a las labores agrícolas a sus padres y hace 9 años se dedica al cultivo de café. Cuenta con una manzana de terreno donde realiza sus cultivos. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF, con el cual  va invertir para la siembra de café y la compra de fertilizantes. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la cosecha de café. Su meta es arreglar su vivienda y sembrar mas área de café.
texts.en: María is 38 years old, single and lives with her two children in the Municipality of San Juan, Intibucá. She used to help her parents with the farm work and has been growing coffee for the last nine years. She has one manzana of land (1.7 acres) where she grows her coffee. She sells the product in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to invest in planting coffee and buying fertilizer. This is her fourth loan from ODEF. The loan will help her coffee harvest. Her goals are to fix-up her house and plant more land with coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to upkeep her plantation and plant coffee.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi prepares and sells kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves, in her village of Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. She is married to a carpenter and together they have 4 children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall kenkey sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Janet is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. 

Janet is married and has five children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Janet wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Janet plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Please meet Mary, a 48-year-old woman who resides in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her children. She is a widow and has five children between 26 and 31. All her children are attending some college. Her children helped her with a little money to establish a table market where she has sold oil, sugar, bread, salt, flour etc for the past two years now. Her aunt taught her how to sell before. Her business makes more profit, moreover, her business makes her popular. She is asking for a loan to buy more oil, sugar, bread, salt, flour etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more oil, sugar, bread, salt, flour etc. for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Edna. She is married and has three children aged five, ten and eighteen. In 1993, Edna established her drinks, toiletries and provisions business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband to run the affairs of the children. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Edna requires a loan in order to pay for additional soft drinks, mayonnaise, and batteries. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profits. In the future, Edna plans to improve on the drinks trade by making an extension for the bar. She hopes to make more profit and expand to the center of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional soft drinks, mayonnaise, and batteries.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Even though Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She sells saucepans in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Adwowa has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more saucepans to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 49 years old, unmarried ,and has two children aged 4 and 8 years old. They all live at home and her children attend school. Her fiancee is a driver. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc in the local market. She spends eight hours with her business six days in a week. Mostly she used taxi to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business.

loans.name: Tupee

texts.en:
Tupee is 42 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancee have four children who are in school and between the ages of five and fourteen. Her fiancee works with Firestone. 

Tupee completed ninth grade before starting her business seven years ago. She describes herself as hardworking woman. She received a little money from her fiancee to establish her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sells for ten hours, six days a week.

She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball and other goods to sell. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She would like to say thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball and other goods for her business

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es una persona de hogar y madre soltera, disfruta de dos hijos con la cuales vive y posee su casa propia. Ella, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, dicha actividad la aprendió desde su infancia y luego inicia su negocio propio cuando formo su hogar, posee 20 años de desempeñarlo.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de mariscos, tales como: pescado blanco y rojo, camarones, jaibas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir más el negocio y con ello generar más ingresos para la familia. 
Los sueños de la Sra. Teresa  son  agregar otro tipo de negocio, adquirir un local mas grande, ampliar su vivienda y sacar adelante a sus hijos, asimismo crecer como microempresario.
texts.en: Teresa is a housewife and single mother who enjoys living with her two children in her own house. She sells seafood, something she learned when she was an infant. Later she started her own business at the time she established her family. She has done this for twenty years now. The loan which she has requested will allow her to buy a variety of seafood, such as: white fish, red fish, shrimp, crabs, etc. This loan will allow her to stock her business with more variety and generate more income for her family. Teresa's dreams are to add another business to her existing one, get a larger place to sell in, expand her house, get her children ahead and grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy white and red fish, shrimp, crabs etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her Kenkey in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Esi has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her Kenkey. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children are given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her prepare more of her tasty Kenkey.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de capital de trabajo para continuar en la agricultura y por la buena atención que la Institución ofrece a sus clientes. Esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, abono, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro adquirir los materiales agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Su deseo es apoyar siempre a sus hijos en los estudios y con la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a new loan because he requires operating capital to continue farming and for the good service the Institution (PADECOMSM) provides to its clients. This investment will help him to purchase necessary agricultural inputs, such as insecticides, pesticides, and manure, among other items.

His last loan was very helpful, since he managed to acquire agricultural materials to grow corn and beans. His desires are to always support his children in their studies and to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides and manure, among other items.

loans.name: Tesaa Group

texts.en:
The Tesaa group is starting their first loan cycle with ID Ghana and Kiva. The group is made up of eleven members, and it is represented by Bernard. Members engage in varied business activities which include sale of products like silver utensils, sugar cane, pedicure products, second-hand clothing, firewood, gold enamel and underwear.

The loan they are requesting for will benefit small business owners like Bernard. He joined Tesaa this year at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, he has a business manufacturing and sells gold enamel goods like necklaces and rings. He says he started this business on advice from his parents. He travels to Obuasi, a gold mining town, to buy gold for manufacturing.

Bernard is requesting this loan to increase his merchandise and purchase more gold to produce more goods. This type of work allows him to generate income to support his family, since he is married with two children.

When asked what he likes about ID Ghana, he responded that he likes working with the group and the savings with the organization. The need of the group totals GHS 4,150 as a loan to increase their respective stock.

loans.use: To buy a lot of gold to manufacture and sell enamel like necklace, rings etc

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Nemesio tiene 38 años, esta casado con Carmen y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa hecha de adobe. Nemesio se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy niño apoyaba a su padre en las distintas actividades que este realizaba para beneficio de su economía familiar cultivando las plantas más rentables de su zona como el cacao orgánico, barbasco y árboles frutales. Es así que aprendió a usar la agricultura como como una manera de generar buenos ingresos. Al cumplir 23 años se comprometió y esto fue el motivo para buscar su independencia económica al lado de Carmen y su nueva familia motivando a su padre a cederle un pequeño terreno de cultivo para seguir con el oficio que aprendió desde muy niño. Al tener ya su primer terrenologró ahorrar y compro otro más grande en donde cultiva cacao orgánico
Tiene el agrado de trabajar siempre al lado  de su esposa que aparte de cuidar a sus hijos pequeños se encarga de preparar el almuerzo a diario para los trabajadores que contratan con la intención de culminar en menos tiempo las tareas de mantenimiento. En esta oportunidad desea solicitar  3,000 nuevos para invertir el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Nemesio, 38, is married to Carmen and has three children.  He lives with them in his adobe house.

Nemesio makes a living in agriculture.  Since he was very young he helped his father in various jobs that benefit the family finances, growing the most profitable plants in his area, such as organic cacao, barbasco, and fruit trees.  This is how he learned to use agriculture as a way to earn a good income.

When he turned 23 he got engaged, which was his reason for becoming financially independent with Carmen and his new family.  This motivated his father to give him a small plot of cropland to continue with the job he had learned as a boy.  With his first plot of land he managed to save and he bought a bigger one where he grows organic cacao.

He has the pleasure of always working alongside his wife.  In addition to taking care of their small children, she's responsible for preparing lunch every day for the workers they hire so the maintenance work will be finished in less time.

Currently he's requesting 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to invest in buying organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Dulmi

texts.es:
Dulmi es una mujer muy luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está pudiendo salir adelante, ella está estudiando la carrera en licenciatura de ciencias en la educación.
Ella quiere poder ayudar a las personas a aprender, de la misma forma que ella está estudiando. Ella es una persona que tiene como ideal el poder ser una buena profesional que sea útil a los demás.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y de sus cuotas ya que con ello podrá seguir estudiando y estar de esa forma cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Dulmi is a very determined woman who has strived and sacrificed in order to get ahead. She is studying for a degree in Education Sciences.

Dulmi wants to help people learn in the same way that she has during her studies. She is a person who has the ability to become a successful professional and can be useful to others. Dulmi is requesting this loan in order to invest in the payment of her classes and fees so that she can continue studying and get that much closer to achieving her goal.

loans.use: to pay for her university classes and fees.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (two relatives). She has a business  selling green bananas and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home and sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres integran este grupo y todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que mostró que la totalidad de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos y que deben seguir trabajando para mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familias. Son mujeres de familia que lo único que quieren es dar a sus hijos una vida diferente a la que ellas tuvieron.
Alba en su ultima encuesta de eliminación de pobreza mostró estar en el nivel uno, es decir con un nivel de ingresos muy bajo, pero ella es consciente de que debe esforzarse por mejorar y que las capacitaciones le sera de mucha ayuda. Ella se dedica a la tapicería y solicita de este crédito para la compra de distintos tipos de tapices, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su plan de negocios y mejorar así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eighteen members make up this group and all of them have taken the poverty elimination survey. The results indicated that all of them have very low incomes and should continue working in order to improve their lives and the lives of their families. These women only want to give their children a life that is different from the ones they had.

The last poverty elimination survey indicated that Alba was at Level 1. In other words, her income level is very low, but she is aware that she must strive to improve and that the training classes will be of great help. Alba works in an upholstery shop and is requesting a loan in order to buy different types of materials. This will enable her to continue working and investing in her business plan for improving her income.

loans.use: to buy upholstery materials.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 21 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. She and her fiancee live together. She completed 8th grade before establishing her business three years ago selling red oil, rice, soap, etc. in the local market. 

She started this business with a little money from her mother, and she learned this business from her older sister. She is happy that with the business she gets more money to help her fiancee with the children and schooling, and she also enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends 8 hours with her business, six days a week. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business. Her plan is to educate her children. She cheers for the supporters of BRAC Liberia who will help them.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Watta is 47, married with five children aged between 19 and 32.  Only one is currently living at home and attending school. Watta has had a shop which sells cold water, rice, drinks, etc. over the past 16 years now.  She will use the loan to buy more water, rice, drinks, etc. for her business.  On average, she works ten hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a little money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites fewer goods in her shop as her biggest challenge. She enjoys the profit making part of the business. In the future, she would like to one day own a house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more water, rice, drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Most people in this city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married to a driver; she completed 7th grade and has three children between 10 and 19 years old. They are in school, and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita, etc.. She started her business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned trading from her friends. She likes how the customers buy when she sells. She spends ten hours on her business every day, from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita, etc. for her business. She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, Vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es: María, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijas y vive con su esposo en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado a la sastrería, ya tiene 25 años de realizar esta actividad realizando reparación de piezas de ropa y confecciones de ropa como ser uniformes escolares, trajes de práctica, vestidos, pantalones etc. Ha decidido solicitar el segundo ciclo de préstamo, el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras  y los va utilizar para la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales para la confección de ropa. Este préstamo le ayudara a crecer  y aumenta la cantidad de trabajos y así mejorar los ingresos. Su objetivo es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, educar a sus hijos y llegar a instalar un taller grande de costura.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old; she has three daughters and lives with her husband in the town of Tela, Atlantida. She has always worked as a seamstress - she has been performing this occupation for 25 years now, performing repairs of articles of clothing and making clothing like school uniforms, dance costumes, dresses, pants, etc. 

She has decided to seek the second cycle of the loan, which is for 20,000 lempiras. She will use it to buy fabric, thread, and other materials to make clothing. This loan will help her to grow and increase her amount of work and in this way increase her income. Her objective is to improve the quality of life of herself and her family, educate her children, and eventually build a large sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es: Leónides de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica el trabaja de jornalero en diferentes casas que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Leónides está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Leónides is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He has a home of his own, but it does not have electricity. Leónides works as a laborer at different residences near his home. With the income he generates from his work, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

Leónides is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar lamp since the community where he lives does not receive electricity and he does not earn enough to have it installed. The lamp is also a charging station that is powered by the energy from solar panels. This type of lamp is useful for homes in rural areas that don’t have electricity. This purchase will benefit his family since they will be able to have light at night.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa esta en su ciclo número 3, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 8  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien por medio de las ventas que hace en su modesta despensa es que esta ayudando a su familia. Comenta que empezó con unos cuantos clientes, pero que luego gracias a su buena atención ha ido mejorando cada vez mas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con el tiempo ha sabido ir ganándose su espacio. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas en general y demás productos, que le permitirá tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Guapa” is in its third loan cycle. The members have taken a poverty elimination survey that indicated that eight of them are below the poverty line. In other words, their incomes are very low but they are working and striving to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. She generates sales from her modest store so that she can help her family. Maria says that she started with a few customers, but thanks to her good service, she eventually improved as time passed. She is a hardworking person who in time has been known for earning her own space. Today she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for her store such as food products, beverages, and other items. This will enable her to keep her business well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica tiene 25 años y vive junto a su esposo Gabriel en su casa propia. Yessica se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico cuyos frutos finales son bien cotizados por los compradores de la zona. De esta forma extraen el máximo provecho a sus terrenos adquiridos con el apoyo de sus padres buscando generar mejores ingresos para luego comprar otro terreno de cultivo. Para lograr una producción de calidad es necesario iniciar una campaña productiva inmediatamente a la anterior, por el cual en experiencia a su buen desempeño en el campo es necesario adquirir abono orgánico. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yessica is 25 and lives together with her husband Gabriel in their own house. Yessica works as a producer of organic cacao. Her final product is highly esteemed by the buyers in the region. In this way they extract the maximum benefit from the fields acquired with the help of their parents, with the aim of generating a higher return in order to then purchase other land for cultivation. In order to produce high quality produce successfully it is necessary to begin a production season immediately after the prior one. To achieve good yield from the field it is necessary to use organic compost. 

This is Yessica's fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead. In addition she promises to make her payments on time. Presently she wishes to receive a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles in order to purchase organic compost and fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: Jenny tiene 53 años es soltera con un hijo dependiente hace 15 años se dedica al comercio de bebidas y productos de primera necesidad y a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido de sus clientes.
