Ngu's challenge in life and work is the lack of money to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is having a full life where her children can grow up well, be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps that helps her get to this dream. She can buy more wood to do carpentry and to earn income and save the profit for her children’s education. 

Ngu is a hardworking woman.She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would again like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more wood to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1969. She has two children, one of whom is married. The other one is a worker and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Lan and her husband sell blankets and cushions to earn a living. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND and Lan earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. They have done this job for a long time. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

Lan's challenges in life and work are the lack of capital to invest in her business and the low consumption of customers. Her dream is to have full capital to sell, so she doesn’t need to borrow from anyone else . This loan is one of the steps to helping her reach to this dream.

Lan is a hardworking and passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more blankets and cushions for her shop. She always wants to expand her business scale.

Other members who are part of Lan's group include the following:
Hoa is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells wood products. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Thuy is 29 years old. She has three children. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her barber shop. 
Nhien is 44 years old. She has four children. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Trang is 26 years old. She has a child. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and cushions for her shop.

loans.name: Yuli

texts.es: Yuli es una joven de 20 años que vive junto a su esposo Cristian y su pequeña Ariana en su casa de madera. Yuli se dedica a la agricultura por eso cultiva algunos productos de la zona rentables como cacao orgánico y barbasco. Desde niña creció junto a sus padres quienes realizaban la misma actividad motivándola a seguir con el negocio familiar de manera independiente. Al comprometerse con Cristian encontró en el un gran compañero de trabajo con quien sale al campo todas las mañanas para realizar las distintas tareas esperando obtener frutos de calidad al final la campaña productiva para lograr vender los granos secos a buen precio en la ciudad a los compradores mayoristas. El cacao orgánico es un producto muy rentable en su localidad pero a su vez requiere también mano de obra constante para darle un buen cuidado y mantenimiento por eso aveces contrata a trabajadores del lugar para el retiro de maleza entre sus plantaciones y así evitar que estas consuman los nutrientes de sus terrenos agrícolas. Su principal objetivo es iniciar la construcción su vivienda con material noble. Este su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea solicitar 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y plantaciones nuevas de cacao.
texts.en: Yuli is 20 years old and lives with her husband Cristian and her little daughter Ariana in their wooden house. Yuli works in agriculture. She grows products that are profitable in the area. such as organic cacao and barbasco. Since she was a child she grew up with her parents who did the same activity, motivating her to continue in the family business on her own. When she got engaged to Cristian, she found in him a great work companion who goes out to the fields every morning to do the different tasks, hoping to obtain quality products at the end of the productive season so that they can sell their dry grains at a good price to the wholesalers in the city. Organic cacao is a very profitable product in her community but it also requires constant labor for care and maintenance. That is why sometimes she hires workers from the are to take out the weeds among the plants and thus keep these from consuming the nutrients from her cropland. Her main objective id to build a brick house. This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is getting to continue ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she wants to ask for 3,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer and new cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and cacao plants.

loans.name: Ballardo Anibal

texts.es: Ballardo tiene 25 años de edad, habita junto a sus ancianos padres a quiénes apoya económicamente con su labor como sastre, realizando elaboración y confección de ropa. Su mayor deseo es brindarles seguridad y mejores condiciones a sus padres, ya que la vivienda está expuesta porque se encuentra ubicada a orillas de una calle principal. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para construir el porche de su vivienda, para que sus padres cuente con la seguridad, comodidad y tranquilidad en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ballardo, 25, lives with his elderly parents who he supports economically by working as a tailor, making clothing.  His greatest desire is to give his parents safety and better conditions since the house is on one of the main streets and somewhat exposed.

He is requesting a loan to build a porch on the house so his parents will be safe, more comfortable and peaceful at home.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron, bricks, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
With help from his family, Victor, now 52, began his commercial landscaping business 11 years ago. Concentrating on cleaning up acres of land, Victor’s business, Valley Tractor Service, was doing fine but was in need of upgraded equipment.

Victor originally was in the industry working solely on residential areas, but recently he changed to maintaining larger, commercial sites. Victor kept working with what he had until one of his friends introduced him to Accion Texas Inc., the nonprofit organization with America’s largest microloan portfolio. He inquired with them for a loan and was approved. With his loan, he purchased a tractor. 

Because of the loan, Victor says his business is able to grow, as he now has the ability to obtain larger bids, and therefore, improve his earnings. The next goal for Victor is to start a website to recruit new clientele and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor to obtain larger jobs and  improve his earnings.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 to 5 years. She describes herself as patient. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a vibrant area and her primary customers are females. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of handbags and trousers. Her business goal is to own a salon within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

loans.use: To add stock of handbags and trousers

loans.name: Kleopatra

texts.en:
Kleopatra is a 25-year-old seamstress who offers her services only to females in her city. She now wants to stock up on raw fabric material. Four years ago she started her clothing repair & alterations shop and, according to her, she has been generating a good income throughout the years.

“I went to university and finished my studies with good grades, but I gave it all up because my passion then was for what I do now. I totally love it. I learned the skills on my own. While still a student, I worked in this field from home to pay off my tuition fees and help myself and my family. I love talking to people and serving them; I also happen to love very much the end result of my work and the smiles on people’s faces after they have received my services,” Kleopatra said.

loans.use: to buy raw fabric material for her females' clothing repair & alterations shop

loans.name: Santa Rosalia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosalia es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé, tiene 13 integrantes, donde cada una de ellas está poniendo todo de sí para ir mejorando su vida y ayudar a sus familias.
La señora Gladis es la tesorera del comité, ella invierte su crédito en compra de arcillas y leñas para la elaboración de ladrillos, ya que a eso ella se dedica. Es una persona que está luchando por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosalía Group in the city of Caacupé has 13 members who all do their best to improve their life situation and help their families.

Gladis is the treasurer of the group.  She plans to use the loan to buy clay and firewood to make bricks since that is what she does for a living. She is a very dedicated person who struggles for her family because she wants to give them the things she was unable to have.

She is very grateful for this opportunity which will be of much help to her.

loans.use: To buy clay and firewood.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 42 years old. She has two children. One of them has just graduated at college. The other one is learning at the 11th grade. Her husband is a hired laborer. His income is 5,000,000 VND. Lan is a farmer and she raises chickens to earn a living. She earns from her job 4,000,000 VND a month. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

Lan's challenge in life and work is lack of knowledge of breeding technology, therefore her poultry often gets disease. She also lacks money to find a job for her son. Her dream is that her children can grow up well, be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps that helps her get to this dream. She can invest in her farm to earn more income and save the profit for her children’s education.

 Lan is a hardworking woman.She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for chickens. She always wants to save more money for her family and to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Thoa's Group

texts.en:
Thoa was born in 1979. She has two children who are in the 10th and 6th grade of school. Her husband is a driver to earn a living. He earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Thoa grows rice and she earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for a long time. Besides that, she also sews to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Thoa's challenge in life and work is lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is having enough capital to expand her business, so she doesn't need to borrow from anyone else. This loan is one of steps to helping her reach this dream. She can invest in her business to gain earnings and save her profits. Thoa is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy materials and sewing machines to expand her sewing business.

Other members who are part of Thoa's group include the following:
Huong is 37 years old. She has two children. She sells motorbikes. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Dung is 38 years old. He has three children. He sells groceries. He wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in his grocery store. 
Mai is 24 years old. She has a child. She sells clothes. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Tien is 45 years old. He has two children. He cooks food to sell. He wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and sewing machines to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 37-year-old woman. She has four children. She describes herself as enterprising. 

She operates a dairy and poultry farm where she produces milk and eggs for sale. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are cooperative societies and hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge as transport. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to increase the number of cows to 10 within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 5º  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6  se encuentran en el nivel rojo, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero con ganas de ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con ingresos medios, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace la venta de comestibles y la cría de pollitos de forma independiente, también se debe destacar el ánimo de superarse que tiene y la lucha que hace.
La Sra. Carmen solicita de este crédito para la inversión en comida para sus pollitos y también insumos para seguir haciendo sus comestibles.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Rory" is in its fifth loan cycle through the women's program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey which shows that six of them are at the red level, meaning low income, with a desire to do better.

One of the members is Carmen who on the last survey was shown to be at level two, with a medium level income.  Through much effort and hard work she is improving her situation.  The work she does involves selling food and raising chickens, independently.  Her desire to get ahead and work hard is commendable.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed and ingredients to make food.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Gibrilla. He is single and has a 2-year-old child. He has one additional dependent who lives with him for schooling.  

In 2011, Gibrilla established his Internet café and designing business. He began his business because he wants to maintain his home. His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are the general public. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Gibrilla requires a loan in order to buy more materials like ink cartridges and computer accessories for use and resale. He hopes that this loan will support him through proper use. 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to establish a bigger shop for more service delivery. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more materials like ink cartridges and computer accessories for use and resale.

loans.name: Thuan's Group

texts.en:
Thuan was born in 1973. She has three children: two daughters in 8th and 9th grade and a son in kindergarten. Her husband and she make steel in a village far from her home. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND and Lien earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Thuan also breeds chicken to earn more money. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.

Thuan's challenge in life and work is lack of capital to breed chicken. Her dream is for het children to grow up well and have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps in helping her reach this dream. She would like to use this loan to buy more chickens, to gain earnings and save profits for her dream.

Thuan is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more chickens to expand her farm.

Other members who are part of Thuan’s group include:
Trinh is 37 years old. She has a child. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND  to sew gloves.
Thoi is 46 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to raise chickens.
Phuong is 31 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000VND  to repair her house.
Sau is 39 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to expand her farm.

loans.name: Nguyet's Group

texts.en:
Nguyet was born in 1972. She has two children who are workers. She is a widow. Nguyet makes iron to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 9,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Huong also raises chickens to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lack of capital to breed chickens. Her dream is to be able to build a more spacious house. This loan is one of the steps in helping her reach this dream. She can buy more chickens to breed, to gain earnings and save profits for her dream. She is a hardworking and passionate businesswoman.

Nguyet has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy more chickens for raising and selling. She’ll use the profits to build a house for her family.

Other members who are part of Nguyet’s group include:
Chinh is 35 years old. She has two children. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to open a barber shop.
Tuan is 48 years old. She has three children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to mill rice.
Hoa is 39 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise pigs and chickens.
Quy is 61 years old. He has three children. He grows rice. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for raising and selling.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera, habita en un barrio cuyos habitantes son de escasos recursos económicos y las casas son muy pobres. Ella se gana la vida vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, todos los días sale a buscar clientela, algunas veces le va bien y otras mal. Solicita este primer crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio con mas productos los cuales le queda muy poco, comprará perfume para damas y caballeros, pintura de uña, de labios, polvo compacto, entre otros, que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades y principales gastos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 59 years old. She is single and lives in a low-income neighbourhood where the houses are very poor. 

She makes a living selling cosmetics by catalogue. Every day she goes out to find clients. Somedays she has more success than others. 

She is applying for her first loan to invest in her small business by buying more products of which she has few remaining. She will buy men's and women's perfumes, nail polish, lipstick, pressed powder, and other items which will enable her to cover her primary needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's perfumes, nail polish, lipstick, compacts, and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño está en su ciclo número 4, es aún muy joven el grupo, pero ellas quieren ir aprendiendo para crecer, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza con lo cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una.
Juana es un ejemplo de persona, muy sacrificada y luchadora, está saliendo adelante gracias a que siempre pone de si y quiere capacitarse para crecer. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles,  y dice que siempre vende todo lo que hace. Es muy difícil su trabajo, pero pese a ello no se desanima y quiere seguir luchando por su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles, ya que de esa forma seguirá mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divino Niño" is in its fourth loan cycle and it is still a very young group.  The members want to learn so they can grow.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine each one's situation.

Juana is an example of a very self-sacrificing, hard-working person who gets ahead thanks to her determination and desire to get training and grow.  She sells food and says she always sells everything she makes.  Although her work is hard she does not become discouraged and wants to continue working for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other supplies to continue with her business, as this is the way to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy food supplies such as vegetables, meat, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Mamadou Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou Saliou  habite dans une des localités de la banlieue sénégalaise. Il est marié  et gère un pressing ou il exerce le lavage d’habits sales. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de gagner des revenus pour faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes et aux paiements de factures. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une porte pour le local ou il exerce son activité de même qu’une armoire afin de rendre mieux accueillant son lieu  de travail. Il souhaite rentabiliser son activité pour mieux faire face a ses charges familiales  mais aussi épargner de l’argent  qui lui servira de réaliser son projet futur qui consiste a acheter d’autres machines a laver et a sécher.
texts.en: Mr. Mamadou Saliou lives in a town in suburban Senegal. He is married and runs a dry-cleaner's shop where he washes dirty clothing. This business enables him to earn the income for coping with day-to-day expenses and for paying the bills. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for purchasing a gate for where he operates his business, as well as an armoire for making his workplace more hospitable. He would like to make his business more profitable to cope with family expenses but also to save some money. This will be used to realize his future plans consisting of purchasing other washers and dryers.

loans.use: to improve his place of business (dry-cleaning shop).

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa vit au Sénégal. C’est un homme célibataire qui évolue dans le secteur de la couture depuis 7 ans.  Grâce aux revenus qu’il gagne il parvient a participer a la dépense quotidienne au sein de la maison familiale. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une nouvelle machine plus performante qui lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité. Il démarre chaque jour sa journée a 8h pour la terminer a 20h. Son projet dans le futur consiste a acquérir de grands ateliers de couture.
texts.en: Mr. Moussa lives in Senegal. His is an unmarried man who has been working in the clothing sector for seven years. Thanks to the revenues he earns, he manages to help cover the day-to-day expenses of his family's home. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for purchasing a new, more efficient sewing machine enabling him to make his business more profitable. He starts each day at 8 AM and finishes at 8 PM. For the future, his plans include acquiring large workshops for tailors.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur lamine est un homme marié qui évolue depuis un an dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Auparavant il exerçait  l’activité de professeur. Il est sociétaire au guichet de l’UIMCEC de  sa zone d’habitation ou il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de semence (manioc) et d’un cheval pour les travaux champêtres. Il démarre sa journée à 6 heures du matin  pour la terminer à 20 heures le soir. Il souhaite avec ce financement accroitre ses revenus et son épargne. Son vœu futur est d’acquérir une grande école dans la ville et   bien développer son activité d’agriculture au village.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine is a married man who started a farming activity a year ago. Prior to that he was a teacher. He is a member of the local UIMCEC branch, where he is seeking a loan of 400,000 F to buy cassava seeds and a horse to help with the farm work. His work day is from 6 A.M. until 8 P.M. 

He hopes that this loan will help to boost his income and his savings. 

His objective is to have a large school in the city, and to have a successful farming activity in the village.

loans.use: to buy seeds and a horse.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Madame   ABY    est    une   femme   mariée   qui   vit   au   Sénégal   depuis   plusieurs   années.  Elle est employée comme femme de ménage dans le secteur des services      depuis   1  an. Parallèlement elle exerce une activité de commerce de vente de tissus dans le but de renforcer ses revenus pour  mieux faire face a ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Elle est mariée depuis plusieurs années. Elle sollicite un crédit de  150000 au guichet de l’UIMCEC  ou elle est membre. Le financement  servira  à  acheter    des   tissus   a   revendre. Elle souhaite épargner de l’argent et ouvrir une cantine dans le futur.
texts.en: Ms. ABY is a married woman who has been living in Senegal for several years. She has been employed as a housekeeper in the services sector for a year. Concurrently, she has a business selling cloth with the goal of bolstering her income for coping better with personal and family needs. She has been married for several years. Ms. ABY is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs at the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. The financing will be used to purchase some cloth to sell. She would like to save money and open a stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Association Dental 4 Group

texts.fr:
L’association Dental 4 représenté par la dame Maguette (la 1ère à partir de la gauche) et qui s’active dans la vente de divers se compose de quatre femmes qui fond toute du commerce. Elle vend de la friperie, de l’huile de palme, du citron, de la  pâte d’arachide. Elle a acquis de l’expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine et compte parmi sa clientèle, les gens de son quartier. Elle en est à son 3ème crédit à l’IMCEC ; des crédits tous remboursés sans peine et sans retard.
Maguette est mariée et mère de famille, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne, et réinvesti les bénéfices dans son activité.
Maguette aimerait diversifier son activité et faire de la vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The group Association Dental 4 is represented by Magatte (1st from the left). The group members sell a diverse array of merchandise. 

Magatte sells used clothing, palm oil, lemons, and groundnut paste. She has over ten years of experience in this activity, and her clientele consists of locals. This is her third loan cycle with IMCEC, and both previous loans were repaid without difficulty or delay. 

Magatte is married with children. She helps with the day-to-day expenses, and she reinvests her profits in her activity. She would like to further diversify her business by selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, palm oil, lemons, and groundnut paste for resale.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: La   dame  AISSATOU est   une   veuve   qui  vit  au  Sénégal   depuis  plusieurs  années.   Elle  s’active   dans  le  secteur   du  commerce    depuis   1  an et pratique l’achat et la vente de tissus.  .  Les  revenus  que lui procure son activité lui permettent  de  supporter   les  charges   familiales :   transport  et   factures. Elle  est membre d’un  guichet de l’UIMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé  2 crédits antérieurs. Actuellement  elle sollicite un prêt de 250000 frs  dans le but d’acheter des tissus à revendre. Les bénéfices de son opération pourraient l’aider a diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise   et a augmenter ses bénéfices. De ce fait elle pourra contribuer davantage  dans le paiement des   frais  de  scolarité  des enfants   et  améliorer  les  conditions   alimentaires   de   la  famille. Elle   projette  d’ouvrir   une  cantine.
texts.en:
The lady Aissatou is a widow who has been living in Senegal for several years. She has been active in the retail sector for one year and practices buying and selling fabrics. The income provided through her activity enables her to support family expenses: transportation and bills.

She is a member of a local branch of UIMCEC where she has already reimbursed two previous loans. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 250,000 francs in order to buy fabrics for resale. Profits from this operation could help her diversify her product offerings and increase her income.

She could thus contribute more towards paying the children's tuition fees and improving the family's nutritional conditions. She plans to open a canteen.

loans.use: buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Association Femmes Sengaz 4 Group

texts.fr:
Association des femmes de sengaz n°4 regroupe cinq femmes dont la présidente,  madame Mada habillée en violet et portant son enfant au dos, évolue dans le commerce de divers et de cosmétiques ; mais aussi de fruits et légumes. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et a démarré avec un capital de 100000f CFA tiré d’une épargne personnelle. Ce n’est que l’année dernière qu’elles ont fait la connaissance de l’IMCEC. Mada est mariée et mère de2 enfants : dont l’un est derrière son dos. Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la maison et a développé son épargne entre temps.
.Elle rêve d’ouvrir un grand magasin e de vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The Sengaz 4 Women's Association consists of five women whose president, Ms. Mada, is dressed in purple and carrying her child on her back.

She has been active in the retail of various products and cosmetics, but also fruits and vegetables. She has over ten years' experience in the business and started with a capital of 100,000 FCFA derived from personal savings. 

It was only last year that the group met the IMCEC institution.

Mada is married with two children: one of whom is behind her back. Thanks to the profits from her activities, she supports her husband in managing the household and at the same time has developed her savings.

Her dream is to open a store selling cosmetics.

loans.use: buy various fruits and vegetables for retail sales but also fragrances to be offered in her vicinity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mbodj

texts.fr: Madame  MBODJ  est   une femme     sénégalaise   veuve    qui   évolue  dans   le   secteur   de la couture service   depuis   5   ans. Avec les revenus de son activité elle essaie de supporter les charges de nourriture de sa famille. Elle  est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC e sa zone d’habitation. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés  a confectionner de nouveaux modèles de boubous qu’elle va exposer a la vente a l’occasion de cette veille de fêtes( korité  et tabaski). L’accroissement de ses revenus l’aiderait a mieux supporter la nourriture de sa famille et a épargner de l’argent. Son   projet  dans le futur   est   l’obtention   d’un  atelier   de   couture.
texts.en:
Mrs. MBODJ is a Senegalese widow who has been active in the area of ​​sewing services for the past five years. With the income generated by her business she tries to support her family's food requirements.

She is a member of the UIMCEC branch office in her neighborhood. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 (XOF) she will use to buy fabrics to make new models of boubou (type of African dress) she will offer for sale during this festive period (Korité and Tabaski).

The increased revenue would help her to better support her family's nutritional needs and also put money into savings. Her project for the future is to set up a sewing workshop.

loans.use: purchase of fabrics for resale after tailoring

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur  Abdoulaye vit au  sénégal. Il est marié et exerce depuis plus de 5 ans la vente de denrées alimentaire dans une alimentation générale.. Grâce a ses revenus il parvient a supporter les charges de loyer, de nourriture, de paiement de facture et de transport.. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires a revendre. Il envisage avec son financement d’accroitre ses bénéfices, afin d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. IL souhaite aussi épargner de l’argent afin de pouvoir réaliser son projet futur qui consiste a acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye lives in Senegal. He is married and for the past five years has been selling food products in a grocery store.

Thanks to his income he manages to cover rental costs, food, transportation, and pay the bills. He is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC.

He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs intended to purchase food products for resale. He expects this financing will increase his profits so he can improve his family's nutritional requirements.

He also wants to save money in order to achieve his future project, which is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy food products for resale

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Madame Marième évolue depuis 2 ans dans le commerce et la vente de d’habits prêt a porter. Elle habite au Sénégal dans une des communautés villageoises. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMC de sa localité d’habitation. Elle a déjà remboursé 11 crédits antérieurs et sollicite un nouveau prêt de 150 000 prévus pour l’achat d’habits à revendre. Elle  souhaite accroitre ses revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son vœu est d’ouvrir une boutique dans le futur.
texts.en:
For the past two years Mrs. Marième has been active in the trade and sale of ready to wear clothes. She lives in Senegal in one of the village communities.

She is a member of one of the UIMC branches where she lives. She has already repaid 11 previous loans and is seeking a new loan of 150,000 (XOF) to buy clothes for resale.

She wants to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. Her wish is to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: buy ready-to-wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady  est une dame mariée qui pratique la vente d’habits depuis 1998.. Elle vit au Sénégal et grâce aux revenus que lui génère son activité elle prend en charge les frais de transport de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits a revendre. Elle souhaite  avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de chaussure e de glace. Son rêve dans le futur est d’acquérir une cantine pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs Khady is a married lady who has been selling clothes since 1998. She lives in Senegal and with the income generated by her activity she supports the transportation costs of her family.

She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs intended to purchase clothes for resale. With the increase in profits she wants to diversify her product offerings by beginning to sell shoes and ice.

Her dream for the future is to acquire a store for the purposes of her business.

loans.use: buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima  est un homme célibataire qui exerce la vente de matelas depuis 20 ans. Grâce a son activité de commerce il parvient a prendre en charge ses frais de nourriture et les paiement de factures. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévu pour l’achat de matelas a revendre. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices il souhaite améliorer ses conditions alimentaires, épargner de l’argent afin de pouvoir dans le futur acquérir un terrain.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima is a single man who's been selling mattresses for 20 years. Thanks to his business, he manages to pay his bills and cover his food expenses.

He is a member of one of UIMCEC's local branches, and he's seeking a loan of XOF 500'000, intended to buy mattresses to resell.

With his increased profits, he wishes to improve his food conditions, and put money away in order to be able to buy a land lot in the future.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to resell

loans.name: Modou Ndigue

texts.fr: - Monsieur     MODOU  Ndigue   est   un   enseignant    marié   qui  vit  sur le territoire sénégalais  .    Il   s’active   dans   le  secteur    de  l’enseignement  depuis 5 ans.  Les   revenus  de  son  activité    lui  permettent   de   supporter  les  charges    familiales : loyer,  nourriture  et   factures. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il sollicite un crédit de  500 000frs prévu pour l’achat de semences. Pendant la période des vacances  il s’adonne a l’agriculture  dans le but de ne pas rester inactif, aussi les revenus supplémentaires qu’il gagne lui permettent de préparer la prochaine rentrée des classes et les événements prochains qui vont se succéder (fête de korité et de tabaski).Aussi il pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille avec l’accroissement de ses revenus. Son projet futur c’est avoir  une   maison.
texts.en: Mr. MODOU Ndigue is a teacher who is married and living in Senegal. He has been active in the education sector for five years. The income from his work enables him to cover family expenses:  rent, food, and bills. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for purchasing some seeds. During the vacation period, he devotes himself to agriculture with the goal of staying active. In addition, the extra income he earns enables him to prepare for the start of classes again and for upcoming events  Korité and Tabaski holidays). He can also save money and improve his family's food situation with the growth in his income. For the future, he plans to have a house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: Madame   Marie   Louise    est    une   femme   mariée   qui   habite  non loin du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre.  Elle  s’active   dans   le  secteur   du  commerce    depuis   5  ans et pratique la vente d’objets d’arts. Les   revenus  que lui procure son activité     lui  permettent   de  supporter  ses  charges : transport.  Elle  a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle  sollicite un crédit de  300000 frs  prévu pour  acheter   des   objets   d’art  qu’elle va revendre. Elle souhaite développer davantage son activité. Ainsi les bénéfices réalisés  pourront l’aider a  diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise (achat et revente de tissus). Son   projet   futur   est   l’obtention   d’une   cantine.
texts.en: Ms. Marie Louise is a married woman who lives near the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. She has been active in the commerce sector for five years and sells art objects. The income her business brings in enables her to cover her transport expenses. She has already repaid two previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for purchasing art objects she is going to resell. She would like to develop her business further. Thus, the profits earned will help her to diversify the products she sells (to buy and sell fabrics). For the future, she plans to obtain a stall for selling goods.

loans.use: to purchase art objects to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame  ADAMA    est   une  femme     veuve   qui  évolue   dans  le  secteur   du   commerce  depuis   3  ans. Elle pratique la vente de tissus. Grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité elle prend en charge la nourriture et les frais de factures de sa famille. Elle est adhérente dans l’une des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour  la réfection du plafond de la maison familiale. Ce financement pourra l’aider a disposer de locaux a louer ce participe a l’augmentation de ses revenus réguliers pour une meilleur prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en: Ms. ADAMA is a widow who has been working in the commerce sector for three years. She sells fabrics. Thanks to the income her business brings in, she is covering the food needs and the bills for her family. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for repairing the ceiling in her family home. This financing will allow her to have a place to rent out. This will help increase her regular income for taking better care of family needs.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling of her house

loans.name: Mberry

texts.fr: Mademoiselle    MBERRY  est  une femme  célibataire,  elle   habite  au  Sénégal  depuis   longtemps.  Elle  s’active   dans  le  secteur   du  commerce  depuis   10  ans.  Son   activité   consiste   à vendre   de  thioups ou   boubous   teintés,  et   les  revenus   qui   découlent  de son activité lui permettent de  prendre en charge une partie de ses besoins personnels comme le transport. C’est un ancien membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre et ou elle a déjà remboursé 10 crédits antérieurs. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour acheter des thioups  a revendre. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité de commerce  pour la rendre plus rentable. Elle projette  de diversifier les marchandises qu’elle commercialise avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices en démarrant la vente de parfums. Par la même occasion elle souhaite épargner de l’argent pour avoir un terrain dans le futur.
texts.en: Ms. MBERRY is an unmarried woman who has been living in Senegal for a long time. She has been active in commerce for ten years selling 'thioups' or dyed 'boubous' (long flowing outfits). The income her business brings in enables her to cover some of her needs, such as transportation costs. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she has already repaid ten previous loans. She is currently requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for purchasing 'thioups' to sell. Her goal is to expand her business to make it more profitable. She plans to diversify the merchandise she sells with the increase in profits from selling perfumes. Thus, she would like to save some money in order to obtain a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 'thioups' to sell

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame    AISSATOU  est  une  veuve    très  active  dans  le   secteur    du   commerce  qui capitalise une expérience de   5 ans dans son activité de vente de légumes dans le marché du quartier de sa localité d’habitation.  Les profits qu’elle gagne de son activité lui permettent de soutenir sa famille dans la gestion de leurs besoins vitaux. Elle a déjà remboursé 5 crédits antérieurs au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre. Actuellement  elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de légumes destinés  a la vente.   Elle souhaite élargir son activité de commerce, accroitre ses bénéfices et parvenir a diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite aussi épargner de l’argent et participer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle envisage  d’avoir un magasin dans le futur.
texts.en:
Ms. AISSATOU is a widow who is very active in the commerce sector. She capitalizes on five years of experience in her business selling vegetables at a neighborhood market in the town where she lives. The profits earned from her business will enable her to support her family in managing their vital needs. 

She has already repaid five previous loans at the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. She is currently requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for purchasing vegetables for resale. She would like to  expand her business, increase her profits, and achieve a diverse product offering by starting sales of palm oil. She would also like to improve her family's food situation. She envisions having a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jubbo De Ndoune Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit « Jubbo de Ndoune » est une association de deux sœurs qui font de l’agriculture et qui partagent le même champ. Elles ont décidé de s’associer pour bénéficier d’un crédit de 250000F CFA pour acheter des semences d’arachide et de l’engrais. La responsable est l’ainée, madame Aida, mariée et mère de famille, qui se trouve à gauche, participe à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Au finish, elles vont se partager les bénéfices en trois parties et chacune de son coté pourra régler ses petits besoins et la troisième partie servira à réinvestir dans l’activité.
Elles rêvent un jour de pouvoir exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux et de diversifier les cultures.
texts.en: The loan group « Jubbo de Ndoune » is an association of two sisters who are farmers sharing the same field. They decided to join together to obtain a loan of 250,000 francs CFA to purchase some peanut seeds and fertilizer. The group's official is the elder one, Ms. Aida, who is a married mother of a family. She is at the left in the photo and helps to cover her family's day-to-day expenses. In the end, the women are going to share the profits in three portions, of which two will be for each woman to address sundry needs, and the third portion will be reinvested in their work. The women dream one day of being able to make use of other farmland and to diversify their crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to cultivate a field

loans.name: Bineta Mansour

texts.fr: La   dame   BINETA   MANSOUR   est  une femme  célibataire qui n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit dans le guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre et ou elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de sacs a main qui seront destinés  a la vente. Elle est ménagère et pratique cette double activité de vente de d’articles divers dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins. Elle capitalise une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Avec son financement elle souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement, élargir  son activité et accroitre  ses bénéfices. Son intention est de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de cheveux naturels. Son rêve  dans le futur est d’acquérir une boutique.  Elle    évolue  dans  le  secteur   du  service   depuis   3   ans comme   ménagère. Les   revenus  de   cette   activité   serviront   à  diversifier   les   produits  et   services  comme   l’achat  de   cheveux  naturels.
texts.en: Ms. BINETA MANSOUR is an unmarried woman who has never had a loan from the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to purchase fabrics and handbags for resale. She is a housekeeper and also works at selling a variety of goods with the goal of bringing in the income enabling her to support herself. She capitalizes on three years of experience in this business. With her financing, she would like to bolster her capital, expand her business, and grow her profits. Her intentions are to diversify the products she sells by selling natural hair. Her dream for the future is to acquire a shop. She has been working in the service sector for three years as a housekeeper. The income from this work will be used to diversify her products or services, such as purchasing natural hair.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and handbags to sell

loans.name: "keur Safadi N° 6 Group

texts.fr:
« Keur Safadi n° 6 » est le nom donné à un groupe de crédit qui regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 5 ans. Diama est la responsable, elle est mariée et mère de famille Elle possède un champ qu’elle aimerait mettre en valeur. Elles viennent pour la première fois solliciter un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC pour acheter des semences d’arachide et de l’engrais. Le crédit leur permettra de développer leurs activités culturales.
Diama, à gauche de la photo, avec les recettes de son activité, appuie son époux dans la gestion de la maison, elle a pu améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. 
Elle rêve de varier son activité en faisant de l’embouche bovine et ovine.
texts.en:
«Keur Safadi n° 6» is the name of a loan group bring together women who have been active in agriculture for five years. Diama is the group's official. She is a married mother of a family, and she owns a field she would like to develop. The women of the group are here for the first time to request a loan from IMCEC to purchase some peanut seeds and fertilizer. The loan will enable them to develop their farm businesses. 

Diama, at the left in the photo, uses the receipts from her business to support her husband in running the home. She has been able to improve her family's food situation. Her dream is to vary her work by raising cattle and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her field

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur    MAMADOU    est  un   homme   marié  qui   vit   au  Sénégal   depuis   plusieurs   années.   Il   y  a  près  de  15 ans   qu’il   s’active   dans   le  secteur    de  la  pêche.  Il   part  en   mer   chercher   du   poisson qu’il revend   pour pouvoir faire   faire  face   à   ses   charges de chef de famille. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC  ou il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un moteur pour sa pirogue. Cet investissement pourrait l’aider a augmenter sa production et ses revenus journaliers. Ainsi il aura l’opportunité d’épargner en vue d’acheter un terrain dans le futur.
texts.en: Mr. MAMADOU is a married man who has been living in Senegal for several years. For fifteen years, he has been active in fishing. He heads out to sea to look for fish, which he sells to be able to cope with his expenses as head of household. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where he has already repaid two previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for purchasing a motor for his fishing boat. This investment would help him to increase his output and his daily income. Thus, he will have the opportunity to save money with the aim of purchasing a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Madame   SOKHNA  est  une   sénégalaise    mariée.   Depuis   4 ans  elle   évolue  dans   le  secteur       de   l’éducation   comme   enseignante. Parallèlement  elle pratique une double activité de commerce et de vente de  produits cosmétiques. Les revenus qu’elle gagne lui permettent de soutenir sa famille dans la gestion  de la nourriture. Elle  a une expérience de 4 ans dans son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite renforcer  son activité et ses bénéfices de sorte à pouvoir entamer  la commercialisation de chaussures. Son projet dans le futur consiste à agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en: Ms. SOKHNA is a Senegalese woman who is married. For four years, she has been working in the education sector as a teacher. Concurrently, she has a business selling cosmetic products. The income she earns enables her to support her family as far as nutrition. She has four years of experience in this business. She would like to bolster her business and her profits, so as to be able to begin selling shoes. For the future, she plans to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Jubbo De Ndoune N 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Jubbo de Ndoune  rassemble de braves femmes qui évoluent dans l’agriculture depuis leur bas-âge, car c’est une activité qu’elles ont hérité de leurs parents et de leurs  ancêtres. Elles habitent dans un village situé à environ quelques kilomètres de la ville principale.
La responsable du groupe s’appelle Fatou,apparait sur la photo comme ètant de plus petite taille, elle est mariée et est mère de famille. Malgré que ce soit son époux qui gère la dépense quotidienne, cela ne l’empêche  pas de participer aux dépenses familiales. C’est sa première expérience de crédit et ce dernier lui permettra d’acheter des semences d’arachide et de l’engrais pour les cultures.
Elle souhaite élargir son espace cultural pour faire du maraîchage.
texts.en:
The Jubbo de Ndoune loan group is made up of good women who have been developing farming activities since they were very young, since this is an activity they inherited from their parents and ancestors. They live in a village which lies several kilometers from the main town.

The leader of the group is called Fatou, and she is the smallest one in the photo; she is married and a mother. Although her husband manages the daily expenses, this does not prevent her from making a contribution. This is her first experience of taking out a loan and she will use the loan to buy groundnut seeds and ferilizers for her farming. 

She would like to increase her farming land so that she can do market gardening.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and fertilizer for the fields.

loans.name: Gie Keur Safadi Group

texts.fr:
Le  GIE Keur Safadi est une association qui regroupe des  personnes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis prêt de dix ans. C’est leur premier crédit aussi, crédit qui leur permettra de renforcer leur  activité d’agriculture. Le prêt leur permettra d’acheter des semences de mil, d’arachide et de l’engrais, urée. 
La dame Fatou est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle travaille dans les champs la matinée et l’après midi, elle s’occupe des travaux domestiques. 
Grace aux bénéfices de l’agriculture, elle peut désormais mettre un peu d’argent de côté et s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
Elle veut dans l’avenir, diversifier son activité en faisant du commerce de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The Keur Safadie GIE (economic interest group) is an association which groups together people who have been farming for nearly ten years. This is their first loan, which will enable them to boost their farming activities. It will enable them to buy millet and groundnut seeds, as well as fertilizer and urea.

Fatou is in charge of the group and she is married and a mother. She works in the fields during the mornings and afternoons and also takes care of domestic chores. Thanks to the profits she makes from her farming she is is now able to put a little money aside and take care of her children's education. In the future she would like to diversify her business by selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Gie Keur Safady 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Keur Safady 2 est une association qui regroupe cinq femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis plus de dix ans. Elles n’ont jamais bénéficié de crédit  à l’IMCEC et voulant augmenter leur capacité de production dans les champs, elles ont fait recours à une Institution financière pur les appuyer.
La responsable, madame Khodia la plus petite de taille, mariée et mère de famille va appuyer son époux dans les champs. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des semences d’arachide et de mil et  de l’engrais pour cultiver.
Avec les bénéfices, ils pourront gérer la dèpense quotidienne de la famille et améliorer les conditions de vie du foyer.
Et si le capital augmente, ils pourront exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux.
texts.en:
The Keur Safady 2 GIE (economic interest group) is an association of five women who have been farming for more than ten years. They have never had a loan from IMCEC, but since they want to increase their production capacity in the fields, they have now turned to the financial institution for help.

Khodia, who is in charge of the group, is the smallest of the women in the photo, and she is married and a mother; she helps her husband in the fields. With this loan she is going to buy groundnut and millet seeds as well as fertilizer for farming. With the profits, they will be able to manage the daily family expenses more easily and improve the household's living conditions. Furthermore if the capital increases, they will be able to farm other pieces of land.

loans.use: to buy millet and groundnut seeds as well as fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Thièlème

texts.fr:
Monsieur Thièlème un agriculteur avéré fait aussi de l’embouche en même temps. Il a acquis une expérience de dix ans. Il est marié et père de famille Et loge dans un petit village situé non loin de la ville principale. Thièlème fait de l’embouche bovine et possède un troupeau qu’il envoie paitre lui-même de 6h du matin à 15h du soir.
Grace aux revenus de l’activité, il gère sa famille et leurs besoins au quotidien. Il épargne pour pouvoir construire sa propre maison et mettre sa famille dans de bonne condition.
Il désire agrandir davantage son cheptel et diversifier son activité en y associant des ovins et des caprins.
texts.en:
Thièlème is an experienced farmer who is also involved in cattle fattening.  He has ten years of experience in his field of work.  A married man and a father, he resides in a small village located not far from the main city.  He fattens cows and owns a herd which he allows to graze from 6 AM until 3 PM.

Thanks to his earnings, Thièlème is able to take care of his family and of their daily needs.  He saves money, so that he can build his own house one day and provide good living conditions for his family.

He would like to further increase his livestock headcount and diversify his activity by adding sheep and goats to his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr:
Monsieur Waly qui loge dans un petit village situè à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale ,s’active dans l’élevage de bœufs depuis dix années. Il a démarré par un petit capital et un petit nombre de bovin. Il vient solliciter pour la troisième fois un petit crédit de 130.000F CFA.Puisqu'il possède dèjà un certain nombre de boeufs et qu'il vise toujours à agrandir son cheptel,ce pret lui servira à acheter du bètail. Waly est très vigoureux et travaille de 6h du matin à 14h du soir. 
Il s’occupe des charges domestiques et de l’éducation de ses enfants en leur assurant une bonne école pour une bonne formation.
Avec le crédit, il peut désormais  épargner, avoir l’ambition d’acheter une maison et de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Il a comme ambition de développer son élevage pour avoir plus de tête de bœufs.
texts.en:
Waly resides in a small village located a few kilometers away from the main city and he has been actively involved in raising cattle for the past ten years.  He started with a small capital and a small number of cows.

It is the third time that Waly is requesting a loan, in the amount of 130,000 CFA francs. Since he already owns a number of oxen and he always aims to grow his livestock, he will use this loan to buy cattle. He is a very strong man, who works from 6 AM until 2 PM.

Waly takes care of the household's expenses and of his children's education, sending them to a good school, so that they can have a good education.

Thanks to credit, Waly can now save some money, which he would like to use to buy a house and improve his family's food conditions.  Professionally, he would like to expand his livestock raising business and increase his cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Asc Lion Group

texts.fr: L’ASC  Lion est le nom donné à une association qui évolue dans le secteur de l’agriculture  depuis plusieurs années déjà. L’association est représentée par deux frères Abass et Babacar. L’association possède un champ en commun qu’elle veut mettre en valeur. Avec le crédit octroyé par l’IMCEC, ils vont pouvoir acheter des semences de mil, de l’engrais et de l’urée. Les bénéfices tirés de l’activité serviront à développer d’autres activités naissantes dans l’association comme le commerce, l’élevage, la culture maraichère… L’association possède un volet social qui intervient dans l’insertion des enfants les plus démunis et vise à améliorer leurs conditions de vie et leur éducation. L’association aura toujours besoin d’un appui financier pour mener à bien ses activités, c’est pourquoi elle collabore étroitement avec l’IMCEC.
texts.en: The ASC Lion is  an association that has been active in the agricultural sector for some years now. The association is represented by two brothers, Abass and Babacar. The association has a common land plot that its members would like to utilize. With the loan obtained from IMCEC, the association members will be able to buy millet seed fertilizers and urea. The revenues derived from this business will allow them to develop other emerging business activities, such as retail, animal husbandry and vegetable gardening. The association has a social component to its activities, helping the most disadvantage children improve their life conditions and obtain an education. The association has always needed financial support in order to manage its activities well, which is why it is collaborating with IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy millet seeds, fertilizers and urea for working their land.

loans.name: Gie Fatoumata Zahra Niass Group

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur est un GIE qui porte le nom de Fatoumata Zahra Niass, de son homonyme la fille de leur marabout. Le GIE regroupe plusieurs femmes qui s’activent toute dans l’agriculture. Elles travaillent dans les champs la matinée et l’après midi est réservé aux travaux domestiques, la préparation du repas du soir et les autres petits travaux de la maison. 
Le GIE fait parti des premiers clients du guichet de cette IMCEC, où il a déjà eu deux crédits payés convenablement. Pour cette fois ci, le crédit sera destiné à l’achat de semences de mil, d’engrais et d’urèe. 
La responsable, madame Amy, habillée en blanc avec une écharpe rouge, est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et règle aussi ses petits besoins avec les bénéfices tirés de l’activité. 
Elles veulent diversifier les activités du GIE et pour cela, ont besoins d’un fond de roulement consistant, ce qui entraine le partenariat avec l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
The borrower is a GIE (Economic Interest Group) called Fatoumata Zahra Niass, named for the daughter of their marabout (holy man). This GIE is composed of several women who are all active in agriculture. They work in the fields in the morning, and the afternoon is reserved for housework, preparation of the evening meal, and other small tasks around the home.

This GIE was one of the first customers of this branch of IMCEC, where they have already had two loans properly repaid. This time, the loan will be used for the purchase of millet seeds, fertilizers and urea.

The representative of the group, Amy, dressed in white with a red scarf, is a married woman and mother. She helps her husband with the household expenses and also pays for her daily needs with the income she earns from farming.

The group wants to diversify the activities of the GIE, and for this they need to have a consistent income, which has resulted in their partnership with IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase millet seeds, fertilizers and urea for farming.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Ndiebel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Takku Liggey Ndiebel est un regroupement mixte d’hommes et de femmes qui évoluent dans le secteur de l’agriculture. Ils se sont associés  et ont approchés  l’IMCEC pour le financement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus telle l’agriculture qui est la principale.
La dame Marie, qui est la responsable du groupe possède un héritage de terre qu’elle exploite depuis plus de cinq ans maintenant. Elle va acheter des semences et de l’engrais. Elle travaille avec son époux dans les champs et son fils ainé qui les aide aussi. La gestion de la dépense quotidienne est alors une affaire pour toute la famille.
L’ambition pour madame Marie est de construire un grand poulailler et d’élever des poulets de chair.
texts.en: The loan group Takku Liggey Ndiebel is a mixed group combining men and women who work in the agriculture sector. They joined together and approached the microfinance institution IMCEC to finance their revenue-generating businesses, such as farming, which is the main one. Ms. Marie, who is the group's official, owns an inherited plot of land she has been putting to use for over five years now. She is going to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. She works with her husband in the fields along with her oldest son, who helps too. Thus, managing the day-to-day expenses is entirely a family affair. Ms. Marie has the ambition to build a large chicken coup and to raise chickens for roasting or frying.

loans.use: to purchase millet seeds and fertilizer to cultivate their field

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou habite dans la région sud au Sénégal,père de 10 enfants . 3 enfants sont à Dakar , 3 filles sont mariées ,un garçon est chauffeur de taxi et les 3 autres sont des élèves au collège . Depuis 20 ans il fait le commerce du céréale dans son quartier ,il avait bénéficié de 2 crédits de 50 000f et de 250 000f au sein de l'imcec qu'il a remboursé à l'échéance sans difficulté .Il sollicite un nouveau crédit de 250 000f pour acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur pour associer ses filles dans son commerce de la crème de la glace en cette période des vacances .Avec ses activités ,Abdou assure toutes les charges de nourriture d’électricité et paye les frais scolaires.Il souhaite avoir une chambre froide dans le grand marche de la localité .
texts.en: Abdou lives in the southern region of Senegal and is father to 10 children. 3 children are in Dakar, 3 daughters are married, one son is a taxi driver and the 3 others are students at the college. For 20 years he has been selling cereals in his neighborhood. He benefited from 2 loans of 50,000f and 250,000f from UIMCEC which he repaid by the settlement date without difficulty. He is requesting a new loan of 250,000f to buy a new refrigerator to make his daughters partners in his ice cream business during this holiday period. With his businesses, Abdou ensures all the responsibilities of food and electricity and pays the school fees. He hopes to have a cold room in the large market of his locale.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Before Kenneth entered the retail business, people approached him to help sell music CDs to the public. For about two years, Kenneth says it was more of a hobby, but as of March, 2013, Kenneth turned his hobby into a full-time business after people started asking for music from his personal library.

Kenneth worked on obtaining music from rappers in the Houston area and selling it to rap lovers in the Dallas area. As the business demand grew, he knew the next thing to do would be to open a store where people could drive to him, instead of making deliveries as he once did.

Now that Kenneth has an established location for his business, he needed a loan to market it, purchase inventory and pay rent. He turned to nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. when a quick Google search introduced him to it, and he was approved for funds to help support his business. He now purchases music wholesale directly from musicians.  

Before the loan, Kenneth marketed his business at barbershops and car washes and relied heavily on word-of-mouth.  Because of the loan, he is now able to keep his store shelves full of local music, support other musicians during a time when piracy is the norm, create a living for those musicians, and become a successful entrepreneur. 

When he’s not at the shop, Kenneth has another job as a landscaper, but the income from that job is invested mostly in the store’s costs. He also uses those earnings to create music of his own.

loans.use: to market his music store, purchase inventory and pay rent.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1966. She has three children who all are employed as workers. Her two daughters have their own families. Hien is a widow. Hien sells rice noodles in the market to earn a living. She earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Hien has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.

Hien's challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy more rice noodles to expand her business. Her dream is having a more spacious house and that her business is easier. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She can invest in her business to gain earnings and save profit for her family’s life. 

Hien is a hardworking woman and has passion for business. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to expand the scale of her rice noodle business.

loans.use: to buy more rice noodles to expand the scale of her business.

loans.name: Thi's Group

texts.en:
Thi was born in 1970. She has two sons. One child has got married. The other one just graduated from high school. Thi’s husband grows rice and raises chickens. He earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She sells coconuts and vegetables in a market. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. 

Besides that, Thi also helps her husband with his work. Her challenge in work is lacking capital for her business. Her dream is having more capital to invest in her business and her children having a stable job. This loan is one of the step that helps her reach this dream. She is a hardworking woman. 

This is the first  time Thi has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more coconuts and vegetables to sell in the market.

The other members who are part of Thi’s group include the following:
 
Tuyen is 39 years old. She has a child. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

Quynh is 24 years old. She has a child. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell breakfast.

Thanh is 54 years old. She has four children. She cooks breakfast to sell in a market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

Dung is 51 years old. She has two children. She is a motorbike keeper. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and vegetables to sell in a market.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong is 28 years old. She has two children who are learning at the 1st and 4th grades. Her husband is an iron worker to earn a living. He earns about 6,000,000 VND per month.

Phuong makes Vietnamese traditional cakes to sell in a market. She has done this job for five years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Phuong also breeds pigs to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is that her facilities for making cakes is manual, she needs to handle every thing, and she has very few customers. Her dream is to make more kinds of cakes to support other restaurants and to have communication with customers every day. This loan is one of the steps to help her get to this dream. She can buy more rice and onions to make cakes. Phuong is a hardworking and careful woman.

This is the first time she participated in SEDA's microfinance program. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more rice and other ingredients to make more cakes. She always wants to expand her business to gain earnings and save profits to raise her children up well.

The other member who is part of Phuong's group is Thuy, who is 35 years old. She has two children. She breeds chickens to get eggs. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to invest in her breeding.

loans.use: to buy more rice and other ingredients to make more cakes

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1991. She has two children who are still little. Her husband is a truck driver to earn a living. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month.

Lan is a worker and she earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for three years. Besides that, she also grows rice and sells gas to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to expand her business work. Her dream is having full capital and raising her children up well. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. Lan is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy more gas bottles for her gas store. She always wants to expand her business work.

Other members who are part of Lan's group include the following:
Binh is 30 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to sell beverages. 
Viet is 34 years old. He has a child. He is a barber. He wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy tools for hairdressing.
Thang is 36 years old. She has two children. She washes cars, motorbikes and sells telephone cards. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to invest in her business.
Trang is 28 years old. She has two children. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy tools for hairdressing.
Cuong is 34 years old. He has three children. He is a worker. He wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy his household furniture.

loans.use: to buy more gas bottles for her gas store

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 49 years old. She has two children. One of her children has gotten married and the other one is a carpenter. Her husband is an electrical repairer to earn a living. Her husband earns about 6,000,000 VND per month.

Thu breeds pigs, chickens and grows rice. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking knowledge about breeding. Her dream is to open a carpentry store at home for her son and open an electrical appliance repair store for her husband. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream.  She would like to use this loan to buy more electrical repair equipment for her husband. Thu is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy electrical repair equipment. She will use the profit to build her house and open a carpentry store for her son. When her husband and her son have stable jobs, she believes she will have an assurance of a stable life.

loans.use: to buy electrical repair equipment

loans.name: Dua

texts.en:
Dua is 49 years old. She has four children. The oldest one has gotten married. The second child is learning in a university. The third child is a barber. The last one is learning at the 4th grade level. 

Her husband breeds pigs and has a beverage stall. His income is about 3,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Dua also sells beverages with her husband, and she earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for six months. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking the experience to sell beverages. 

Her dream is to open a restaurant to sell breakfast. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She can buy tables, chairs and a cooler. Dua is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more tables, chairs and a cooler for her beverage stall. She always wants to grow her children up well.

loans.use: to buy more tables, chairs and a cooler for her beverage stall.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 59 years old. She has three children. Two of them have got married. The other one is a carpenter. Ly and her husband raise chickens and pigs to earn a living. Her husband earns about 3,000,000 VND and Ly earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Ly has done this job for 26 years. 

Ly's challenge in work is lack of capital to build breeding facilities for chickens and pigs. Her dream is having a large breeding farm. This loan is one of the step that helps her reach this dream. She can use this loan to buy feed for chickens and pigs and buy more chickens to breed. She is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. 

Ly has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to raise fighting cocks. She will use profits to build breeding facilities and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to raise fighting cocks.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 53 years old. She has three children who have their own families. Her husband works as a building guard to earn a living. He earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. To earn a living, Oanh raises pigs and fighting cocks. She has done this job for twenty-five years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to breed. 

Oanh's dream is to be able to build larger and nicer breeding facilities to raise more chickens. This loan is one of the steps that helps her get to this dream. She can buy more chicken feed to gain earnings and save profit for her dream. 

Oanh is a hardworking woman. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy feed for raising pigs and chickens and to expand her breeding.

The other member who is part of Oanh's group: 

Binh is 48 years old. She has seven children. She catches fish to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy fishing nets.
