loans.use: to buy food for raising pigs and chickens and to expand her breeding.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 49 years old. She has a child who is learning at the 4th grade. Her husband is a driver who transports goods in a market. His income is about 6,000,000 VND per month.

Hoa sells bamboo shoots, noodles, pigs and chickens and she earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 12 years. Besides that, she also works for hire to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are a lack of capital to sell her goods. Her dream is to buy a car to transport her goods. This loan is one of the steps to help her to reach this dream. She can buy more noodles to retail. Hoa is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more noodles to retail. She always wants to raise her child up well.

Other members which are part of Hoa's group include the following:
Dung is 31 years old. She has four children. She sells fruits. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to do carpentry.
Vinh is 41 years old. She has three children. She raises pigs. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in her breeding.
Thao is 45 years old. She has three children. She raises pigs and grows rice. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy agricultural tools.

loans.use: to buy more noodles to retail

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is a 44-year-old widow and has two children, one who works and the other who is at university. Oanh sells groceries to earn a living, earning about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. She has done this job for 20 years and her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in working is a lack of capital to invest in her grocery store and a lack of sentiment in her life. Her dream is having more capital to buy more kinds of goods for her store, and that her children will have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps that will help her achieve her dream. She will be able to buy more goods to sell, earn greater profits and save these for her dream. 

Oanh is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessperson. She has participated in SEDA’s micro finance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more beverages, noodles and salt for her grocery store so that she can improve her earnings and save for her family.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, noodles and salt for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is appreciative for the previous Kiva loan that enabled her to add more stock to her store and generate profits.
She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt and cereals such as rice and beans for her business.
She has joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt and cereals such as rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
This is Marjana, who is being photographed in front of her animals’ stable, which she wants to rebuild and make more spacious with your help.
Marjana is a 44-year-old married mother of four children; her oldest is 22 and her youngest is 18. People in her village have commented that she is a very positive lady with a lot of positive energy all the time. “She is always smiling and loving and anyone can sense that from her. One of her children was disabled at birth, yet we never saw Marjana looking sad or tired… that’s the kind of mother and spouse she is,” said one of the villagers to the loan officer.
This will be Marjana’s first loan. Up until now, for almost eighteen years, she has been practicing livestock and has been able to make an okay income selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and baby calves to locals.

loans.use: to rebuild the existing stable and make it more spacious

loans.name: Noi

texts.en:
Noi is 50 years old. She has two children. A son is a carpenter. A daughter is learning at the 12nd grade. Noi’s husband and Noi cook food to sell. Her husband earns about 3,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Besides that, Noi also does carpentry to earn more money. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 10 years. Her family’s total income is about 18,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to invest in her family’s business. Her dream is for her daughter to pass the university entrance exam. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach her dream. She can care for her daughter’s education and invest capital in her business.  

Noi is a hardworking and careful woman. 

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 2,016,000 VND to buy more ingredients to cook. She would like gain earnings and save profit for her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
Oscar, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar tornillos, llaves, tenazas, pistola de aire, entre otros. 
El préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar su negocio y aumento la clientela. Las condiciones económicas se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Oscar requires a new loan because he needs additional working capital to sustain his business. Oscar will use these loan funds to purchase screws, keys, pliers, an air gun, and other tools. 

Oscar's previous loan allowed him to improve his business and grow his customer base. His financial situation has improved.

loans.use: To purchase screws, keys, pliers, air gun, and other tools and supplies.

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap, 43, lives in a rural village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district in Cambodia. She is widowed and has six children. For the last 29 years, she has been farming rice on 3 hectare of farmland. The current business earns her about 7,000 per day but she can manage to save about 3,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Heap is just with VisionFund this cycle, and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to make more income for her family so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en:
At 35 years old, Rith is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of the Siem Reap province. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is the sixth loan for Rith with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Rith is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lerk's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the village of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Lerk is 43 years and married with four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. 

For more than 23 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs as primary sources of the family’s income to make a living; they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Lerk just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan.

As the leader, Lerk is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, as well as to use to plow her field. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 47 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been farming rice; her husband is a fisherman. The current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day to make a living and they can afford to save 5,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Yorn has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Yorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, as well as use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. 

With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income in order to make a better living, and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Chanthou is a 45-year-old mother of five children. She is a farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for several years, she can make daily income from her current business of about 35,000KHR and is able to save about 20,000KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the fifth loan for Chanthou with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to pay labor fees. She hopes to earn a higher crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Noern, 35, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care her children by farming rice. She has been in the business for 16 years while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 29,000KHR per day and manage to save about 8,000KHR each day for the future.
 
Noern has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Noern wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve the family’s financial burden. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on buying more plots of farmland. She hopes to grow her rice well and raise more healthy crops to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Koern

texts.en:
Koern, 50, is a married woman living with her seven children in a rural village of the Chheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is earning about KHR37,000 per day and is able to save about KHR20,000 each day after expenses for future needs. 

Koern is a first cycle client with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to get a high crop yield so as to respond to her customers’ needs on time. She also hopes to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is a 37-year-old mother of four children and earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava. Her husband is a paid worker to gain extra income to support the family. All of their children are still in school. Phal has been in this business for 17 years and the current business earns her about 19,000KHR per day to feed the family.

Phal is a third cycle client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and her business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Phal is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zenfira

texts.en: Zemfira by nature is an industrious and capable organizer. For more than 17 years she has been engaged in an agricultural business. She has 3 cows and 200 chickens and chicks. Zenfira's husband works as a tractor driver and earns a salary. They have three children, ages 19, 17 and 14. Zenfira's daughter is getting married. She will plan her wedding party and will provide her with a dowry. The reason Zenfira has applied for money is to pay for their daughter's wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To pay for the wedding ceremony of their daughter.

loans.name: Sopheary's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sopheary is aged 30 years and married. She has two children who are still small. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing beans for 11 years. This business earns her family about 32,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sopheary has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor fees. She hopes to grow more crops from her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de ellas tienen el deseo de crecer y salir adelante, quieren crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona, es por eso que tienen muchas expectativas.
La Sra. Daniela es costurera, hace todo tipo de confecciones, ya sea de prendas como de otro tipo, es muy conocida por el trabajo que hace, y gracias a sus buenas confecciones esta saliendo adelante y tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Solicita hoy de ese crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que tiene varios pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its sixth loan cycle. Each and every member of the group wants their business to grow and improve. The members want reap not only financial gains, but personal ones as well, and their expectations therefore are high. 

Señora Daniela is a seamstress who makes all styles of dresses, from formal gowns to casual wear. Her reputation for high-quality work has allowed her to earn more income and provide for her family. Señora Daniela is now applying for a loan in order to purchase fabric and thread, as she has several orders and wants to continue satisfying her customers.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Be's Group

texts.en:
Be is 39 years old. She has six children. Two of them have got married and are working in a company. The other children are learning at secondary school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a building worker to earn a living. His income is about 6,000,000 VND per month. Be breeds pigs and chickens and she earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 20 years. Besides that, she also works for hire to earn more money. 

Her family’s total earnings are about 14,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to expand her breeding facilities. Her dream is to be able to build larger and cleaner breeding facilities. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She will be able to buy more chickens and pigs to breed. 

Be is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy more pigs and chickens to expand her breeding. She always wants to raise her children well.

Other members who are part of Be's group include the following: 

	Huong is 30 years old. She has two children. She works for hire. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to breed chickens.
 
	Gai is 53 years old. She has four children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to invest in her breeding activity.

	Tinh is 43 years old. She has four children. She works for hire. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy agricultural tools.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens to expand her breeding.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y diez de las mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos, pero que pese a ello están luchando y tratando de mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Sunilda, en su encuesta mostro estar en el nivel uno. Ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar, este es el sustento principal de su familia, y con lo cual les puede ayudar. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, carne, enlatados y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y surtir así su local.
texts.en:
“United Women” is making the effort to eliminate poverty, and 10 of these women have very low incomes. Despite this, they are fighting back and attempting to improve their lives. 

Sunilda is at 'level 1' according to her survey results. She is improving her poverty situation, but she is also conscious of the fact that the work and effort she is making needs to continue and become permanent if she is to accomplish total success and achieve a better life for her family. Sunilda has a well-stocked store which with much sacrifice she has been able to establish. This is her family's principal source of sustenance – with this she can help them. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and in the future, she hopes to offer employment to others.

Sunilda is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing drinks, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and other merchandise so that she can continue sales and restock her shop.

loans.use: buy drinks, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Emanuel; está en su ciclo número  4  ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren capacitarse para mejorar sus vidas. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas en su casa utilizara su crédito para la compra de aceite, carne, harina, huevos, entre otros para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
Ella es la presidenta y comenta que siempre inspira a sus amigas a ir luchando y mejorando por su familia. Es consciente de que todas tienen que poner todo de si para mejorar sus vidas. Ellas estan agradecidas por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo que les abrirá muchas puertas para seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
This group, called Emanuel, is in its fourth loan cycle. The women in the group are the heads of their households and are seeking resources to improve their lives. One of the members is Carmen, who makes and sells food in her home. She will use her loan to buy oil, meat, flour, eggs, and other products so that she can keep cooking.
Carmen is the president of the group and notes that she always inspires her friends to keep struggling and improving for their families. She knows that all of them have to give 100 percent to better their lives. They are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, which will open many doors to them and help them keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, flour, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Madres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalia, quien tiene ventas de ropa usada y a la vez es limpiadora, ella es una persona que se esta esforzando el doble por salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida y sus ingresos, quiere poder dar a su familia todo lo que esta a su alcance y que no pasen necesidades, a la vez que también quiere capacitarse para ir mejorando su vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropa, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Madres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Mothers). It is in its fifth cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other move forward in life. They are doing the survey on eliminating poverty, and six of them are below the poverty line.
One of the members is Rosalia, who sells used clothing and cleans houses. She works twice as hard so that she can be successful and improve her life and her income. She wants to be able to offer her family everything they need and to develop her own skills so she can move ahead.
Rosalia is requesting this loan to buy clothes, which will help her solidify her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is a conspiratorial and shy woman. So in the picture you will see only her children. They are 24, 22 and 19. Her eldest daughter is working in the registration department of a small company. 

Kamala has been engaged in farming for more than 18 years. She sells milk, dairy products and animals for their meat. After a long term request of her children, she decided to build a new bathhouse. The old bathhouse is inadequate. They have to heat water in a bucket and carry heavy buckets to the bath. She applied for 1,500 AZN for the implementation of her children's wish.

loans.use: To build a bathhouse.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Pov is now 35 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Pov and her husband are farmers who grow rice and plant cassava as their main business to support the family. Having been in the business for 15 years, they are able to make daily earnings of about 25,000KHR and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Pov with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Pov is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops well to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sila is now 35 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are still in school. Sila and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava, and they have engaged in the business for 15 years. The current business earns them about 30,000KHR per day to support the family’s needs, and they can afford to save about 15,000KHR each day. 

Sila is a third cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income for her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sila wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and will use a portion to pay labor fees. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to make a more healthy rice crop to make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Sokha, 37, is widowed with two children. She has been earning a living through selling fish and also by working for others for a fee. Having been in the fish selling business for eight years, she can earn about 100,000KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs, and she manages to save about 20,000KHR each day. 

Sokha is with VisionFund for just this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sokha is going to use her portion to buy more fish to resell. She hopes to earn more income for her family so as to make better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Riang Ov district, Sohpea is 24 years old and married with two children. She has been growing cassava for several years to make a living. She can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from the current business and manages to save about KHR5,000 daily for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sophea with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado ROSA MISTICA está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comités, ellas se unieron con la esperanza de ir creciendo y mejorando la vida de cada una de las integrantes, son luchadoras y tienen un gran entusiasmo de progresar y crecer, quieren crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Florentina, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón, comenta que le está yendo cada vez mejor, pues el carbón es más accesible y sus clientes lo prefieren. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y está luchando por mejorar su vida y sus ingresos. Se unió al grupo con la esperanza de ir creciendo y mejorando tiene el deseo de poder tener algún día un negocio propio y así también poder ayudar a otras personas.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carbón, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que es una gran oportunidad para ella y sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística [Mystic Rose] group  is in its 11th loan cycle. The members came together with each one sharing hopes of achieving growth and improving their lives. They are tenacious women with a great passion for striving and growth. They hope to achieve not only financial gains, but also personal ones as well.  

Señora Florentina is one of the members of Rosa Mística. She sells charcoal and notes that business is always improving as charcoal is widely available and her customers prefer it. 

Señora Florentina is accustomed to making sacrifices and striving to boost her income and improve her life. She joined Rosa Mística with hopes of achieving growth and improving her life. She hopes to open her own business some day and also to be able to provide help to others. 

Señora Florentina is applying for this loan so that she can purchase charcoal, which will help her meet her business plan and thus boost her income. Señora Florentina is grateful for the assistance that she's receiving as it represents a great opportunity for her and her colleagues in Rosa Mística.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon is very grateful to Kiva lenders, thanks to the loan they offered last February 2013, which enabled him to buy a motorcycle. He mentioned that the loan was a great support to his family, facilitating their transportation needs. After paying off the loan, he hopes to have another loan opportunity to build a bathroom to keep his family healthy and support their well-being. Being a hardworking and enthusiastic father, he will continue working to advance his teaching career and farming, and provide a comfortable lifestyle to all his family members. Despite having loans from HKL, Nuon has never been with any state banks before because HKL offered him trust services, a suitable loan term, and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to build a bathroom to keep his family healthy and support their well-being.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Kitale area of the North Rift region, a very fertile area for maize production. He is married and has two children who are yet to start going to school. He has practiced farming for three years, where his primary source of income is maize, beans, and milk which he sells at Teldet market. He has a motorbike that he uses for transportation as an extra source of income.

He wants to expand his milk production by adding a dairy cow and therefore has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing it. This loan will help him boost his income level; that will help him to build a good foundation for his young family. He says that in five years the loan received will have helped his farming to grow larger and better.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Changandevu Group

texts.en:
Loyce, who is in her early 40s, is married with one son who is still going to school. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6:00 am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Loyce's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying new plates and chairs, and to buy missing items in the food store. She dreams of owning a big hotel.

Loyce will share this loan with her loan group "Changandevu" with sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new plates and chairs, and to buy missing items in the food store

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comite San Cayetano son  de la zona de San Lorenzo son 16 integrantes  muy responsables. Casi todas participaron de la eliminación de pobreza en el año 2012.
Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas para que así puedan salir adelante juntas.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Claudia, quien humildemente se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, que con mucho esfuerzo hace. Ella está dispuesta a seguir luchando todo sea por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales que le permitirá seguir con su venta y luchando cada día por mejorar.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank is from the San Lorenzo area.  They are 16 very responsible members.  Almost all of them participated in the poverty elimination survey in 2012.  All of them are very responsible and hard-working mothers.  They always meet in order to resolve any group problem. They always help their community, and they also always help each other so that they are able to get ahead together.

Claudia is one of them.  She humbly sells natural remedies, and she puts forth great effort.  She is prepared to continue struggling as everything is for her family.  She wants to give them everything they need so that they do not have to do without any of the necessities.

She is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies, which will allow her to continue with her sales as she struggles every day in order to improve.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is 43 years old. She has two children. A son is a carpenter. A daughter is in the 11th grade. Her husband sells groceries to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Duc grows rice and helps her husband selling groceries. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total income is about 17,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges in work are having more competitors and having a considerable amount of customers on credit. Her dream is to be able to open a level one sales agency. This loan is one step to help her reach her dream. She can expand her grocery store. Duc is a hard working and careful woman. 

She has participated in SEDA’s micro finance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more kinds of goods such as beer, noodles, beverage, and salt for her grocery shop, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of goods such as beer, noodles, beverage,and salt for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa has been a member of PMPC for seven years. She has a new business in the fish industry, selling dried fish for a living. Elsa is 61 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has three children. She has applied for a loan to buy additional fishing materials and accessories. In the future, Elsa hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials and accessories.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La Sra Teodora está casada con el Sr Francisco, con quien tiene hijos, todos ya mayores, quienes son estudiantes universitarios, ella tiene una despensa y mercería en su casa, y el marido presta servicios  en su taxi.
Gracias al trabajo que realizan sus hijos estudian en la universidad. Ella  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. Comenta que gracias a su servicio brinda un buen   trato a sus clientes, Solicito este crédito para la compra de un congelador  ya que no abastece con lo que tiene. Sueña con agrandar el negocio y dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Teodora is married to Francisco, and they have children.  All of them are grown, and they are university students.  She has a food and haberdashery store in her house.  Her husband provides services in his taxi.

Thanks to the work that they do, their children attend the university.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible person who is honest with her commitments.  She says that thanks to her service, she offers her customers a good deal. 

She requested this loan to buy a freezer.  The one that she has will not suffice.  She dreams of expanding the business and being a source of work for other people.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Luis, I am 67 years old and have been married for the last 44 years. When I got married I started my tortilla shop, with this business I have been able to support my family and give them a decent life.

I will use this credit to buy tortilla flour and for other working capital needs. I am a responsible person who always fulfills his commitments. My biggest accomplishment in life is to own two houses and to provide a job for my children.

loans.use: to buy tortilla flour and have working capital

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en: Jati Ayu group is applying for its third loan from MUK. For eight members, the loan totals 20,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and to repair pens. Ni Nengah, as the head of the group, will use her loan to buy three superior piglets and feed. The price for a superior piglet is currently very high, ranging from IDR 400,000 to 500,000. These pigs will be maintained for five months, for fattening. Ni Nengah expects that, during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she hopes to fix up her house.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en: Lenelyn is married and lives in Kapalaran, Tangub City, with her family. She is 35 years old and the mother of eight children. Her husband is a farmer. Their main source of income is a store that she runs, selling goods in their community. Her husband has been cultivating their own farm for many years. Recently, she took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she had joined the year before, in the amount of 10,000 PHP. A portion will be used to buy fertilizer, and a portion will be used to buy grocery items for resale. She hopes to have an abundant harvest, to earn more income and to be able to save a portion to cover the of her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 43 years old, married, and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She has run a general store to earn a living for two years, while her husband has worked on their own farm. She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used to buy more items, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, for sale. In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC, and it has helped to improve her ability to engage in another line of business, buying and selling scrap. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy more scrap for sale. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and able to save a portion of her earnings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello my name is Juana, I am 48 years old and have been married for the last 30 years, I live with my husband and we have three teenage children. We have a pizza restaurant with three employees, I work every day from 5 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. Usually I sell pizzas at schools and in the streets of Iztapalapa. We are beginning to be successful in part because we have a very traditional concept of pizza.

I will use this credit to buy a bigger oven. With this new oven I will be able to supply increased orders that I've had lately. Also I will use a part of the loan to buy flour, cheese, pepperoni, ham, pineapple and soda cans. My biggest accomplishment in life is that my children respect me and also admire me. My challenge is to make my business grow.

loans.use: To buy a larger pizza oven and ingredients

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello I am Eduardo, I am 43 years old. When I was 13 years old I started working as a wood carver, when I was 25 I changed my job category to the glass-blowing business. Since I was a child I have always worked to improve my living conditions, 9 years ago I started designing glass figures and selling them at social events to earn more money. I will use this credit to start a new business; I want to produce wooden boxes.

This loan is an opportunity to grow my business and also to obtain financial stability. I am a responsible person who likes to make payments on time. I think that a debt implies a commitment.

loans.use: to start a new business producing wooden boxes

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en: The Winangun Sari group is made up of six men who are neighbors in the village in Penebel, in the middle part of Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 21,000,000 IDR, and each member will receive 3,500,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these men's common interest in raising pigs in order to supplement their family incomes, and out of their interest in education regarding the best practices for pig-raising. This is their fifth loan from MUK. I Nengah is the head of the Winangun Sari group. He is married and has one child. His wife earns money as a farmer. I Nengah will use his loan to buy superior piglets. He plans to sell the piglets after five months of fattening. With the increase in household income, he hopes to be able to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 5 to 20. She describes herself as trustworthy and straightforward. She operates an M-pesa shop, where she offers M-pesa services, i.e., withdrawing and depositing money. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an accessible area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of float for the business and the illiteracy of her customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add float, i.e. money for clients to withdraw. Her business goal is to put up more businesses within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable life. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open another M-pesa branch.

loans.use: add float (money for clients to withdraw).

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah resides in the Kitale area of the North Rift region. She is married and has four children, of whom three are of schoolgoing age. She has practiced farming for thirteen years. Her primary source of income is from selling maize, beans and milk. She wants to increase her milk production, and so she has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. This will help her get more income by increasing her milk production. The income will help educate her children with ease, and also improve their living standards. The major challenges she faces are unfavorable climate change and diseases. In five years’ time, she will have improved her farming activities. Stellah appreciates the support Juhudi Kilimo has given her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Atiya's Group

texts.en: Atiya is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Atiya, as a member of a two-person lending group, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Atiya is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's  rickshaw.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Edgar, I am 25 years old. I have been a butcher for most of my life. I learned from my father everything I know about the butchery business; 10 years ago I became independent. I always offer to my customers the best service and the best products.

With this credit I will be able to remodel my butcher shop and also to buy some tools like a saw, which will allow me to work faster. I like to make my payments on time because I know that if I am responsible I will have more opportunities in the future.

My biggest accomplishment is to be independent and to own a car, my next goals are to grow my business and one day to have my own house.

loans.use: To refurbish his butcher shop

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en: Edina, who is in her early 30s, is married and has three children who are still going to school. She has been running a beauty salon for one year. She works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to open a fruit and vegetable business, and she bought more and better quality salon equipment. She used the profit to buy a bed with a mattress, to help her husband to pay school fees, and to cover household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes to receive a loan to restock the salon. She dreams of building her own house. Edina will share this loan with her loan group, Mzimuni, which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to replace out-of-stock beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam, aged 50, is a single mother with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past year, she has operated a business selling second-hand clothes at retail to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces a major challenge in high costs of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a clothing shop in the future. With the loan that she is requesting, of KES 30,000, she wants to buy bales of clothes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello my name is Juana, I am 67 years old and I am a mother of 5 adult children. I have been a merchant of household items for most of my life. I live in Mexico City in a neighborhood called Iztapalapa.

I will use this credit to purchase merchandise such as quilts, blankets, blenders, toasters and dishes. With this credit I will be able to deliver orders to my customers on time. My biggest accomplishment is to be financially independent and my main challenge is to have a better life. 

I think that if you work hard nothing is impossible, that's why I always have the initiative to overcome obstacles. I am a responsible person who believes in fulfilling commitments. In the past I acquired many loans and I have never been late on my payments.

loans.use: To buy quilts, bedspreads and other home products to sell door to door

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres y hermana, el se dedica a realizar trabajos por computadora y por la noche va a la Facultad, está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de Ingeniería  Comercial.
Cuando termine su carrera quiere  trabajar en su profesión, y por medio de ello ayudar a su familia y ayudar de una mejor manera con los ingresos de la casa. Es un joven con gran espíritu de superación.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención, ya que el día a día en la facultad es muy costoso y quiere seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Diego is 26 years old and lives with his parents and sister.  He works with a computer and attends school in the evenings, where he is in his fourth year of study as a commercial engineer.

When he completes his studies, he wants to work in his profession and help his family more with the household income.  He is a young man with a great spirit for getting ahead.

He is asking for this loan so that he can pay his tuition, since classes are expensive and he wants to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna is from Kosovo and lives in a minority community in the western part of Kosovo. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old. They are very poor and don’t generate much income as she is a housewife and her husband works doing manual labor as a helper. When people need to carry or transport things, they hire and pay him to do it. This type of work serves as the main income for his family along with the small amount they receive as social help. 

They live in very bad conditions and they are unable to afford to have water installation inside the house. This means that their toilet is outside the house, which makes it difficult for them to live. Besides the toilet being outside, it is also very old and for this reason for the first time she is requesting a loan to renovate it. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family. Her goal is to find a regular, stable job and secure money for her children’s education. She appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the toilet

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with two children, both of whom finished school. Rachel lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Rachel sells potatoes and her customers are her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest challenge is transportation of her potatoes to her business place.
 
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and to use the rest of the money for transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes and to use the rest of the money for transportion costs

loans.name: Winners Group

texts.en:
Byarugaba, who is in his early 50s, is married with three children - one son, and two daughters. All of his children are still in school. He has been running a medical clinic for 15 years. He works from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This is Byarugaba's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania, and he wants to use it to buy better clinical equipment. He dreams of expanding his clinic.

Byarugaba will share this loan with his loan group, "Winners". The five members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy better clinical equipment.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a very hardworking man. He is a widower and has six children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Stephen operates a business selling eggs. He sells at the market to local customers. He dreams of expanding his business in the future, to run a wholesale shop.

With this loan of 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase trays of eggs for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Serfina

texts.en:
Serfina is a 48-year-old lady from Gem West-Homabay in Kenya. She supports seven people in her family. She is married to James, who is a small-scale farmer. She has two children who are 20 and five years old respectively.

She sells fish, a business which she has been engaged in for the last ten years. She gets a monthly income of 6000 KES. She is applying for her first loan with Kadet Ltd., which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and to pay school fees for her kid.

Her dream is to have a stable business so as to provide a stable income to her family.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 20 años, vive en Cerrito Benjamín Aceval, tiene 3 hermanos, 2 de ellos trabajan y viven con ella en la casa de sus padres quienes viven y trabajan en un establecimiento en el Chaco, le envían dinero para el pago de sus cuotas y recibe ayuda de sus hermanos pues es madre soltera. Aspira a tener un título universitario en la Carrera de Ciencias Agrarias pues le gusta el campo y quiere trabajar con sus padres o en algo mejor que le dé una vida digna a su familia.
Ella Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar clases y también sus cuotas y de esa forma poder aligerar un poco los gastos de sus estudios. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Irene is 20 years old and lives in Cerrito Benjamín Aceval.  She has three siblings, two of whom work and live her at her parents’ house.  They live and work at an establishment in Chaco and send her money so that she can pay her expenses and she gets help from her brothers because she is a single mom.  She wants to earn a university degree in agricultural sciences because she likes the fields and wants to work with her parents in something better that will provide her family with a dignified life.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay for classes and tuition and in this way be able to lighten her educational expense burden a little.  She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Fatumadoreen

texts.en:
Fatumadoreen is married and has three children, two attending school and one still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees

She has operated a motorcycle business for the past three years. She dreams of owning a bus in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase a new motorcycle for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Njia Ya Ng'ombe Group

texts.en:
Judith, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running a poultry business since 2005. She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Judith's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more chicks to increase her stock of poultry. She dreams of building her own house.

Judith with share this loan with her 13-member loan group "Njia Ya Ng'ombe". The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to increase her poultry stock.

loans.name: Severiana

texts.es:
Severiana tiene 41  años, es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí, vive en casa propia, es casada, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida es la única en su barrio, y es por eso que el esta yendo muy bien, también es funcionaria, limpiadora, como se puede ver es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de insumos para el negocio, como ser cerveza, gaseosas en general  ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar y obtener un mayor ingreso. Ella está muy contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de gran oportunidad.
texts.en:
Severiana is 41 years old and is from the city of Paraguarí. She is married and lives in her own house. She has a well-stocked store, the only one in her neighborhood, which is why it's going very well. She also works as a cleaner and civil servant, so it's clear that she is a very hard-working and committed person.

She hopes to use this loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, like beer and sodas, because that will allow her to grow and obtain a greater income. She is very happy that she is receiving this opportunity, and that it will be a great opportunity.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es de la ciudad de Ybycui, el es una persona muy trabajadora, tienen tres hermanos, y comenta que su meta es poder salir adelante, tener un buen sueldo y con ello poder ayudar a su familia.
Lo que le inspira a seguir creciendo es principalmente su familia, ya que ellos son su principal sostén y quiere darles lo mejor.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también las cuotas de su universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Marcos is from the city of Ybycui and he is a very hardworking person.  He has three siblings and says that his goal is to get ahead, have a good salary, and be able to help his family with it.  His family is what inspires him to continuing growing and he wants to provide the best for them.

He is asking for this loan so he can pay for his classes and university expenses.  He is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan with Kiva. She was able to generate more profits that she used to take care of her family.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Shadan Group

texts.en:
Shadan is a member of this female group from Iraq. Shadan is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. She is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Shadan has eight years of experience with her home-based sewing business activity. To improve the quality of services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions, she would like to buy a new sewing machine, iron and fabric. Shadan has a very good reputation in her region with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with the additional income and provide a better life for her children.

The story of Shadan and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, iron and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 33-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her whole family works in the same business, which involves packaging pieces of biscuits and then selling them in the market. Khalida's husband has a job in a biscuit factory. He buys cracked or small pieces of discarded biscuits at a very low rate. He brings these biscuits home to his wife. Khalida sorts according to size, quality, and type, and she categorizes the biscuits. Her daughter packs the cookies into polythene and then Khalida's husband sells the biscuits in the market. Each family member has different duties assigned to them for packaging the cookies.

Retailers like to buy these biscuits due to the low rates, and children also like to eat these biscuits. Shopkeepers have demanded more biscuits in order to increase their sales. For this reason, Khalida requested a loan of 40,000 Rs. from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, Khalida will buy more biscuits so that she can meet the demand of the retailers.

Khalida is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is a 24-year-old married man. He has two children, who are six years old and one year old respectively. He describes himself as a creative person.

Calvin operates a transport business, in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has had this business for three years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are members of the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as being a lack of capital. 

He will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy a bicycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 39-year-old man from Usenge, located in the Western part of Kenya. He is a single man and supports 5 people in his family. He is a fisherman, and has been doing this for the last 9 years. 

He gets a monthly income of about Kes 70,000. Martin has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more fishing nets so as to boost his business. He will plow the anticipated profits back into the business.

His dream is to start a new business and support himself.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself as a creative person. He operates a fish-selling business, in which he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are the general public.

He describes his biggest business challenge as being a lack of funds. He will use this loan of 20,000 KES to increase his stock of fish. His business goal is to grow within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a half year of her son's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman with two school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a salon business. She operates in the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With this loan of 30,000 KES she wants to purchase shampoos, hair weaves, braids, and hair chemicals for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, hair weaves, braids and hair chemicals for her business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 37 years old. He supports four people in his family. His wife Mary operates a tailoring shop, which brings some little income.

He is a planner and he draws plans for houses. He has been doing this for the last five years and gets a monthly income of 20000 KES. He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase office equipment.

His dream is to become a leader in construction in the region and take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy office equipment

loans.name: Anora

texts.en:
A young woman by the name of Anora, who is a widow, lives in a house which is in bad condition. She is 23 years old. Her husband was a kind man. She has a little daughter who is three years old. She is the owner of her business. She has been busy with this business more than five years. She grows potatoes and wheat. She has an additional business from animal husbandry. She began her business selling milk, kefir and sour cream. She must repair her house, which is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to repair her house. 

In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Sakher

texts.en: Sakher is 23 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his family, which consists of 9 members. He has 4 sisters and 2 brothers. Sakher is currently studying for his Bachelor of Earth and Environment Sciences, and is in his 4th year at Al-Bait University, which is near Mafraq. He is planning to continue his studies to be able to work in his field after graduation. As Sakher is currently facing financial problems, he is asking for a loan to be able to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his college semester fees

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and has three children that he supports who are between 11 and 4 years old.

George has a motorcycle which he has owned for some years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy another motorbike.

He hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another motor bike.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Jose is an entrepreneurial 53-year-old man. He is married and lives with his spouse. He is currently asking for a loan with the hope of buying agricultural inputs like fertilizers and fumigants. He wants to help the growth of his coffee crops, with the goal of keeping them in good condition while they grow, so that he obtains a good quality harvest.

The only challenge that this gentleman faces is a lack of money to continue growing his business. He depends on this business to support himself. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He doesn't have any other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR offered him the loan on better terms and at a much lower interest rate than he would have gotten from a bank.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de La Paz, aunque la vivienda no es de su propiedad.

Actualmente trabaja en transporte libre con su taxi, con esta actividad mantiene a su familia y cubre sus mínimas necesidades, la esposa instalo una pequeña pensión y cubre la alimentación ayudando de esta manera a su esposo, el crédito que solicita es para efectuar el mantenimiento de su auto ya que es su herramienta de trabajo principal,
texts.en:
Santiago is married, and he has two children.  He lives in the city of La Paz, but he does not own his house.

He currently works with Transport Libre with his taxi.  With this business activity he supports his family and covers their barest necessities.  His wife set up a small eatery, and it covers the food.  In this way she helps her husband.

The loan he is requesting is for maintenance on his auto because it is his main working tool.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and student son in the Lagodekhi district. Pridon is educated but is involved in agriculture and cultivates land where maize is grown. Pridon’s wife works as an accountant and gets a monthly salary. The couple works hard to provide their son with a good quality of education for progressing in life.

Pridon is requesting a loan from Credo to start an animal husbandry business and generate more income. He will use his loan to purchase pigs and cows. He will put the livestock in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. 

Pridon's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo for the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit, as they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

Pridon's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will increase the family income, and he will be able to improve their living conditions as well as pay his son’s tuition.

loans.use: to purchase cows and pigs for an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has a child. Rahim is the sole provider of the family.

He owns a small shop where he sells household electronics like microwaves, ovens, refrigerators and air-conditioners. He has long experience in this field since he used to work as an employee at a similar shop for several years. In 2012, Rahim established his own business and thanks to his wide experience in this field, he gained an excellent reputation and the respect of his clients.

Rahim is requesting a loan of $2,400. The aim of this loan is to install a sign for his shop and to renovate it to attract more customers. Rahim is aiming to grow his business and someday open another shop to increase his profits and provide his child with a strong career path and a good source of income.

loans.use: to install a sign for his shop and to renovate it.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 39-year-old Iraqi client, who is married and has two children. He owns a garage where he specializes in fixing all types of electrical problems related to engines. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Using updated electronics and modern ways to fix electrical problems of car engines has given Khaled a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Khaled is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his garage, as well as to purchase some assets. Khaled is aiming to grow his business and improve the quality of his work so that he may increase his profits. He intends to give his children a chance to continue their education and achieve advanced degrees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his garage and to purchase some assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Paula Yesenia

texts.es:
Paula es una joven de 24 años de edad la cual es comerciante y agricultora y de ella no depende nadie. En compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura: siembra maíz, frijol, café y en ocasiones a la cría y engorde de cerdos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo le cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Sus clientes son los dueños de bodegas y pulperías que se encuentran en la zona donde ella habita y en los alrededores.

Uno de los desafíos que las personas que se dedican a la agricultura tienen es la alza de los precios en cuanto a los insumos agrícolas que utilizan para dar asistencia técnica y mantenimiento a sus cultivos por lo cual ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero para poder comprar lo necesario y limpiar de plagas sus cosechas evitando que sean contagiadas con enfermedades entre otras.

Sus sueños es ver a sus hijos crecer y verlos convertidos en profesionales aunque en este momento no los tenga poderlos enviar a la universidad para que estudien carreras con futuro sean profesionales y poder fortalecer el patrimonio que hoy en día está formando junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Paula is a young woman of 24 years old. She is a merchant and farmer and has no dependents. She and her spouse work in agriculture; they plant corn, beans and coffee, and sometimes raise pigs. She completed primary education thanks to the support of her parents. 

Her customers are owners of local grocery stores and shops in the area where she lives and its surrounding communities.

One of the challenges that faces people who work in agriculture is the increasing cost of agricultural inputs that they use to grow and care for their crops. This is why Paula has asked for financial support from COMIXMUL, in order to buy necessary products and keep her crops clear of pests. This way she will prevent her crops from contaminating one another with diseases.

Her dreams are to see her children grow up and become professionals, even though she doesn't have any children yet. She dreams of being able to send her children to university so that they earn degrees and become professionals. She also hopes to build up the estate that she is currently working on alongside her spouse.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his daughter's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her grandson's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years old and single. He lives in Naivasha, Kenya.

Simon has been farming for the past 14 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer and seedlings to use on his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to be a leading farmer in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Christine Ndinda

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old and from Naivasha. She is married and has two children who are 2 months old and 9 years old.

Christine has a call centre business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy air time to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a bigger business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy air time to add to her stock

loans.name: Laith

texts.en: Laith is 21 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his family, which consists of six members. He has two brothers and one sister. His father is retired from the military and is working as a taxi driver, and his mother is a teacher. Laith is currently studying for his Bachelor of Accounting degree, in his third year. He also works as a private teacher. He is planning to expand his studies and get a Master's degree after graduation. Now he is facing a financial crisis, so he needs a loan to be able to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: La Poma Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios microempresarios exitosos uno de ellos es Isidra mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 18 y 14 años. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de dulcería desde hace 20 años. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan a ir a comprar la materia que necesita para elaborar sus productos. Hace 15  años es cliente de la institución. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de materia prima  como azúcar, aceite, canela,  harina, papaya, vasos descartables, cucharas. Antonio hombre de 39 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería y Rosa mujer de 44 años de edad y se dedica al negocio de crianza y venta de gallinas y flores.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who are successful micro-entrepreneurs.  One of them is Isidra, 43.  She's married and has four children, ages 22, 20, 18, and 14.

Isidra's business for the last 20 years has been making and selling sweets.  Her older children help her buy the supplies she needs to make her products.  She has been a client of the institution for 15 years.

She'll invest the loan in buying ingredients such as sugar, oil, cinnamon, flour, papaya, disposable cups, and spoons.

Antonio, 30, has a grocery store.  Rosa, 44, raises and sells chickens and flowers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Ariadne Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Sandra mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 12, 11 y 5 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos zafiros, prendas laminadas y fritanga desde hace 5 años. Sus productos los vende en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes de damas, de varón, cremas corporales y faciales, sandalias, ropa de varón y de mujer como pantalones, camisetas, camisas, blusas, etc. Sugey mujer de 22 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida, refrescos, gaseosas y Jessica mujer de 23 años y su negocio es la venta de camisas, ropa interior y chinelas.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Sandra, a 32-year-old woman who is married with three children who are 12, 11 and 5 years old.  For five years her business has been the sale of Zafiro cosmetics, laminated jewelry and fast food and she sells her products in her community.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics like perfumes for women and men, body and face creams, sandals and clothing for men and women like pants, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, etc.  

Sugey is a 22-year-old woman who has a business selling food and soft drinks.  Jessica is a 23-year-old woman who has a business selling shirts, underwear and flip flops.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics by catalogue such as perfumes for women and men, body and face creams, sandals and clothing for men and women like pants, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Las Lindas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gema mujer 26 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo solicita para comprar zapatos de mujer, zapatos de varón, de niño, ropa íntima. Vilma mujer de 32 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon, Zelsa, Vogue y bisutería. Y Jennifer mujer de 24 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de bisutería, zapatos y bolsos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Gema, a single, 26 year old woman. her business is selling clothes, shoes and perfume. She has been doing this for 4 years. The loan she is asking for is to buy women's shoes, men's shoes, children's shoes and underwear. Vilmais 32 and her business is selling Avon, Zelsa, and Vogue cosmetics and jewelry. Jennifer is 24 and her business is selling jewelry, shoes and purses.

loans.use: to invest in buying women's shoes, men's shoes, children's shoes, and underwear.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es  Yamileth mujer 38 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos menores de 13 y 10 años. Su negocio es la ropa interior desde hace 6 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años. El crédito lo requiere para invertir en comprar ropa como pantalones de varón, de mujer, camisas, blusas, bikinis, brasieres, blúmer, medias, etc. Martha mujer de 56 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería y Oneyda mujer de 30 años de edad se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida y gaseosas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is 38-year-old Yamileth.  She has a partner and two children, aged 13 and 10 years old.  Yamileth has had a business selling underwear for six years, and has been a member of the communal bank for that same amount of time.  She needs this loan to invest in clothes, such as men's and women's trousers, shirts, blouses, bikinis, bras, panties, socks, and more.  Martha is 56 years old and has a grocery store, while Oneyda is 30 years old and has a business selling food and fizzy drinks.

loans.use: to buy new clothes such as men's and women's trousers, shirts, blouses, bikinis, bras, panties, socks, and more.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old and is from Nyandarua. He is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 20 years old.
